Text:
"Dear Galactic Citizen! 

The Coruscant Financial Bureau is a non-profit establishment that provides ratings of various organisations and corporations to the galactic community with the goal to improve cooperation and coordination between galactic governments and other entities. 
With recently acquired assets
column4: you are now a subject for registration within Coruscant Financial Bureau. All documentation will be generated automatically and will be kept up to date with your future endeavors. Soon you will get a notification on the first assessment of your assets
column5: don't miss it! \nDepending on your CFB rating
column6: you may be viewed differently by factions
column7: so be aware of your current rating
column8:
which can be one of the following: 

Privateer - if less than 150 mil. assets cost \(no rep. penalty\)
Private Company - at 150 mil. total assets cost \(10% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Organization - at 300 mil. total assets cost \(20% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Corporation - at 600 mil. total assets cost \(50% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Major Faction - at 1 billion total assets cost \(80% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Empire - at 1.5 billion total assets cost \(120% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)

The rules for calculations are following: 
-Assets cheaper than 50k Cr are ignored
-Traders
column9:
miners and Auxiliary ships are counted as 50% of their credit cost
-Production Station Modules are counted as 80% of their credit cost
-Non-Production Station Modules are counted as 35% of their credit cost
-Shipyard and Wharf Modules are counted as 70% of their credit cost
-All other assets are counted as 100% of their credit cost
"

Text:
"Dear Galactic Citizen!

The Coruscant Financial Bureau is a non-profit establishment that provides ratings of various organisations and corporations to the galactic community with the goal to improve cooperation and coordination between galactic governments and other entities. 
With recently acquired assets
column4: you are now a subject for registration within Coruscant Financial Bureau. All documentation will be generated automatically and will be kept up to date with your future endeavors. Soon you will get a notification on the first assessment of your assets
column5: don't miss it!\n\nDepending on your CFB rating
column6: you may be viewed differently by factions
column7: so be aware of your current rating
column8:
which can be one of the following:

Privateer - if less than 150 mil. assets cost \(no rep. penalty\)
Private Company - at 150 mil. total assets cost \(10% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Organization - at 300 mil. total assets cost \(20% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Corporation - at 600 mil. total assets cost \(50% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Major Faction - at 1 billion total assets cost \(80% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Empire - at 1.5 billion total assets cost \(120% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)

The rules for calculations are following:
 - Assets cheaper than 50k Cr are ignored
 - Traders
column9:
miners and Auxiliary ships are counted as 50% of their credit cost
 - Production Station Modules are counted as 80% of their credit cost
 - Non-Production Station Modules are counted as 35% of their credit cost
 - Shipyard and Wharf Modules are counted as 70% of their credit cost
 - All other assets are counted as 100% of their credit cost
"

"(Description)It took considerable effort
column4: but we were finally able to get two opposing parties to sit down to negotiations aimed at resolving their conflict. Unfortunately
column5: a third party has become aware of our plans
column6: and is trying very hard to make sure these talks never take place. One of the delegations involved in these talks was attacked
column7: and now their main dignitary is stranded on one of our stations. If you can ensure that his ship makes it to the talks
column8: you will be paid handsomely."

"We are continuously updating our security protocols and defensive installations to stay ahead in the galactic arms race. Due to their volatile and fickle nature
column4: tracker mines have often caused us problems in this regard. Last time
column5: we hired an especially eager contractor
column6: who insisted on a 'hands on' approach. Halfway through the process
column7: they realised their mistake and
column8: in trying to revert the software update
column9: accidentally reset the mines' friend-or-foe recognition. We are legally obligated to remove the malfunctioning mines and would like to outsource this task to pilots of all skill levels. If you are up for it
column10: please also make sure not to damage our former contractor's ship
column11: as his demise would unnecessarily strain our insurance."

"Sith Holocron Transfered"
"Celebrations of the Empire's fall at Endor takes place throughout the galaxy
column4: including bonfires in Bright Tree Village
column5: gatherings on Cloud City
column6: a rally on Naboo
column7: and parades on Tatooine. However
column8: celebrations on Coruscant lead to a crackdown at Monument Plaza
column9: sparking the Coruscant Civil War."

"Z-95 Headhunter"

"The Z-95 Headhunter was a starfighter designed jointly by the Incom and SubPro Corporations years before the Invasion of Naboo. Its resilience and longevity meant it remained a staple of private and low-priority government starfighter forces long after its introduction."

"The Z-95 Headhunter was a starfighter designed jointly by the Incom and SubPro Corporations years before the Invasion of Naboo.\n\nIts resilience and longevity meant it remained a staple of private and low-priority government starfighter forces long after its introduction."
"The RZ-1 A-wing interceptor
column4: also known as the RZ-1 A-wing starfighter
column5: was a wedge-shaped starfighter manufactured by Kuat Systems Engineering
column6: which took design inspiration from the Republic starfighters of the Clone Wars. Based on the original R-22 prototype
column7: the early Rebel movement adopted the fighter for service against the Galactic Empire"

Text: "The RZ-1 A-wing interceptor is a wedge-shaped starfighter manufactured by Kuat Systems Engineering
column4: which took design inspiration from the Republic starfighters of the Clone Wars.\n\As with Incom's X-wing fighter
column5: the RZ-1 began life as a prototype for the Imperial Navy
column6: but was rejected in favor of the TIE series. It found new purpose in the early Rebel Alliance
column7: and its high maneuverability and concussion missiles allowed it to compete with Imperial fighters."

Text: "The BTL-A4 Y-wing starfighter
column4: also referred to simply as the Y-wing fighter or Y-wing
column5: was a series of multi-role starfighter-bombers manufactured by Koensayr Manufacturing."

Text: "The BTL-A4 Y-wing starfighter
column4: also referred to simply as the Y-wing bomber
column5: is part of a series of multi-role starfighter/bombers manufactured by Koensayr Manufacturing. The original Clone Wars model
column6: the BTL-B
column7: was so successful that Koensayr began producing additional variants.\n\nThe BTL-A4 variant was most famously used by the Rebel Alliance
column8: who had to steal as many as possible from scrapping facilities."

Text: "The BTL Y-wing starfighter
column4: also referred to simply as the Y-wing fighter or Y-wing
column5: was a series of multi-role starfighter-bombers manufactured by Koensayr Manufacturing. This is a scout variant with additional sensors in place of missile storage and launchers."

Text: "In war
column4: information is vital to the success of any mission. For the Rebel Alliance and New Republic
column5: much of this information comes from ships like the BTL-A4 Y-wing Longprobe. The seat for the weapons officer was removed to allow for advanced scanners and other equipment."

Text: "The A/SF-01 B-wing starfighter
column4: also designated as the A/SF-01 B-wing assault starfighter
column5: more commonly referred to as the B-wing
column6: was a heavily armed Rebel Alliance single-pilot starfighter and bomber manufactured by Slayn and Korpil. Featuring a radical design where the ship rotated around the cockpit
column7: the B-wing was a challenge to master even for experienced pilots
column8: but its impressive weaponry allowed for devastating attacks on capital ships and ground targets."

Text: "The A/SF-01 B-wing starfighter
column4: more commonly referred to as the B-wing
column5: is a heavily armed Rebel Alliance single-pilot starfighter and bomber manufactured by Slayn and Korpil.\n\nFeaturing a radical design where the ship rotated around the cockpit
column6: the B-wing was a challenge to master even for experienced pilots
column7: but its impressive weaponry allowed for devastating attacks on capital ships and ground targets."

Text: "The E-7 E-wing multi-role starfighter
column4: also called the E-wing escort starfighter
column5: was a single-pilot starfighter developed by FreiTek Inc. It was notable for being the first fighter designed entirely under the support of the New Republic. Despite many issues in development
column6: it has become a staple of the New Republic Defence Fleet. Though some models did not mount missile launchers
column7: this production model features two."

Text: "The E-7 E-wing multi-role starfighter is a single-pilot starfighter developed by FreiTek Inc.\n\nIt was notable for being the first fighter designed entirely under the support of the New Republic. Despite many issues in development
column4: it has become a staple of the New Republic Defence Fleet."

Text: "X-wing T65B NRL"
"X-wing T65B \(NRL\)"
"X-wing"
"X-wing T65B"
"X-wing NRL"
"X-wing T65B"
"The T-65 X-wing is one of the most iconic starfighters in the galaxy. Descended from such fighters as the Z-95 Headhunter and the ARC-170 starfighter
column4: the designers at Incom intended to build a well-rounded snubfighter with no exploitable weaknesses. \n\nOriginally intended for use by the Imperial Navy
column5: Incom sold the design to the Alliance to Restore the Republic after the Galactic Empire instead chose Sienar's TIE series as their mainline fighter.\n\nThe T-65B X-wing starfighter was a modified version of the standard X-wing starfighter produced by Incom Corporation. They were faster
column6: more updated fighters compared to their predecessors."

Text: "The T-65 X-wing is one of the most iconic starfighters in the galaxy. Descended from such fighters as the Z-95 Headhunter and the ARC-170 starfighter
column4: the designers at Incom intended to build a well-rounded snubfighter with no exploitable weaknesses.\n\nOriginally intended for use by the Imperial Navy
column5: Incom sold the design to the Alliance to Restore the Republic after the Galactic Empire instead chose Sienar's TIE series as their mainline fighter.\n\nThe T-65B X-wing starfighter was a modified version of the standard X-wing starfighter produced by Incom Corporation. They were faster
column6: more updated fighters compared to their predecessors."

Text: "The Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft
column4: also known simply as a Firespray-class interceptor
column5: is a patrol ship originally designed by Kuat Systems Engineering. Originally intended for use by the Republic Correctional Authority
column6: Firesprays found their way into the hands of many law enforcement agencies
column7: private interests
column8: pirates
column9: and bounty hunters. Its distinctive design lands horizontally on its engines
column10: but rotates to a vertical configuration in flight.\n\nThe most famous of these ships was Slave 1
column11: owned by the bounty hunters Jango and Boba Fett."

Text: "The Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft is a patrol ship originally designed by Kuat Systems Engineering. Originally intended for use by the Republic Correctional Authority

column7: and bounty hunters. Its distinctive design lands horizontally on its engines

column9: owned by the bounty hunters Jango and Boba Fett."

Text: "The TIE/LN starfighter
column4: or TIE/line starfighter
column5: simply known as the TIE Fighter or T/F
column6: is the standard Imperial starfighter seen in massive numbers throughout most of the Galactic Civil War and onward. Colloquially
column7: Rebel pilots referred to the craft as ""eyeballs."". This is a modification outfitted with an auxiliary shield generator."

Text: "The TIE/LN starfighter
column4: or TIE/line starfighter
column5: simply known as the TIE Fighter or T/F
column6: is the standard Imperial starfighter seen in massive numbers throughout most of the Galactic Civil War and onward. Colloquially
column7: Rebel pilots referred to the craft as ""eyeballs."".\n\nTo many space pilots
column8: TIE Fighters
column9: rather than the Star Destroyers
column10: symbolize the true might of the Empire. Few ships ever face a Star Destroyer
column11: but TIE Fighters are everywhere.\n\nThis variant is outfitted with an auxiliary low-power shield generator."

Text: "TIE Fighter Vanguard or TIE/LNv is the modification outfitted with regular shield generator slot and hyperdrive used by escorts for high ranking officers."
"TIE Fighter Vanguard or TIE/LNv is a modification outfitted with a regular shield generator and hyperdrive
column4: often used by escorts for high ranking officers."

Text: "Mining Guild TIE Fighter or TIE/mg is the modification of TIE Fighter with removed frontal panels for improved visibility in asteroid fields."
"Mining Guild TIE Fighter or TIE/mg is a modification of TIE Fighter with removed frontal panels for improved visibility in asteroid fields."
"The TIE/IN starfighter
column4: simply known as the TIE Interceptor or T/I
column5: was a TIE Series starfighter used by the Galactic Empire. The TIE Interceptor was identifiable by its arrow-shaped solar collection panels
column6: a distinct difference from the hexagonal solar arrays of its predecessor
column7: the TIE Fighter. The Interceptor was one of the fastest starfighters in the galaxy at its prime
column8: nearly rivalling the Alliance's RZ-1 A-wing interceptor. Due to their speed
column9: distinct shape
column10: and narrow profile in comparison to the TIE/ln starfighter (which was nicknamed ""eyeball"")
column11: TIE Interceptors came to be referred to occasionally as ""squints"" by enemy pilots. This is a late modification outfitted with a shield generator."

Text: "The TIE/IN starfighter
column4: simply known as the TIE Interceptor or T/I
column5: was a TIE Series starfighter used by the Galactic Empire. The TIE Interceptor was identifiable by its arrow-shaped solar collection panels

column7: the TIE Fighter.\n\nThe Interceptor was one of the fastest starfighters in the galaxy at its prime

column9: distinct shape
column10: and narrow profile in comparison to the TIE/ln starfighter (which was nicknamed ""eyeball"")
column11: TIE Interceptors came to be referred to occasionally as ""squints"" by enemy pilots.\n\nThis is a late modification outfitted with a shield generator."

Text: "Part of a line of experimental models based on the TIE series
column4: Sienar Fleet Systems'  TIE/x1
column5: most commonly referred to as the TIE Advanced
column6: came standard with both a hyperdrive and shield deflectors. While the Advanced model was never put into full-scale production
column7: many Imperial ace pilots were known to choose it as their fighter of choice. One well known-- and greatly feared-- pilot was Darth Vader himself
column8: who personally customised his TIE-x1 to suit his flying skills."

Text: "Part of a line of experimental models based on the TIE series

Text: "The TIE/D Defender
column4: commonly known as the TIE Defender or T/D
column5: was a high-performance TIE Series starfighter developed for the Imperial Navy by Sienar Fleet Systems in a project overseen by Grand Admiral Demetrius Zaarin shortly before the Battle of Endor. Representing a shift in starfighter design from previous TIE models
column6: the ship featured a hyperdrive as well as deflector shields to allow it to operate independently of Imperial capital ships. The ship's speed and agility
column7: combined with its arsenal of four laser cannons
column8: two ion cannons and two warhead launchers made it arguably the most advanced starfighter available at the time."

Text: "The TIE/D Defender
column4: commonly known as the TIE Defender or T/D
column5: was a high-performance TIE Series starfighter developed for the Imperial Navy by Sienar Fleet Systems in a project overseen by Grand Admiral Demetrius Zaarin shortly before the Battle of Endor.\n\nRepresenting a shift in starfighter design from previous TIE models
column6: the ship featured a hyperdrive as well as deflector shields to allow it to operate independently of Imperial capital ships.\n\nThis ship's speed and agility
column7: combined with its arsenal of four laser cannons
column8: two ion cannons and two warhead launchers made it arguably the most advanced starfighter available at the time."

Text: "The UT-60D U-wing starfighter/support craft
column4: also known as the UT-60D
column5: U-wing or UT-60D U-wing Troop Transport
column6: is a transport/gunship model manufactured by Incom Corporation. It was used primarily by the Rebel Alliance to drop soldiers into battle and provide cover for them
column7: using both its forward guns and optionally-mounted infantry weapons at the loading doors."

Text: "The UT-60D U-wing starfighter/support craft is a transport/gunship model manufactured by Incom Corporation.\n\nThough it was never fully produced during the Imperial era due to the nationalization of Incom
column4: many fell into the hands of the Rebel Alliance
column5: who used them as light transports and dropships."

Text: "The TIE/sa bomber
column4: simply known as the TIE bomber or T/B
column5: was a larger
column6: less manoeuvrable TIE starfighter used for destroying large starships and pinpoint-precision bombing. The ""sa"" in the TIE bomber's designation stood for ""surface assault."""

Text: "The TIE/sa bomber
column4: simply known as the TIE bomber
column5: was a larger
column6: less manoeuvrable TIE starfighter used for destroying large starships and pinpoint-precision bombing.\n\nThe ""sa"" in the TIE bomber's designation stood for ""surface assault."" Like many other starfighters in the TIE series
column7: it is unshielded and expendable
column8: intended for swarm tactics where the survival of a ship or pilot was less important than the success of the mission."

Text: "The TIE/sh shuttle
column4: also known as the TIE Command Shuttle
column5: was a model of armoured shuttle manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for the Galactic Empire. It was designed to transport Imperial officers plus a squad of stormtroopers between Imperial-class Star Destroyers."

Text: "The TIE/sh shuttle is a model of armoured shuttle manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for the Galactic Empire.\n\nThis shuttle was designed to transport Imperial officers plus a squad of stormtroopers between Imperial-class Star Destroyers."
"The Sheathipede-class transport shuttle
column4: also known as the Sheathipede-class shuttles and as the Neimoidian escort shuttle
column5: was a short-range transport used by the Trade Federation and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Some of these shuttles had their cockpits removed and replaced with automated pilots
column6: and others were heavily modified with additional shielding or weaponry."

Text: "The Sheathipede-class transport shuttle was a short-range transport used by the Trade Federation and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Some of these shuttles had their cockpits removed and replaced with automated pilots
column4: and others were heavily modified with additional shielding or weaponry."

Text: "The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict
column4: the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production. General Grievous flew a customised Belbullab-22 named the Soulless One."

Text: "The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict
column4: the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production.\n\nGeneral Grievous flew a customised Belbullab-22 named the Soulless One."

Text: "The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict
column4: the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production. This is a lightweight scout version."

Text: "The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict
column4: the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production.\n\nThis is a lightweight scout version."

Text: "Probe droids (also known as probots or recon droids) were droids that were specifically designed and programmed to perform reconnaissance duties. These units were often dispatched by various space navies to gather information from a variety of different locations
column4: reporting anything of significance as defined by specific preprogrammed protocols."

Text: "Probe droids (also known as probots or recon droids) are droids that are specifically designed and programmed to perform reconnaissance duties. These units were often dispatched by various space navies to gather information from a variety of different locations
column4: reporting anything of significance as defined by specific preprogrammed protocols."

Text: "The M12-L Kimogila heavy fighter was designed as part of the collaboration between MandalMotors and the Hutt Cartel. Officially an upgrade to the G1-M4-C Dunelizard
column4: the Kimogila is heavily armed and armoured
column5: and serves as a long-range
column6: multipurpose ship. Though originally intended for use by the Hutts
column7: it also saw use by pirates
column8: mercenaries
column9: and some planetary defence forces."

Text: "Hyena-class bombers
column4: also known as Hyena-class Droid Bombers
column5: were droid starfighters manufactured by Baktoid Armour Workshop. They were designed for heavy ordnance bombing runs. Based on Vulture droid designs
column6: Hyena bombers had wider and sturdier hulls with huge wings to gain stability during flight."

Text: "Hyena-class bombers
column4: also known as Hyena-class Droid Bombers
column5: were droid starfighters manufactured by Baktoid Armour Workshop. They were designed for heavy ordnance bombing runs.\n\nBased on Vulture droid designs
column6: Hyena bombers had wider and sturdier hulls with huge wings to gain stability during flight. However
column7: they were still relatively fragile
column8: and intended for use in swarms to negate this."

Text: "The HWK-290 was a light freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation during the decades leading up to the Battle of Naboo
column4: in an effort to break into a new market for fast
column5: small cargo ships. Unlike YT-series of ships for tramp captains
column6: the Hawk line was aimed at more upscale clients
column7: like wealthy merchants and noble politicians. The series saw modest success
column8: but never reached the amount of sales of YT-series
column9: and was discontinued during the Clone Wars to make way for military production."

Text: "The HWK-290 was a light freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation during the decades leading up to the Battle of Naboo
column4: in an effort to break into a new market for fast

Text: "The BTA-NR2 Y-wing starfighter is a variant of the Y-wing starfighter produced by Koensayr Manufacturing and used by the New Republic. It was designed to emulate the appearance and customisable nature of the BTL-A4 Y-wing flown extensively by the Rebel Alliance
column4: though it sacrifices some durability for speed
column5: agility
column6: and a larger ordnance bay."

Text: "The BTA-NR2 Y-wing starfighter is a variant of the Y-wing starfighter produced by Koensayr Manufacturing and used by the New Republic.\n\nIt was designed to emulate the appearance and customisable nature of the BTL-A4 Y-wing flown extensively by the Rebel Alliance
column4: though it sacrifices some durability for speed

column6: and a larger ordnance bay."

Text: "The Emperor's Royal Guard TIE/IN starfighter was a specially modified version of the TIE/IN interceptor. These TIE Interceptors were flown only by Emperor Palpatine's Royal Guard."
"The Emperor's Royal Guard TIE/IN starfighter was a specially modified version of the TIE/IN interceptor. They are faster
column4: more heavily armed and shielded
column5: and feature a hyperdrive.\n\nThese TIE Interceptors were flown only by Emperor Palpatine's Royal Guard."

Text: "The Eta-2 Actis-class interceptor was a Republic starfighter used late in the Clone Wars
column4: that shared design elements with the Republic's Delta-7 and Delta-7B starfighters
column5: as well as the TIE fighters of the later Galactic Empire. This model is a modernised version that is also equipped with a hyperdrive. While these modifications improve the vessels' overall versatility
column6: they also make it a bit slower."

Text: "The Delta-7B Aethersprite-class interceptor was commissioned just before the outbreak of the Clone Wars. The starfighter was considered highly advanced at the time of its creation and carried sophisticated equipment
column4: but it was expensive to produce. The 7B version is modified with additional shields and weaponry compared to baseline Delta-7 models used by the Jedi."

Text: "The Delta-7B Aethersprite-class interceptor was commissioned just before the outbreak of the Clone Wars. The starfighter was considered highly advanced at the time of its creation and carried sophisticated equipment
column4: but it was expensive to produce.\n\nThe 7B version is modified with additional shields and weaponry compared to baseline Delta-7 models used by the Jedi."

Text: "The Starchaser is a solid starfighter capable of competing with the Z-95 Headhunter. It had a good balance of speed
column4: weapons and durability
column5: but lacks heavy armour or internal hull bracing
column6: which often makes it vulnerable to well-placed enemy hits."

Text: "The Starchaser is a multi-role starfighter once built by Hoersch-Kessel Drive
column4: inc. Originally intended to compete with the Z-95 Headhunter
column5: it has a good balance of speed and weaponry
column6: but its poor maneuverability and lack of heavy armor leave it vulnerable to more modern and nimble fighters."

Text: "The Theta-class T-2c shuttle
column4: also known as the Theta-class shuttle
column5: was a model of shuttle used by the Galactic Republic
column6: and later the Galactic Empire. It was designed as part of the Abecederian line of shuttles manufactured by Cygnus Spaceworks and later Sienar Fleet Systems
column7: and saw use by Chancellor
column8: and later Emperor
column9: Palpatine."

column5: and saw use by Chancellor

Text: "The Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter
column4: also known simply as the ARC-170 starfighter
column5: is a heavy-duty model of starfighter used by the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars and was considered the latest in fighter technology. Jointly manufactured by Incom Corporation and Subpro
column6: it was eventually modified to compete with modern fighters. Its tail gunner turret was replaced by a slaved ion cannon
column7: similar to the Y-wing."

Text: "The Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter

Text: "The droid tri-fighter is a model of droid starfighter that was specifically designed to engage and excel in heavy dogfighting. Its brain is housed in the central gyroscopic core
column4: and its arms carry laser cannons and missile launchers. It was used extensively by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars
column5: where it rivalled the Republic's starfighters."

Text: "The Kihraxz is a starfighter developed by TransGalMeg Industries. Though vaguely modelled after the popular design of Incom's X-wing starfighter
column4: few Kihraxz fighters were the same due to heavy customisation and after-market kits. Though originally intended for use by the Black Sun crime syndicate
column5: this fighter ended up in the hands of various pirates
column6: mercenaries
column7: and other spacers during the Galactic Civil War."

Text: "The TIE Phantom is the result of a development project led by Grand Admiral Martio Batch and is equipped with both deflector shields and a hyperdrive
column4: along with a technology not seen for decades — a  cloaking device."

Text: "The TIE Phantom is the result of a development project led by Grand Admiral Martio Batch and is equipped with both deflector shields and a hyperdrive
column4: along with a rare cloaking device.\n\nModels and schematics sold to third-party vendors conspicuously remove the stealth device
column5: however the mount for the device remains
column6: so intrepid spacers may be able to replace it for less-than-legal activity."

Text: "Initially the TIE Fury competed with TIE Defender as another actively developed project. While TIE Defender was selected for future development and implementation in fleet doctrine
column4: the TIE Fury was reworked into an /H heavy variant with increased missile capacity and additional ion cannons compared to TIE Defender. It is usually used by elite forces to quickly suppress larger vessels. Due to limited supply this ship is not freely available on the market."

Text: "Developed alongside the TIE Defender
column4: the TIE Fury was an early concept bid for an Imperial TIE heavy fighter. With the success of the Defender
column5: the Fury’s development was mothballed and it never left its prototype test phase. Despite being heavily armed with four ion cannons
column6: two laser cannons
column7: and four ordinance launchers
column8: the Fury was regarded as a failure due to its low speeds and low maneuverability. Coupled with a higher production cost than even the TIE Defender
column9: it was deemed impractical to utilize the TIE Fury even in specialized roles.\n\nDeep Space traders have reported seeing ships matching the TIE Fury
column10: though these reports remain unverified. The Corporate Sector Authority
column11: Galactic Empire
column12: and New Republic have issued warnings to traders traveling near the Stenos system
column13: and urges any ship that detects unidentified vessels to withdraw from the area immediately."

Text: "The T-65XJ-3/5 X-wing starfighter is a successor to T-65B model
column4: tangential to the T-70 development. Though it sacrifices some manoeuvrability compared to its predecessor
column5: it is faster
column6: more durable
column7: and has a larger ordnance bay."

Text: "The Porax-38 starfighter is a tough
column4: heavy starfighter used by the Utapauan government during the Clone Wars. It has since been updated and can be found in some militia forces. The cockpit was updated on this model to accommodate many different species."

Text: "The Porax-38 starfighter is a tough
column4: heavy starfighter used by the Utapauan government during the Clone Wars.\n\nIt has since been updated and can be found in some militia forces. The cockpit was updated on this model to accommodate many different species."

Text: "The Porax-38-B starfighter is a modified heavy fighter used by the Utapauan government during Clone Wars. This is an upgraded model that is commonly used by Outer Rim pirates and Mandalorians
column4: that sacrifices speed and manoeuvrability for additional armour and weaponry."

Text: "The Porax-38-B starfighter is a modified heavy fighter used by the Utapauan government during Clone Wars.\n\nThis is an upgraded model that is commonly used by Outer Rim pirates and Mandalorians

Text: "The Fang-class starfighter
column4: also known as the Fang fighter
column5: is a starfighter manufactured by SoroSuub Corporation and MandalMotors and used by the Mandalorians. The Fang fighter is a fast and highly manoeuvrable starship designed specifically for space combat."

Text: "The Fang-class starfighter
column4: also known as the Fang fighter

Text: "The Scarab-class Starfighter was developed for the Trade Federation prior to its invasion of Naboo
column4: but was quickly supplanted by the Vulture-class droid starfighter. Compared to its successor
column5: the Scarab is more heavily armed and armoured
column6: but is not as agile. It also features a cockpit compartment and hyperdrive
column7: allowing for independent use by organic pilots."

Text: "The Alpha-3 Nimbus-class V-wing is a medium starfighter model

column7: as well as a hyperdrive."

Text: "The Consular-class space cruiser/corvette was a starship designed and manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and used by the Galactic Republic to transport Jedi and diplomats to troubled spots across the galaxy. Civilian models of the Consular-class cruiser were used for straight-forward transportation and were indistinct."

Text: "The Crusader-class corvette is a light warship developed by Mandal Hypernautics shortly after the end of the Clone Wars. Naming the ship after the ancient Mandalorian Crusaders

Text: "The Lancer Pursuit Craft is a patrol ship produced by MandalMotors. Blurring the line between civilian freighter and warship
column4: the Lancer was more interdiction and patrol vessel than workaday cargo hauler.\n\nCreated on special commission for Black Sun by MandalMotors
column5: the Lancer was designed to chase down fleeing cargo vessels and outrun other patrol ships."

Text: "The YV-666 light freighter
column4: also known simply as YV-series light freighter or YV-666
column5: is an old model of light freighter that was designed by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and is currently produced by some Outer Rim companies. Quite popular among pirates and smugglers due to its versatility."

Text: "The YV-666 light freighter
column4: also known simply as YV-series light freighter or YV-666
column5: is an old model of light freighter that was designed by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and is currently produced by some Outer Rim companies.\n\nQuite popular among pirates and smugglers due to its versatility."

Text: "Named after a planet which was controlled by the Imperial Mining Company
column4: this shuttle became one of the powerhouses of Empire mining operations. This is a modification for ore mining."

column4: Inc. and used by various factions and corporations for light freight trading and as VIP transport."

Text: "Produced by Starfeld Industries
column4: the ZH-40 Tribune-class light freighter was designed with both protection and profit in mind
column5: fielding numerous pilot-controlled weapons and a powerful dorsal turret. The robustness and defensive capabilities of the Tribune has made it a favourite of many outer-rim traders and smugglers."

Text: "The GS-80
column4: or Gallofree Gunship
column5: is one of the few dedicated warship designs produced by Gallofree Yards. Sporting five main guns
column6: four torpedo launch tubes
column7: and three defensive turrets
column8: the GS-80 has found itself in the hands of private organisations
column9: the Rebel Alliance
column10: and even the New Republic Defence Fleet. At least one GS-80 was present at the Battle of Endor."

Text: "The Dynamic-class freighter was a light freighter built by a subsidiary of Core Galaxy Systems on the remote Republic world of Transel around the period of the Mandalorian Wars. A stock Dynamic-class freighter was only modestly armed and shielded; however
column4: the ship was designed to accept modifications without compromising existing systems and most ships were therefore heavily customised by their owners. By this date these ships are no longer produced and can be rarely seen."

Text: "The Kom'rk-class fighter/transport
column4: also known as the Gauntlet starfighter
column5: was a type of starfighter and troop transport used by the Mandalorian splinter faction known as Death Watch."

Text: "The Kom'rk-class fighter/transport

Text: "A collaboration between Corellian and Koensayr engineers resulted in a modular transporter ship that was often modified for different roles and purposes. There was a legal dispute around ship model naming
column4: and in the end people started to call it a C-K Transporter/Miner. This is a solid miner modification."

Text: "The SoroSuub Personal Luxury Yacht 3000 is exactly what its name suggests: a yacht
column4: suitable for carrying passengers in luxury. It has been used to carry everything from famous dignitaries to illegal cargo. The most famous of these ships
column5: the Lady Luck
column6: was owned by Lando Calrissian
column7: but many examples were found among veteran spacers after the Battle of Yavin."

"The EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate was built by Kuat Drive Yards for use by the Imperial Navy
column4: to protect convoys from Rebel Alliance starfighter actions. It was
column5: however
column6: used more famously by the Rebellion. While generally well-armed for a vessel of that size
column7: the midsection connecting spar was an exploitable vulnerability. This Escort version is equipped with more anti-fighter weapons."

Text: "Designed years before the outbreak of the Clone Wars
column4: the Acclamator I-class was a common sight alongside the larger Venator-class Star Destroyers. Despite primarily being a transport ship
column5: its heavy weaponry and shielding allowed it to carry troops into enemy systems
column6: break orbital blockades
column7: and land directly on the battlefield to deploy an entire legion of troopers and their vehicles. Though it was phased out of the Imperial Navy
column8: it continues to see service as a heavy freighter among multiple factions
column9: due to the protection offered by its anti-fighter capabilities."

Text: "Seeing the need for a more heavily-armed warship within the fleets of the Republic Navy
column4: Rothana Heavy Engineering modified the design of the Acclamator-class Transport. The resulting ship
column5: the Acclamator-II
column6: sacrificed most of the original Acclamator's cargo space for additional weaponry and shielding
column7: and was used by the Republic to carry out orbital bombardments during the Clone Wars. Following the end of that conflict
column8: the Acclamator-II was retired by the Galactic Empire
column9: and now sees service within the fleets of the Corporate Sector Authority."

column5: was a starship produced by Botajef Shipyards which first brought the small shipbuilding concern to galactic prominence. Initially conceived as a freighter
column6: it would go on to be used as a refugee transport and
column7: during the Clone Wars
column8: as a troopship for the Grand Army of the Republic."

column4: was an Imperial moderization of the Quasar Fire-class built by the SoroSuub Corporation. It saw service in the Galactic Empire's Imperial Navy
column5: both as a starfighter carrier and a mobile base of operations."

Text: "Pelta-class Frigate"
"Pelta-class Freighter"
"Produced by Kuat Drive Yards and used heavily by the Republic during the Clone Wars
column4: the Pelta-class frigate was a versatile ship capable of filling multiple roles. Moderately armed
column5: it acted as a support frigate for larger Venator or Acclamator fleets
column6: while its cargo bays and crew quarters allowed it to move supplies or transport troops. One of its primary uses
column7: however
column8: was the transport of injured clone troopers to Republic medical stations for treatment."

Text: "Produced by Kuat Drive Yards and used heavily by the Republic during the Clone Wars
column4: the Pelta-class frigate was a versatile ship capable of filling multiple roles. In the years following the war
column5: the Empire retired the majority of these ships. Many years later
column6: as the Galactic Civil War began
column7: several Pelta-class frigates fell into the hands of Rebel forces
column8: which modified them for greater firepower at the cost of cargo storage. Eventually
column9: the New Republic found the modified Pelta frigates to be efficient enough that the modifications were formalized under the Pelta-II designation."

Text: "The Class VI Bulk Freighter is a type of cargo hauler originally designed by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. Based on the ancient Praetorian-class Frigate
column4: it has a modest cargo space and impressive speed
column5: but is lightly armed
column6: poorly armoured
column7: and moderately shielded."

Text: "A successor and life extension program to the Victory I-class Star Destroyer manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards
column4: the Victory II-class Star Destroyer was redesigned with greater firepower and lower maintenance upkeep. Though many of the previous model's most glaring flaws were corrected
column5: this all-purpose ship never escaped the Victory I's problems in their entirety
column6: and failed to hold up to Imperial standards. Many Victory IIs were assigned to service as defence for a planetary garrison or light patrol duties on the edges of the Galactic Empire's authority.  An Imperial officer being assigned to an old Victory II-class was often seen as the end of their career
column7: shuffled off to a backwater world in exile."

Text: "The Neutron Star Bulk Cruiser was designed by Rendili StarDrive as a second-line warship for the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars. However
column4: it was already obsolete by the time it was produced
column5: and the defeat of the Separatists meant the Neutron Star never saw combat. Rejected by the Empire
column6: Rendili sold the ship to private interests as patrol vessels in poor sectors and fringe systems.\n\nThis model has been modernised to carry heavy turbolasers
column7: an ion cannon
column8: and a small complement of fighters."

Text: "The Immobilizer 418 cruiser
column4: also known as the Interdictor
column5: is a 600-meter-long cruiser built on the standard Vindicator-class heavy cruiser hull. Equipped with gravity well projectors designed to pull ships from hyperspace and/or prevent them making the jump to lightspeed
column6: the Interdictor became a valuable addition to the Imperial Navy."

Text: "The MC40B is a small cruiser built by Mon Calamari Shipyards. It is equipped with powerful shields for a vessel of its size. Compared to the MC40A
column4: the Torpedo Cruiser had its ion Cannons and concussion missile launchers removed to allow the installation of Heavy Torpedo Launchers."

column4: the Torpedo Cruiser had its ion Cannons and concussion missile launchers removed to allow the installation of Heavy Torpedo Launchers."

Text: "The Valor-class cruiser is an ancient Old Republic design
column4: restored and modernised by the Anoat Federation. Designed as a fast capital ship
column5: it originally served as the most powerful warship in the Republic fleet during the Great Galactic War
column6: more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Bristling with medium turbolasers
column7: it stands on level footing with other cruisers
column8: but will struggle and falter under the fire of larger vessels."

Text: "The Heraklon was once a transport and frigate of the Old Republic Navy. Currently it is repurposed as a utility vessel and for mining operations. This is the ore miner refit."

"Nova Battle Cruiser"
"Nova-class Battle Cruiser"
"The Nova-class battle cruiser is a capital ship that formed a large portion of the Hapan fleet. This 400-meter cruiser often serves as a patrol vessel for the Hapan Consortium's borders
column4: as well as supplementing their primary warship
column5: the Battle Dragon. Their speed and weaponry make them a formidable cruiser for their size."

Text: "Vigil-class"
"Vigil-class Corvette"
"The Vigil-class corvette is considered the smallest vessel in the iconic Star Destroyer line of ships. Thanks to their size and role
column4: these ships rarely served in the line of battle with larger types of star destroyers. Instead they patrolled trade routes
column5: escorted cruisers as picket ships
column6: served as battlegroup leaders for small backwater fleets
column7: operated as lone cruisers hunting pirates and smugglers
column8: and generally served where a larger destroyer was deemed excessive or wasteful."

Text: "Fulgor-class"
"Fulgor-class Frigate"
"The Fulgor-class frigate is a heavy pursuit ship made to protect trading routes. Its hyperdrive is powerful enough to catch up to most corvettes
column4: and its light turbolasers
column5: ion cannons
column6: and concussion missiles can make quick work of the lighter targets used to harass freighter convoys."

Text: "Velox-class"
"Velox-class Frigate"
"Basically an engine with weapons attached
column4: the Velox-class Frigate is able to weave between heavier ship classes inside their formations to disrupt and distract the enemy from the larger fleet vessels. With a wide variety of light and medium weapons
column5: combined with the forward-facing heavy ion cannons
column6: the Velox can even pose a threat to ships of similar or smaller size as part of a picket or patrol."

Text: "Teroch-class"
"Teroch-class Cruiser"
"The Teroch-class cruiser is an older Mandalorian warship design created by MandalHypernautics
column4: and commissioned by Death Watch after their rise to power. Over the course of the Galactic Civil war

"The Storm Commando Carrier
column4: also known as the 'Spector-class Escort Carrier' and 'Imperial Escort Carrier'
column5: is a type of capital ship used extensively by the former Galactic Empire's Storm Commandos. Following their official disbandment after the Battle of Yavin
column6: this ship has found continued use by various Imperial warlords.\n\nThe Storm Commandos demanded something different than the standard escort carrier of the Imperial Navy. The result is a nimble narrow-hulled ship with a flared arrowhead bow
column7: two turrets on the dorsal centerline
column8: a startling number of rear-facing missile racks
column9: and ample hangar space for a ship of its size.\n\nThe Storm Commando Carrier relies on speed and high alpha-strike potential to deal quick decisive blows during operations. Once its missile stores are depleted it is quite lightly armed. The ship does not have the ammunition stores or durability for prolonged combat."

Text: "The Imperial II-class Star Destroyer is a capital ship model that was derived from the Imperial I-class Star Destroyer. The newer model has a heavily reinforced hull

Text: "The Venator-class Star Destroyer was the backbone of the Galactic Republic's naval forces during the Clone Wars. As the first of the Star Destroyers designed by Kuat Drive Yards
column4: the Venator combined high firepower with a substantial starfighter complement
column5: and often served as a command ship for Jedi generals. Capable of quickly fielding dozens of fighters
column6: the Venator is purpose-built as a carrier first and warship second. While it may not be able to hold its own against some ships of comparable size by itself
column7: the fighters and other support craft it houses can turn the tide of battle.\n\nFollowing the end of the Clone Wars
column8: the Venator was slowly retired in favour of the Imperial-class Star Destroyer
column9: and scrapped or sold as surplus to a wide variety of corporate and private interests.\n\nThis iteration of the Venator is seen among Corporate Sector fleets
column10: and has been modernised with additional shielding and hull reinforcements
column11: which came at the cost of some of its fighter capacity."

column6: and as a destroyer its arms and armour are impressive
column7: though its moderate speed leaves it lagging behind all but the heaviest warships."

"The MC85 Star Cruiser is a prototype of new heavy Star Cruiser manufactured by the Mon Calamari Shipyards and the Corellian Engineering Corporation. Incorporating the powerful shields comparable to Home One class and additional heavy turbolasers this ship is designed with single purpose in mind - direct ship-to-ship combat in fight against remaining imperial forces."
"Following the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column4: the Mon Calamari Shipyards and Corellian Engineering Corporation cooperated to develop a new frontline warship for a multi-species navy. The resulting ship
column5: the MC85 Star Cruiser
column6: is a massive battleship intended to be a defensive keystone in New Republic fleets. Rather than being a repurposed civilian ship
column7: like the MC80 line
column8: the MC85 was designed from the start to engage in direct ship-to-ship combat.\n\nA robust and sturdy platform
column9: this cruiser utilizes heavy weaponry and advanced shielding. Keeping with the New Republic doctrine of force projection through versatility
column10: the MC85 also boasts large inset hangars
column11: allowing it to carry a full complement of fighters."

Text: "Subjugator Battle Cruiser"
"\033U[XXL]\033X Subjugator-class Battlecruiser"
"Subjugator"
"[XXL] Subjugator"

"The Subjugator-class Battle Cruiser is a type of heavy battleship designed by Ruggle Schmong for use by the Confederacy of Independent Systems' naval forces from a discarded SoroSuub Corporation starship design. Potentially the largest warship that served at the time of the Clone Wars
column4: the Subjugator is heavily armed with hundreds of laser cannons of different types
column5: powerful ion cannons
column6: flak guns and proton torpedoes."

Text: "In the early months of the Clone Wars
column4: the Republic Navy was plagued by a new and terrifying threat: a Subjugator-class Battlecruiser
column5: the Malevolence. Initially the Republic had difficulty in tracking the Malevolence as its advanced axial Ion Cannons were capable of projecting a massive blast which disabled any vessel caught in its wake
column6: and even entire fleets of Republic Star Destroyers fell to the following barrage of missiles and laser fire. The Republic's first several encounters with the Malevolence resulted in a complete loss of Republic assets
column7: and only a handful of survivors.\n\nHowever
column8: with the intelligence acquired by those survivors
column9: Republic forces under General Anakin Skywalker were able to disable the Malevolence with a large-scale bomber strike
column10: and on-board sabotage forced the ship to crash into the Dead Moon of Antar
column11: finally destroying it.\n\nDespite being wildly successful in its first engagements
column12: the Separatists kept their remaining Subjugators away from the frontlines except as a last result
column13: fearing additional losses of these resource-intensive ships; those remaining Subjugators disappeared entirely after the Clone Wars.\n\nFollowing the end of the Galactic Civil War
column14: and the growing hostilities between the Corporate Sector Authority and Independent Commerce Guild
column15: it has been rumored that these massive ships have once again been seen in supermassive shipyards.\n\nLicensed Build Limit: 2"

column4: used across the galaxy."

Text: "The L-s1 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems. Before 0 BBY
column4: TIE/ln space superiority starfighters were usually equipped with a pair of L-s1s. The L-s1 was eventually surpassed by the L-s7.2 laser cannon
column5: which solved the L-s1's problem of overheating by adding coolant modifications; however
column6: the L-s1 still remains popular among young spacers
column7: as it is not only very cheap but is becoming more widely available as a result of the Empire's slow but steady fracturing after the disaster at Endor."

Text: "The L-s1 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems. Before the Battle of Yavin
column4: TIE/ln space superiority starfighters were usually equipped with a pair of L-s1s.\n\nThe L-s1 was eventually surpassed by the L-s7.2 laser cannon
column5: which solved the L-s1's problem of overheating by adding coolant modifications; however
column6: the L-s1 still remains popular among young spacers

Text: "The KX5 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. It is a viable alternative to the standard-issue IX-4 laser cannons found on BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers and RZ-1 A-Wings. They are also commonly seen on Z-95 Headhunter starfighters."
"The KX5 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. It is widespread and can be found on many small craft throughout the galaxy thanks to its low cost
column4: though it suffers from a relatively low damage."

Text: "The KX7 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Most commonly seen on UT-60D U-wing support ships and Zeta-class cargo shuttles
column4: it is more pricey
column5: but certainly more powerful
column6: than the KX5."

Text: "The KX7 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Though it was most commonly mounted to U-wings and Zeta-class shuttles
column4: it could also be found on various fighters. Its high fire rate offsets low individual damage per shot
column5: making it a more effective
column6: if more expensive
column7: improvement over Taim and Bak's KX5."

Text: "The KX10 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. The most powerful of the KX-series of weapons systems
column4: this design can easily ensure a pilot's victory in a dogfight several times over
column5: and
column6: if the user is smart enough
column7: is capable of seriously damaging or even crippling a light corvette. However
column8: it has a shorter range than the KX7
column9: and overheats much faster."

Text: "The KX10 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. One of the more powerful weapons that can be mounted on a starfighter
column4: the KX10 deals devastating damage to fighters
column5: and can even cripple a corvette if used by a skilled pilot.\n\nHowever
column6: it has a shorter range than the KX7
column7: and is limited to a slower fire rate due to high heat buildup."

Text: "Developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation
column4: the XX-80 is an octuple barbette turbolaser design usually found on Imperial II-class Star Destroyers and other heavy warships and stations. While it suffers from a slow turning rate
column5: its long range and sheer damage output readily compensates for this weakness."

Text: "Developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation
column4: the XX-80 is an eight-barreled turbolaser design usually found on Imperial II-class Star Destroyers and other heavy warships and stations.\n\nWhile it suffers from a slow turning rate and middling range
column5: its sheer damage output readily compensates for this weakness."

Text: "\033#989db6ec#AG-1G Laser Cannon\033X"

"The Corellian Engineering Corporation-produced AG-2G quad laser cannon is a powerful laser cannon
column4: best suited for anti-starfighter defence. One of these laser turrets was installed on the top of the Millennium Falcon by Lando Calrissian and modified by Han Solo
column5: the latter of whom also added the ventral cannons."

Text: "The Corellian Engineering Corporation-produced AG-2G quad laser cannon is a powerful laser cannon
column4: best suited for anti-starfighter defence.\n\nTwo of these cannons were mounted on the Millennium Falcon by Han Solo
column5: replacing the single-barrel turrets used by Lando Calrissian."

Text: "The Corellian Engineering Corporation-produced AG-1G laser cannon is a basic point-defence laser cannon."
"The Tomral RM-76 laser cannon is a basic point-defence laser cannon with a single barrel. A pair were mounted on the Millennium Falcon when it was captained by Lando Calrissian
column4: though they were eventually replaced by Han Solo."

Text: "The H9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Usually seen on CR90 corvettes
column4: they are reasonably powerful for their small size but struggle against anything that isn't another corvette
column5: and are best used in an anti-starfighter role. This is the dual-barrel configuration."

column4: they are reasonably powerful for their small size but struggle against anything that isn't another corvette

Text: "The XX-9 heavy turbolaser is a heavy shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation and is the main turbolaser type seen on medium and large warships
column4: where it excels in medium-range engagements.\n\nThis is the single-barrel configuration."

Text: "The SW-7a light ion cannon is a starfighter-mounted ion cannon manufactured by the ArMek Corporation. Used for disabling a target's shields and short-circuiting their internal systems
column4: including their engines. When used by the right pilot
column5: it is capable of disabling anything from starfighters to small warships. The Slayn and Korpil-designed A/SF-01 B-wing heavy assault starfighter featured three SW-7a cannons as part of its armament."

Text: "The SW-7a light ion cannon is a starfighter-mounted ion cannon manufactured by the ArMek Corporation.\n\nUsed for disabling a target's shields and short-circuiting their internal systems

column5: it is capable of disabling anything from starfighters to small warships.\n\nIt is commonly found on the B-wings of the New Republic

Text: "The L-s7.2 laser cannon is mass produced in the Wakeelmui system
column4: and is considered the standard laser cannon used on Sienar Fleet Systems' TIE Series as of the Battle of Endor. It features several improvements over the older L-s1
column5: chief of which are its higher damage output
column6: higher rate of fire
column7: and better coolant systems."

Text: "After reports by Imperial pilots regarding the inadequacies of the L-s1 laser cannons mounted on their TIE fighters
column4: Sienar Fleet Systems developed the L-s7.2 as a replacement weapon.\n\nIt features several improvements over the older cannons
column5: chief of which is its better coolant system. With a slower buildup of heat
column6: TIE fighters produced since the Battle of Endor can fire for longer periods."

Text: "More destructive than the slightly older but more common L-s7.2 laser cannon
column4: the L-s9.3 had the power to destroy small asteroids in one shot. Developed by Sienar Fleet Systems to provide additional firepower against shielded Rebel fighters
column5: the L-s9.3 was most notably used as the primary armament of the Imperial TIE/IN interceptor. However
column6: it was also commonly found on the TIE/ad Avenger and the TIE/D Defender. It could also be fitted to the TIE Advanced x1 and even standard TIE/LNs."

Text: "More destructive than the slightly older but more common L-s7.2 laser cannon
column4: the L-s9.3 had the power to destroy small asteroids in one shot. Developed by Sienar Fleet Systems to provide additional firepower against shielded Rebel fighters
column5: the L-s9.3 was most notably used as the primary armament of Darth Vader's prototype TIE/x1 fighter.\n\nHowever
column6: it was also commonly found on other advanced and specialty TIEs. Some pilots dislike its three-round burst
column7: but others prefer the high damage of individual bolts."

Text: "A Taim and Bak-produced dual heavy turbolaser turret
column4: usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons. Best used in long-range engagements."

Text: "A Taim and Bak-produced dual heavy turbolaser turret
column4: usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons.\n\nIt boasts a high range for general ship-based weaponry
column5: as well as decent damage and fire rate."

Text: "A Taim and Bak-produced dual-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that is similar to the XX-18
column4: usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons. Best used in long-range engagements."

Text: "A Taim and Bak-produced dual-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that is similar to the XX-18
column4: usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons.\n\nIts high range and decent fire rate are offset by a relatively low damage."

Text: "The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-7 ion cannon is a powerful ship-based weapon used on Imperial capital ships
column4: especially Imperial Star Destroyers. Each emplacement has its own turbine generator and is controlled by gunnery stations inside the ship. Used for disabling the shields and engines of another capital ship. A volley from these weapons can disable a ship for several minutes. Components of the NK-7 include an ion tube
column5: ion accu-accelerator
column6: turbine generators
column7: cooling grid
column8: targeting computers
column9: elevation tracking
column10: and maintenance access hatches."

Text: "The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-7 ion cannon is a powerful ship-based weapon used on Imperial capital ships
column4: especially Imperial Star Destroyers. Each emplacement has its own turbine generator and is controlled by gunnery stations inside the ship. It is quite effective at disabling the shields and engines of capital ships.\n\nA volley from these weapons can wreak havok on electrical systems and shield generators."

Text: "The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-5 ion cannon is a powerful ion cannon used on Imperial capital ships."
"The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-5 ion cannon is a powerful ion cannon used on Imperial capital ships. It features high fire rate
column4: but relatively low shield disruption."

Text: "A heavier variant of the Krupx Warhead Launcher that can be fitted to medium-sized warships. Capable of carrying heavier and more powerful payloads."
"A heavier variant of the Krupx Warhead Launcher that can be fitted to medium-sized warships.\n\nIt is capable of carrying medium ion and proton torpedoes."
"General-purpose point defence light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence."
"A general-purpose point defence light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. It has short range and low damage
column4: leaving it unsuitable for larger targets."

Text: "Clone-war era point defence general-purpose light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence."
"A Clone War-era point defence laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. Compared to the SL-1 point defense cannon
column4: it has higher range
column5: fire rate
column6: and shield disruption
column7: but lower damage to hulls."

Text: "Quad-barreled general-purpose heavy laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence."
"A quad-barreled general-purpose laser turret manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks
column4: installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. It features a high range for quad laser cannons
column5: but some captains may prefer a dual cannon turret with higher range to defend against hostile fighters."

Text: "The NK-3 ion cannon is a type of starfighter-scale ion cannon that is manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense and is more powerful than the SW-7a. Used for disabling the shields and engines of a target."
"The NK-3 ion cannon is a type of starfighter-scale ion cannon that is manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense. Though it is ostensibly more powerful than other ion cannons
column4: it overheats more quickly
column5: fires more slowly
column6: and has a shorter range.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of a target."

Text: "The T-s5 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in the TIE/sa bomber
column4: which also contains an M-s3 concussion missile launcher in its ordnance pod."

Text: "The T-s5 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in various TIE craft. The launcher allows for the use of medium torpedoes and light cluster missiles."
"The M-g-2 general-purpose warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in the TIE/x1 Advanced
column4: TIE/ad Avenger
column5: and TIE/D Defender."

Text: "The M-g-2 general-purpose warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in several TIE-series starships. It allows ships to fire light missiles and torpedoes
column4: and is distinguished from other launchers by its ability to store an extra missile."

Text: "Mining laser turret used to crack open large asteroids for the purpose of mining resources such as silicon."
"Mining laser turrets are used to crack open large asteroids for the purpose of mining resources such as silicon."
"The SW-7 ion cannon is manufactured by ArMek. It is a powerful weapon found on medium and heavy warships. Used for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships."
"The SW-7 ion cannon is a general-use ion cannon manufactured by ArMek. It is a powerful weapon found on heavy fighters
column4: but its high damage is offset by its low firing rate.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships."

Text: "The SW-7-HOI ion cannon is a heavier version of SW-7 manufactured by ArMek
column4: usually installed on Mon Calamari capital ships. Used for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships."

Text: "The SW-7-HOI ion cannon is a heavier version of SW-7 manufactured by ArMek
column4: usually installed on Mon Calamari capital ships.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships."

Text: "The XV9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. This heavy-duty turbolaser is commonly found aboard a variety of capital ships."
"The XV9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. It is typically found on Mon Calamari Cruisers of all sizes."
"The RG-9 laser cannon is a model of laser cannon manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense. It has an extended gimbal for better target tracking. However
column4: it suffers from low damage output and a somewhat short range."

Text: "The RG-9 laser cannon is a model of laser cannon manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense.Most commonly mounted on the New Republic's A-wings
column4: it has a very high fire rate. However
column5: it suffers from low damage output and a somewhat short range."

Text: "The MG9 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Krupx Munitions. Can only hold proton torpedoes."
"The MG9 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Krupx Munitions.\n\nCan only hold proton torpedoes."
"The HM-6 Concussion Missile Launcher is a type of concussion missile launcher commonly found on the RZ-1 A-wing interceptor. They are manufactured by Dymek."
"The HM-6 Concussion Missile Launcher is a type of concussion missile launcher commonly found on the A-wing interceptor and other freelance fighters."

"The SW-4 is a dual ion cannon manufactured by ArMek during the early years of the Galactic Empire. It is most commonly found on BTL-series Y-wing starfighters used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic."
"The SW-4 is a dual ion cannon manufactured by ArMek during the early years of the Galactic Empire. A notoriously delicate system
column4: the cannon's internals tended to vibrate out of alignment during flight
column5: leading to mechanics hating the weapon.\n\nIt is most commonly found on BTL-series Y-wing starfighters used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic
column6: though few were ever operational."

Text: "The XV7 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser. Effective at relatively short ranges and possesses decent damage output. It can be mounted on select station modules."
"The XV7 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser. It is effective at average ranges and possesses decent damage output.\n\nIt can be mounted on certain station modules."
"The XV7's bigger cousin. Able to be mounted on medium-size warships
column4: the XV8 is a medium-range dual-barreled turbolaser that is reasonably powerful for its size."

column5: slow-firing
column6: but has an average damage and price."

Text: "Heavy turbolaser cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates. A powerful weapon that is held back somewhat by a relatively short range."
"A heavy turbolaser cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates.\n\nA powerful weapon that is held back somewhat by a relatively short range."

Text: "A heavy ion cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates.\n\nExcels at quickly disabling the shields and engines of a similarly-sized ship
column4: but like its turbolaser counterpart
column5: held back somewhat by a relatively short range."

Text: "The R-T0 is a twin laser cannon designed by ArMek that is commonly mounted on the aft turret of Lambda-class T-4a shuttles. It is an effective anti-starfighter weapon
column4: reasonably powerful for both the Lambda's size and its own."

Text: "The R-T0 is a twin laser cannon designed by ArMek that is commonly mounted as the aft turret of some shuttles and transports.\n\nIt is an effective anti-starfighter weapon
column4: reasonably powerful for the size of the ships that use it."

Text: "Dual-barreled long range laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence."
"A dual-barreled long range laser turret manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks
column4: installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence. It has average range and firepower compared to other dual laser cannons."

Text: "The IX-4 is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation and is older than the KX5. However
column4: it is still a formidable starfighter-scale weapon
column5: boasting respectable firepower and range."

Text: "The IX-4 is a laser cannon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation.\n\nDespite being older than the KX5
column4: it is still a formidable starfighter-scale weapon
column5: boasting respectable firepower and range
column6: at the cost of a lower fire rate."

Text: "The IX-8 was an attempt by the Taim and Bak Corporation to improve and modernise the IX-4. However
column4: its only improvement over the IX-4 ended up being its higher damage output
column5: and it overheats faster
column6: leading the company to quickly discontinue the IX-8 in favour of developing and manufacturing the more modern KX-series of laser cannons. Nevertheless
column7: many spacers and factions seem to have found a use for it."

Text: "The IX-8 was an attempt by the Taim and Bak Corporation to improve and modernise the IX-4. However
column4: its only improvement over the IX-4 ended up being its higher damage output
column5: and it overheats faster despite its burst fire
column6: leading the company to quickly discontinue the IX-8 in favour of developing and manufacturing the more modern KX-series of laser cannons.\n\nNevertheless
column7: many spacers and factions seem to have found a use for it."

Text: "The Taim and Bak-produced MS-1 is infamous for being the primary armament of the Empire's All Terrain Armoured Transports
column4: and many factions took to mounting it on starfighters due to its low cost and resistance to overheating. However
column5: its damage output in dogfights is underwhelming."

Text: "The Taim and Bak-produced MS-1 is infamous for being the primary armament of the Empire's All Terrain Armoured Transports
column4: and many factions took to mounting it on starfighters due to its low cost and resistance to overheating. However
column5: its damage output in dogfights is underwhelming and its burst fire can be unappealing to some spacers."

Text: "The MS-1's bigger brother
column4: now specifically designed for starfighters. Significantly improved damage output while still being resistant to overheating."

Text: "The MS-2b is manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation as the MS-1's bigger brother
column4: now specifically designed for starfighters.\n\nIt has significantly improved damage output while still being resistant to overheating
column5: though it retains the three-round burst of its predecessor."

Text: "The third and final product in the MS-series of laser cannons
column4: the MS-3 features a significantly longer range and higher damage output than the MS-2b."

Text: "The MS-3 is the third and final product in the MS-series of laser cannons manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation.It features a significantly longer range and higher damage output than the MS-2b
column4: but far lower fire rate
column5: even for its three-round burst."

Text: "Produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation
column4: the KX20-B is a heavy laser cannon typically mounted on fast attack craft and corvettes. Has a respectable damage output but a relatively short range."

Text: "Produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation
column4: the KX20-B is a heavy laser cannon typically mounted on fast attack craft and corvettes.It has a respectable damage output but average range and slow firing speed."

Text: "The Taim and Bak-produced XV1 prow turbolaser is a powerful bow-mounted weapon that is commonly seen on corvettes such as the Defender-class and the more offensive-minded variants of the Gozanti-class cruiser. Has a respectable range but is held back by its tendency to overheat quickly."

"The Taim and Bak-produced XV1 prow turbolaser is a powerful bow-mounted weapon that is commonly seen on corvettes such as the Defender-class and the more offensive-minded variants of the Gozanti-class cruiser.\n\nIt has a respectable range and damage
column4: but is held back by its tendency to overheat quickly."

Text: "The GA-60s is a heavy laser cannon produced by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations. It is relatively weak
column4: and is further held back by a short range for its size
column5: but thanks to advanced technology and cooling systems it seldom overheats during a pitched fight
column6: and is excellent at beating down a target's shields."

Text: "The GA-60s is a heavy laser cannon produced by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations.\n\nIt is relatively weak
column4: and is further held back by a short range for its size
column5: but thanks to advanced technology and cooling systems it seldom overheats during a pitched fight
column6: and is excellent at wearing down a target's shields."

Text: "The KV22 heavy repeating laser cannon is manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Despite its relatively low damage output and short range
column4: its nature as a repeater allows it to do much damage to a target. It is also slow to overheat. Best used in hit-and-fade attacks."

Text: "The KV22 heavy repeating laser cannon is manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Despite its high damage and range
column4: its low fire rate belies its nature as a repeating cannon.\n\nIt is slow to overheat
column5: however
column6: which makes it effective in sustained fire."

Text: "The HS-10 is a heavy laser cannon manufactured by the resurgent Techno Union
column4: and is used on medium-size ships fielded by both Union and Commerce Guild forces. Is held back by a somewhat short maximum range
column5: but boasts a decent damage output for its size and is slow to overheat."

Text: "The HS-10 is a heavy laser cannon manufactured by the Independent Commerce Guild
column4: and is used on medium-size ships fielded by Commerce Guild forces.\n\nCompared to similar heavy laser cannons
column5: it boasts a high fire rate and range
column6: but low damage and high heat."

Text: "A mass driver Chaingun is a ship-mounted weapon that launches solid projectiles at breakneck speeds towards a target
column4: typically by rapidly accelerating the projectile via electromagnetism as it leaves the cannon's barrel. Some mass drivers
column5: such as this one originally produced by MandalMotors
column6: are fed projectiles via a magazine system
column7: allowing the cannon to fire at a reasonably fast rate before the barrel needs to cool down. Mass drivers are able to seriously damage a starship's hull because of their nature as projectile weapons."

Text: "A mass driver Chaingun is a ship-mounted weapon that launches solid projectiles at high speeds towards a target
column4: typically by rapidly accelerating the projectile via electromagnetism as it leaves the cannon's barrel.\n\nSome mass drivers
column5: such as this one originally produced by MandalMotors
column6: are fed projectiles via a magazine system
column7: allowing the cannon to fire at a reasonably fast rate before the barrel needs to cool down.\n\nMass drivers are able to seriously damage a starship's hull because of their nature as projectile weapons."

Text: "The XX3 prow turbolaser is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation exclusively for the Empire. While similar to the XV1
column4: it has a slightly longer range and is better resistant to overheating."

Text: "The XX3 prow turbolaser is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation exclusively for the Empire.\n\nWhile similar to the XV1

column5: leading to more damage overall."

Text: "The E-X is a heavy blaster cannon found on anti-personnel vehicles and small fighters."
"The E-X is a heavy blaster cannon found on anti-personnel vehicles and small
column4: cheap fighters. Due to high heat buildup
column5: short range
column6: and low damage

Text: "A missile rack allows for the mounting of additional missiles on a starship."
"A missile rack allows for the mounting of additional missiles on a starship. Typically this is only done on tiny frames with precious little internal space
column4: like droid fighters."

Text: "Modernised version of DBY-24 medium turbolaser. Can be mounted only on Venator Star Destroyers."

"The A-2 ion cannon is manufactured by ArMek and is designed for small fighters. Capable of disabling the shields and engines of other small fighters but not very useful beyond that role."

"The PD Quad Turbolaser is an Imperial-designed point defence weapon system that prioritizes accuracy and fire rate over raw destructive power. Manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards
column4: this quad-barreled turbolaser was specifically engineered to counter the increasing threat of Rebel starfighter attacks on Imperial capital ships.\n\nBy sacrificing per-shot damage for enhanced targeting systems and a higher rate of fire
column5: the PD Quad provides effective coverage against fast-moving targets that would otherwise evade heavier turbolaser batteries. Its reduced power requirements also allow for installation on vessels where power distribution is a concern.\n\nCommonly found on the Executor Super Star Destroyer and other Imperial vessels
column6: the PD Quad has proven itself an essential component of layered defensive systems."

"A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes
column4: concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and piercing a target's shields. The ST2 is a starfighter-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries that is best used against other starfighters."
