Text: "A rocket
column4: also known as a dumbfire missile
column5: is a concussion missile that has no internal guidance systems
column6: and travels in a straight line when launched from a starship. Their key advantage over conventional concussion missiles is that several can be fired in rapid succession. Rockets are incredibly basic weapons
column7: with a typical rocket's method of propulsion being a chemical explosion that is then forced out of its nozzle
column8: and can be traced all the way back to antiquity. This also makes them extremely easy to manufacture
column9: and as such they can be found all across the galaxy
column10: most often sold in bulk."

Text: "A discord missile
column4: nicknamed the Blue Streak for its blue exhaust trail
column5: is a missile whose payload is seven Pistoeka sabotage droids; when deployed from the missile
column6: these droids attach themselves to
column7: and can wreak havoc on
column8: a starship's hull
column9: doing considerable amounts of damage over time. Interestingly
column10: the discord missile seems to have exceptionally intelligent internal guidance systems
column11: as the missile uses external manoeuvring thrusters to ""steer"" itself out of the way of incoming enemy point-defence fire
column12: and can outmanoeuvre most starfighters. Sold at wharfs or equipment docks belonging to the Techno Union or Independent Commerce Guild."

"The ST8 is a super heavy capital-scale concussion missile produced by Mandal Hypernautics.\n\nAlthough they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes
column4: concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and depleting a target's shields.\n\nCommonly fitted to Mandalorian warships such as the Kandosii-class dreadnaught and other moderized ancient Mandalorian designs
column5: these missiles are designed for maximum destructive impact against slow heavily armored capital ships."

Text: "The Galactic Empire
column4: also known as the New Order
column5: or simply the Empire
column6: was the galactic government that replaced the Galactic Republic in the aftermath of the Clone Wars. The Empire ushered galactic civilisation into a new age of safety
column7: freedom
column8: justice
column9: and security
column10: but this was achieved through absolute tyranny. Shortly before the Battle of Yavin
column11: less than twenty years after its founding
column12: the Empire had its legislative body
column13: the Galactic Senate
column14: dissolved
column15: effectively becoming a military dictatorship. It is currently the largest political
column16: territorial
column17: and military power to date
column18: with access to nearly unlimited funding and holding sway over a large majority of the galaxy. However
column19: following the death of its Emperor
column20: Sheev Palpatine
column21: during the disastrous Battle of Endor
column22: the Empire has entered a period of steady decline over the past few years
column23: with some political or military groups within the Empire breaking away entirely
column24: either to continue the Imperial dream on their own terms or to form new dominions. Those still loyal to the Imperial leadership are known by Alliance intelligence officers as simply Imperial Loyalists. As of 4 ABY
column25: the Empire is lead by a Grand Vizier
column26: originally a title held by the Emperor's personal assistant. The current Grand Vizier is Sate Pestage."

Text: "The Bounty Hunters' Guild
column4: also known as the Bondsman's Guild
column5: or simply the Bounty Guild
column6: is an institution that regulates the complicated profession that is the bounty-hunting trade throughout the galaxy. Ensuring the legality of hunting for its members
column7: it works alongside galactic governments and curates bounties for its members. Although it is smaller than it once was following a violent period of internal strife ignited by Boba Fett in 1 ABY
column8: the Guild is still active today."

Text: "The New Republic is the galactic government established by the Alliance to Restore the Republic to replace the Galactic Empire after the Battle of Endor. Like its predecessor
column4: it was often simply referred to as the Republic. It has become the supreme governmental authority of the galaxy. The ""New"" Republic is a continuation of the original Galactic Republic that had become known as the Old Republic. While the New Republic is busy establishing security around the galaxy
column5: its adversaries are not yet done with the fight."

Text: "The New Republic is the galactic government established by the Alliance to Restore the Republic to replace the Galactic Empire after the Battle of Endor. Like its predecessor

column5: its adversaries are not yet done with the fight."

Text: "Remnants of the Alliance to Restore the Republic
column4: fulfilling mostly police roles and some special operations."

Text: "Remnants of the Alliance to Restore the Republic
column4: now fulfilling police and special forces roles within the New Republic military.\n\nWhile diplomatically aligned with the New Republic and completely beholden to it economically
column5: the Rebel Alliance does not always agree its methods and has been known to strike on its own against targets of opportunity."

Text: "Following the death of the Emperor at Endor
column4: Imperial leadership fragmented into various warlords and renegade admirals
column5: generals
column6: and Moffs. Though many have given their loyalty to Grand Vizier Sate Pestage
column7: leading the Imperial Remnant in the galactic north
column8: others have formed a new government in the galactic south: the Imperial Ascendancy. Eschewing certain Imperial traditions
column9: the Ascendancy has replaced some ships with less popular designs
column10: and uses the Anoat Federation
column11: a vassal state of pirates
column12: mercenaries
column13: and smugglers
column14: to harass the New Republic.\nAs a consequence of Imperial ideology
column15: the Ascendancy despises its rival in the north."

Text: "Once a small mining corporation based in Anoat system
column4: the Anoat Federation is a growing power thanks to Imperial Ascendancy investments. These investments began as a means to use the Federation as a proxy for activities the Imperial Ascendancy found unsavoury
column5: such as criminal and smuggling operations. They have since grown to include legitimate business and logistics operations within Anoat space
column6: all to serve Ascendancy goals. It is safe to call Anoat Federation a vassal of the Imperial Ascendancy
column7: which causes significant friction with the New Republic."

Text: "No Description yet"
"The Sith Empire's history is long
column4: bloody
column5: and often forgotten.\nOriginating on the world of Korriban
column6: the Sith were a red-skinned species of humanoids capable of using the dark side of the Force. For thousands of years the Sith existed in isolation
column7: their society shaped by strict hierarchies
column8: constant internal strife
column9: and a cultural devotion to strength and power. This period would come to a close
column10: however
column11: upon the arrival of Dark Jedi exiled from the Old Republic. These Dark Jedi embedded themselves in the culture and bloodline of the Sith
column12: eventually taking the Sith name as the foundation of their ideology and the Sith empire as the base of their rising power. Under their influence
column13: the Sith Empire
column14: known often as the Sith Order
column15: began a cycle of expansion into the galaxy
column16: war against the Jedi and Republic
column17: defeat
column18: and rebirth.\n\nTheir overzealous ambitions would prove to be their downfall
column19: and the end of the New Sith Wars led to Darth Bane instituting the Rule of Two
column20: forcing the Sith into secrecy for almost a thousand years until Darths Sidious
column21: Maul
column22: and Tyrannus revealed themselves to the galaxy at the end of the Galactic Republic.\n\nYet the Sith Empire did not cease to exist with the eradication of its leadership. With the Dark Lords gone
column23: control fell instead to cult fanatics and devoted adherents who claimed stewardship of Sith tradition. These groups withdrew the remnants of the Empire into hiding. Cut off from the wider galaxy by forgotten and forbidden hyperlanes
column24: the Empire was left undisturbed. With no outside powers able to reach them and no Sith hierarchy remaining to seize control
column25: the cult leadership rebuilt the Empire according to its own rigid beliefs.\n\nIn this isolation the cult restored the Empire`s fleets
column26: expanded its hidden holdings
column27: and enforced Sith doctrine through strict internal hierarchy. Over the course of centuries
column28: this period of uncontested regrowth transformed the surviving Empire into a disciplined and insular power
column29: shaped not by Sith Lords but by the fanaticism of the cult that endured in their place."

Text: "These pirates serve as the... less legitimate enforcers of Hutt rule."
"These pirates serve as the less legitimate enforcers of Hutt rule. Operating from hidden bases throughout Hutt Space and Outer Rim
column4: they function as deniable assets for the Hutt Cartel
column5: conducting raids
column6: intimidation
column7: and ""tax collection"" that the Hutts prefer not to officially acknowledge.\n\nWhile officially the Cartel maintains they have no connection to these raiders
column8: it's an open secret that many pirate captains receive protection
column9: information
column10: and even equipment in exchange for a cut of their spoils and occasional ""favors"" for their Hutt patrons.\n\nThese pirates range from desperate spacers trying to survive in the lawless Outer Rim to organized criminal syndicates with their own hierarchies and territories
column11: all operating under the tacit approval of their corpulent overlords."

Text: "The Black Sun is among the most powerful and infamous crime syndicates in the galaxy. It wields significant influence in various galactic governments and is heavily involved in piracy and smuggling.\nFormed at the end of the Great Galactic War
column4: more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column5: the Black Sun quickly rose to prominence by seizing control of neighbourhoods in the lower levels of Coruscant. Throughout the next few years
column6: the organisation spread beyond the planet and became a galactic criminal syndicate.\nIn addition to its activities in ""regular"" organised crime
column7: the Black Sun's true reach included an intelligence network that rivalled even that of the Galactic Empire
column8: and the syndicate even employed its own private army and assassins."

Text: "A pirate faction made up of multiple independent crews and rival factions
column4: united only by profit and opportunity. They operate across the Outer Rim and unclaimed systems

column6: raids
column7: blackmarket trades
column8: and ad-hoc strikes from temporary safeharbors.\n\nEach crew keeps its own leaders

Text: "These Mandalorian raiders are even more aggressive than the Death Watch."
"The Mandalorian Raiders operate as a pirate faction rather than a formal clan: there is no central power structure or single ruler. Instead they are a loose alignment of small
column4: independent crews and pirate bands who raid

Text: "The Hapes Consortium is a matriarchal monarchy of the near-Human Hapans in the Hapes Cluster

column7: and had undergone a long period of isolation. Members of Hapes Consortium are known to go on pirate raides
column8: which is categorically denied by its government."

Text: "Kuat Drive Yards is among the oldest and largest military shipbuilding corporations in the galaxy. Based in orbital yards around the planet Kuat
column4: the company and its subsidiaries have manufactured everything from swoop bikes to the mighty Imperial-class Star Destroyer. \n Formed by a union of aristocrats known as the Ten

column6: to competition with larger corporations like Core Galaxy Systems and Hoersch-Kessel Drive
column7: Inc

column9: buying up smaller shipbuilders and operating outside the Kuat sector to earn its place. \n In the Clone Wars
column10: Kuat sold vehicles and vessels to the Republic
column11: including the mighty Venator-class Star Destroyer. During the Imperial Era
column12: Kuat manufactured the Imperial-class Star Destroyers and the All-Terrain series of walkers."

Text: "TransGalMeg Industries
column4: Incorporated is a large interstellar conglomerate specialising in the design and mass production of starships
column5: transport systems and related components.\n\nPragmatic and cost conscious
column6: TGM produced a broad catalogue of merchant freighters
column7: civilian transports
column8: modular hulls and light combat craft that proved popular with independent traders
column9: mercenary outfits and local governments. Its modular designs made vessels easy to adapt for commercial
column10: military or covert roles
column11:
and many hulls were licensed or locally modified across the Outer Rim.

Across the Republic and into the Imperial era TGM maintained a wide customer base. The company pursued legitimate government and corporate contracts while also undertaking profitable conversions and unofficial sales when advantageous. That willingness to serve varied clients earned TGM a reputation for commercial neutrality and occasional controversy among competitors and regulators.

By the height of Imperial power TGM operated multiple shipyards and engineering centres in core and rim systems and expanded into subsystems
column12: maintenance services and hyperspace transport hardware. Its products were rarely cutting edge
column13: but were valued for reliability
column14: low operating cost and ease of repair; traits that kept TGM hulls ubiquitous among independent captains and secondary fleets through the years following the Empire's fall."

Text: "Mon Calamari Shipyards is a shipwright company that produces numerous models of transports and warships. Operating out of the orbital shipyards of Mon Calamari
column4: MCS is renowned for its elegant
column5: organic-looking hulls. \n Formed more than four thousand years before the formation of the Galactic Empire
column6: Mon Calamari Shipyards was a collaborative effort between the two native species of Mon Calamari: The Mon Calamari and the Quarren. Dreaming of what lay beyond their oceanic world
column7: the company developed several orbital facilities to construct starliners and specialised exploration vessels. \n After the formation of the Galactic Empire
column8: the company and its home planet were subjugated and enslaved
column9: though the Imperials never managed to adapt Mon Calamari technology to Imperial standards. Mon Calamari Shipyards were still able to develop luxury starliners
column10: however
column11: and the company took advantage of this to secretly produce prototypes for warships. Eventually
column12: Mon Calamari overthrew Imperial occupation and used its orbital shipyards to retrofit its luxury liners into the infamous MC-series of star cruisers.\n\nThis corporation will not change alignment when captured!"

Text: "The Twin Suns Transport Service is a small shipping company. They employ a wide variety of freighters."
"Twin Suns Transport Services is a small but reliable shipping company operating throughout the galaxy. Founded in the decades before the Clone Wars

"The InterGalactic Banking Clan is a powerful financial institution that controls much of the galaxy's credit flow and monetary systems. Originally formed to facilitate commerce between distant star systems
column4: the Banking Clan grew into one of the most influential economic powers in galactic history.\n\nLed by the Muun species from the planet Scipio
column5: the Banking Clan maintained strict neutrality in galactic conflicts to protect its financial interests. However
column6: during the Clone Wars

Text: "No Description yet"

"The Mining Guild is a powerful conglomerate that controls vast mineral extraction operations across the galaxy. Originally formed to coordinate mining efforts and protect the interests of independent miners
column4:
the Guild gradually consolidated power and became one of the most influential corporate entities in galactic history.

Their distinctive TIE/mg Mining Guild starfighters became a common sight patrolling resource-rich asteroid fields and mining colonies.

Known for their aggressive acquisition tactics and ruthless exploitation of mineral rights
column5: the Mining Guild often operated on the edge of legality

"The Trade Federation is a powerful mercantile guild that once dominated galactic commerce through its vast shipping fleets and droid armies. Originally formed to protect trade interests and break monopolies
column4: the Federation grew into a corporate juggernaut with its own military force and political influence in the Galactic Senate.\n\nLed by the Neimoidians
column5: the Trade Federation became infamous for its blockade of Naboo and subsequent role in the Separatist movement during the Clone Wars. Though officially dissolved after the rise of the Empire
column6: various successor organizations and splinter groups continue to operate across the galaxy
column7: maintaining the Federation's legacy of aggressive business practices and corporate warfare.\n\nNow seeking to rebuild their former glory in the chaos following the Empire's fall
column8: these remnant Trade Federation elements pursue profit and power through any means necessary."

Text: "No Description yet"

"The Yuuzhan Vong are an enigmatic extragalactic species whose true nature remains shrouded in mystery. What little is known comes from scattered encounters with what military analysts believe are merely scout forces
column4: small probing incursions that hint at something far larger lurking beyond the galactic rim.\n\nTheir technology appears to be entirely biological in nature
column5: with vessels and weapons that seem grown rather than built
column6: pulsing with organic life. These living ships demonstrate capabilities that defy conventional understanding
column7: regenerating damage and adapting to threats in ways that suggest a fundamentally different approach to warfare and civilization.\n\nThe few encounters recorded have been universally hostile
column8: with these forces attacking without warning or any attempt at communication. Their warriors exhibit an unsettling coordination and purpose
column9: operating with mechanical precision despite their organic technology. Some xenobiologists theorize the Yuuzhan Vong may be absent from the Force itself
column10: though this remains unconfirmed speculation.\n\nIf these truly are only scouts
column11: the implications are dire. What manner of civilization sends such advanced forces merely to reconnoiter? What might their full invasion fleet be capable of? These questions haunt military strategists across the galaxy as sightings of these biological vessels become increasingly frequent in the Unknown Regions."

Text: "Unknown Threat"
"Beyond the borders of known space
column4: reports speak of mysterious vessels bearing no markings or identification. These ships demonstrate an unsettling uniformity in their construction and behavior
column5: operating with mechanical precision that suggests a singular purpose. Initial encounters have proven universally hostile
column6: with these forces attacking any biological crew they encounter without warning or communication.\n\nTheir technology appears to be entirely synthetic in nature
column7: with no signs of organic life support systems. Intelligence suggests these entities may represent the remnants of an ancient automated defense network
column8: now operating far beyond their original programming constraints. Some scholars theorize they seek to purge all biological life from the galaxy
column9: though their true objectives remain as enigmatic as their origins.\n\nWhat is certain is that wherever these metallic aggressors appear
column10: destruction follows. Their weapons are precise
column11: their tactics ruthless
column12: and their numbers appear to be self-replicating. The galaxy's various factions have begun to take notice of this emerging threat from the void."

Text: "The Mandalorians are a warrior culture from the Outer Rim

column7: Mandalorian traditions and their iconic beskar armour remain symbols of resilience and strength."

Text: "The Mandalorians are a warrior culture from the Outer Rim
column4: known for their highly advanced armour

column6: and a code centered around honour and survival\n\nThough their society has fractured over time
column7: Mandalorian traditions and their iconic beskar armour remain symbols of resilience and strength."

Text: "The Sith are a faction rooted in the pursuit of power and domination
column4: guided by the philosophy of the Dark Side of the Force. They are known for their mastery of manipulation
column5: advanced technology
column6: and the construction of vast empires built on fear and control. Once almost eradicated
column7: now rising to power again."

After a recent strangely coordinated ambush of Black Sun pirates

column5: and a bounty on your head was published. All members of your group were proclaimed as dangerous pirates and most factions will most probably shoot you on sight. Knowing the nature of this secret mission
column6: the only way out is to find a route back to NRL space without dying. Currently
column7: you are being chased by a group of pirate ships.\n\n"

"Attention Citizen! \(READ CAREFULLY!\)\nWe at the Galactic Immigration Agency want to help everyone to find their place in this vast universe. To help you and others like you
column4:
we gathered information from governments across the galaxy on the requirements for gaining citizenship and additional benefits and listed them below for your reference. 
You can always contact any station manager's office on any faction station to check on your citizenship documentation. 

What do these requirements mean?
Production Stations - stations with at least one production module and dock in government space.
Station Transactions - transactions from your stations and their subordinates in that government's space
column5: to that government.\nFrontier Defence Stations - station with an administration/claim module in a government sector bordering either a contested
column6: unclaimed
column7: or enemy sector.\n\n Please refer to the pamphlet that was sent in a separate message for a more detailed requirements list for citizenship by various governments."

Text: "Attention Citizen!\n\nBy galactic law and common sense you will now have to pay more attention to your ships as they require regular maintenance. There are a few ways to make your life easier
column4:
so pay attention! 
 NOTE: The Maintenance menu can be accessed through the player info menu-- look for a wrench icon!

HOW THE MAINTENANCE SYSTEM WORKS
1. The maintenance cycle occurs every 30 minutes
column5: and the Maintenance menu will display the time until the next cycle.\n2. The SHIP SUPPLIES ware can be bought from other factions
column6: or produced yourself with a Ship Supplies Module
column7: and stored at your Equipment Docks to be consumed.\n3.Each ship has a SUPPLY COST. The more powerful your faction is
column8: the higher that cost. Initially
column9: you will barely notice it
column10:
but with further development of your organisation this may change.
NOTE: The SUPPLY COST of a specific ship can be seen in its encyclopedia entry.
4.Each sector you own has a SUPPLY LEVEL which negates the SUPPLY COST of your ships. 
5.You can build Equipment Docks in your owned sectors to increase the SUPPLY LEVEL of that sector up to 3 times! Each size of maintenance module
column11: S/M
column12: L
column13: and XL
column14: adds 1 to that multiplier. Multiple modules of the same size are NOT cumulative
column15: so one of each per sector is enough.\nNOTE: Only one EQ dock per sector is considered
column16: and it should not have shipbuilding functionality-- SUCH STATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED! Equipment Docks may have ware production and Administration modules
column17: so you can combine your Ship Module production and your maintenance docks
column18: or your defence stations and maintenance docks
column19: or both!\n6. L/XL ships docked at player-owned EQ Docks will receive a 25% cut in their Supply Cost
column20: regardless of if that EQ Dock is in a player-owned sector.\n7. S/M ships docked at player-owned Carriers and Auxiliary ships will receive a 25% cut in their supply cost
column21: regardless of where the Carrier is.\n8. If the sum of SUPPLY LEVEL from your owned sectors and EQ docks is still not enough to cover your ships cumulative SUPPLY COST
column22: then SHIP SUPPLIES wares will be consumed randomly from all of your EQ docks across the galaxy
column23: usually 2 wares per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST.\nNOTE:  SHIP SUPPLIES can be consumed from any of your Equipment Docks
column24: though only EQ docks in your owned sectors will increase your SUPPLY LEVEL.\n9.If consuming SUPPLY WARES is still not enough to cover all SUPPLY COST of your ships
column25: then you will pay in money
column26: usually 5000 Credits per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST. \n\nFailing to pay the maintenance of your ships
column27: which includes wages to your hired crewmen
column28: will lead to morale loss among them."

column4: it is a prosperous trade and manufacturing world
column5: but was still considered as backwards as an Outer Rim planet: Beyond the relative safety of the spaceports
column6: Abregado-rae is a wilderness. Discovered ten millennia before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column7: Abregado was not colonised for thousands of years more. During the Jedi Civil War
column8: it joined Darth Revan's Sith Empire
column9: and during the Clone Wars Abregado remained part of the Republic."

Text: "Abregado-rae is a planet located in the Abregado system of the Core Worlds region
column4: positioned at the beginning of the Rimma Trade Route hyperlane. Despite its location in the Core
column5: Abregado-rae has long been considered a backwater world
column6: with a reputation more befitting an Outer Rim planet than one of the galaxy's central systems.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including vast plains
column7: mountain ranges
column8: and scattered urban centers. However
column9: beyond the relative safety of its spaceports
column10: Abregado-rae remains largely wild and undeveloped
column11: with dangerous wilderness areas dominating much of the landscape.\n\nAbregado-rae was discovered approximately ten thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column12: during the early expansion era of the Galactic Republic. Despite this early discovery
column13: the planet remained uncolonized for thousands of years afterward
column14: with settlers showing little interest in its remote location and challenging environment.\n\nEventually
column15: the Gado ethnic group established settlements on Abregado-rae
column16: giving the planet its name. These hardy colonists built their communities despite the planet's isolation and the dangers posed by its wilderness regions. Over time
column17: Abregado-rae developed a modest economy based on trade and light manufacturing
column18: though it never achieved the prosperity or prominence of other Core Worlds.\n\nThe planet's position at the start of the Rimma Trade Route gave it some strategic importance as a waypoint for vessels traveling between the Core and the Outer Rim. However
column19: this advantage was offset by the planet's reputation for lawlessness and danger outside its urban centers.\n\nDuring the Jedi Civil War
column20: approximately 3
column21: 959 years before the rise of the Empire
column22: Abregado-rae fell under the control of Darth Revan's Sith Empire. The planet remained in Sith hands until Revan's defeat and the restoration of Republic authority.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column23: Abregado-rae remained loyal to the Galactic Republic. The planet's strategic position along the Rimma Trade Route made it valuable for Republic military logistics
column24: serving as a waypoint for supply convoys moving through the Core.\n\nEarly in the Clone Wars
column25: the Malevolence
column26: a massive Separatist warship equipped with ion cannons capable of disabling entire fleets
column27: attacked Republic forces near Abregado-rae. The ship destroyed a Republic medical convoy in the Abregado system
column28: with few survivors. Jedi Master Plo Koon and several clone troopers were rescued from the wreckage by Anakin Skywalker and Ahsoka Tano before the Malevolence could finish them off.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column29: Abregado-rae came under Imperial control. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to monitor trade along the Rimma Trade Route and maintain order
column30: though the garrison remained relatively modest given the planet's backwater status.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column31: Abregado-rae remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. However
column32: the planet's reputation for lawlessness and its position along a major trade route made it a location of interest for both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. Smugglers and independent traders frequently used Abregado-rae as a waypoint
column33: taking advantage of the planet's loosely enforced regulations.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column34: Abregado-rae's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic positions along the Rimma Trade Route."

Text: "Adarlon is a planet in the Outer Rim
column4: along the Rimma Trade Route. Originally colonised by Alderaanians for its beauty
column5: more than its natural resources
column6: it developed a culture focused on entertainment instead of survival. It is one of the galaxy's most prominent centres of tourism and the entertainment industry."

Text: "Adarlon is a terrestrial planet located in the Outer Rim Territories along the Rimma Trade Route. Originally colonized by Alderaanian colonists who were drawn to the planet's natural beauty rather than its resource potential
column4: Adarlon developed a culture that emphasized art
column5: entertainment
column6: and leisure over industrial development.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including mountains
column7: forests
column8: and coastlines
column9: with settlements concentrated in areas of exceptional natural beauty. Unlike most frontier worlds
column10: Adarlon's economy evolved around tourism and the entertainment industry rather than mining or manufacturing. The capital city became a center for holodrama production
column11: music
column12: and various forms of artistic expression.\n\nAdarlon's unique cultural focus attracted artists
column13: performers
column14: and tourists from across the galaxy
column15: establishing it as one of the premier entertainment destinations in the Outer Rim. The planet's theaters
column16: concert halls
column17: and holodrama studios rivaled those of more established worlds in the Core.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column18: Adarlon maintained a degree of neutrality
column19: though its cultural ties to Alderaan meant many citizens sympathized with the Republic cause. The planet avoided major battles
column20: though its entertainment industry was affected by the galactic conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the destruction of Alderaan
column21: Adarlon experienced a cultural crisis. Many citizens mourned the loss of their ancestral homeworld
column22: and the planet became a gathering place for Alderaanian refugees and survivors. Despite this tragedy
column23: the entertainment industry continued
column24: though Imperial censorship and oversight brought new restrictions.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column25: Adarlon remained under Imperial control
column26: though many in the entertainment community secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance. Some artists and performers used their work to subtly criticize the Empire
column27: while others provided covert support to the Rebellion.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor
column28: Adarlon's remote location in the Outer Rim meant that no government made early claims on the system."

Text: "Agamar is a terrestrial planet in the Outer Rim. Once a part of the Rakatan Infinite Empire
column4: it remained somewhat independent of the later Galactic Republic and Sith Empires until after the Great Galactic war
column5: more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Agamar joined that Empire following the end of the Clone Wars
column6: though full control was never achieved
column7: and resistance to Imperial rule strengthened over time."

Text: "Agamar is a cold rocky planet located in the Agamar system of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Trax Tube hyperlane. Agamar developed as a modest farming world known for producing quality agricultural products.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column5: Agamar was part of the ancient Rakatan Infinite Empire. Following the collapse of that civilization
column6: the planet remained independent for millennia
column7: maintaining only sporadic contact with the Galactic Republic.\n\nApproximately 3
column8: 600 years before the rise of the Empire
column9: during the aftermath of the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire
column10: Agamar finally joined the Republic. The planet maintained its membership for thousands of years
column11: though its remote location meant Republic influence remained limited.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column12: Agamar remained loyal to the Republic
column13: though its isolation spared it from major battles. The planet continued its traditional agricultural economy throughout the conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column14: Agamar came under Imperial control. The Empire established a garrison on the planet to maintain order and collect taxes
column15: though full control was never achieved. The planet's rural population and scattered settlements made comprehensive Imperial oversight difficult.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column16: resistance to Imperial rule strengthened over time. Many Agamarians secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance
column17: providing covert support despite the risks. The planet's agricultural products continued to be exported throughout the Outer Rim
column18: though tensions between the local population and Imperial authorities remained high.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column19: Agamar's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for influence in the Outer Rim territories."

Text: "Ahch-To
column4: known by many names in ancient legends
column5: is a planet mostly covered in water
column6: with numerous rocky islands blanketed with green trees located in the Unknown Regions. It was the birthplace of the Jedi Order and held the ancient Jedi texts."

Text: "Ahch-To is a remote
column4: oceanic planet located in the Unknown Regions
column5: far from any known hyperspace routes. The planet's surface is almost entirely covered by endless seas
column6: with only scattered rocky islands breaking through the waves. These islands feature steep cliffs
column7: ancient stone structures
column8: and lush vegetation thriving in the temperate maritime climate.\n\nAhch-To holds immense significance as the legendary birthplace of the Jedi Order. Thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: the first Jedi Temple was established on one of Ahch-To's islands. This sacred site became the foundation of the Jedi Order
column10: serving as the initial gathering place for Force-sensitives seeking to understand the mysteries of the Force.\n\nThe planet's isolation made it ideal for contemplation and study. The Prime Jedi
column11: the first member of the Order
column12: meditated on Ahch-To and established the philosophical foundations that would guide the Jedi for millennia. The temple contained the original Jedi texts
column13: ancient documents recording the earliest teachings
column14: philosophies
column15: and discoveries about the Force.\n\nThese sacred texts included writings on Force philosophy
column16: meditation techniques
column17: and fundamental light side principles. They were inscribed on stone
column18: metal
column19: and specially treated materials designed to withstand time
column20: representing the accumulated wisdom of the earliest Force users.\n\nAs the Jedi Order grew and expanded
column21: Ahch-To's importance diminished. The Order established new temples on more accessible worlds
column22: and the remote planet gradually faded from memory. The hyperspace routes to Ahch-To were lost
column23: and its location became shrouded in mystery.\n\nBy the Old Republic era
column24: Ahch-To existed primarily in ancient Jedi lore. Most Jedi knew of it only through stories
column25: tales of the Order's mythical birthplace in the Unknown Regions. Its exact location became one of the Jedi's greatest mysteries.\n\nAhch-To is home to several native species. Porgs
column26: small avian creatures
column27: nest among the cliffs. Thala-sirens
column28: large aquatic mammals
column29: inhabit the surrounding seas. The Caretakers
column30: amphibious beings
column31: maintain the ancient Jedi structures
column32: preserving them even after the Order forgot the planet's location.\n\nThe climate features frequent storms
column33: strong winds
column34: and rough seas. The constant ocean presence influences all life
column35: from hardy vegetation to species adapted to marine and terrestrial environments.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars and the Empire's rise
column36: Ahch-To remained isolated from galactic events. The ancient temple continued to stand
column37: weathered but preserved by its remote location and the Caretakers' maintenance.\n\nFollowing Order 66 and the Jedi Order's fall
column38: Ahch-To's significance grew. With Jedi temples destroyed or desecrated by the Empire
column39: Ahch-To remained as one of few intact repositories of ancient Jedi knowledge. However
column40: its location remained unknown to both surviving Jedi and the Empire.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor
column41: Ahch-To continued its isolated existence
column42: unknown to the wider galaxy. The ancient temple and sacred texts remained hidden
column43: waiting to be rediscovered by those who might one day restore the Jedi Order."

Text: "Ajan Kloss is a jungle moon located in the Cademimu sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: in grid square L-5 on the Standard Galactic Grid
column5: orbiting the gas giant Ajara."

Text: "Ajan Kloss is a jungle moon located in the Cademimu sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: orbiting the gas giant Ajara. A lush
column5: forested world with dense vegetation and humid conditions
column6: Ajan Kloss remained largely unexplored and uninhabited throughout most of galactic history.\n\nThe moon's surface is covered in thick jungles featuring towering trees
column7: tangled undergrowth
column8: and numerous clearings suitable for landing zones. The abundant rainfall and fertile soil support a rich ecosystem
column9: though no sapient species are native to the moon.\n\nDue to its remote location far from major hyperspace routes
column10: Ajan Kloss attracted little attention from galactic governments or explorers. The moon's isolation and lack of strategic resources meant it remained pristine and untouched by industrial development.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Ajan Kloss was occasionally noted on star charts as a potential waypoint for explorers venturing into the Unknown Regions
column12: though few vessels made the journey to its location. The moon's dense jungles and lack of civilization made it an unappealing destination for colonization efforts.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars and the subsequent rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Ajan Kloss remained undisturbed. Its distance from the conflicts that engulfed the galaxy allowed the moon to maintain its pristine natural state.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column14: Ajan Kloss continued its existence in obscurity
column15: unknown to both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. The moon's thick canopy and remote location made it an ideal hiding place
column16: though no faction utilized it during this period.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and throughout the early years of the New Republic
column17: Ajan Kloss remained an unremarkable jungle moon on the fringes of explored space
column18: its potential as a base or refuge yet to be discovered."

Text: "Once a planet of great wealth and influence
column4: now its a monument to horrendous atrocities of the Empire."

Text: "Alderaan was a terrestrial planet in the Core Worlds
column4: one of the Republic's founding members for over 25
column5: 000 years. Known for its natural beauty
column6: peaceful philosophy
column7: and cultural achievements
column8: Alderaan was a center of learning and diplomacy throughout galactic history.\n\nThe planet featured diverse terrain including mountains
column9: plains
column10: oceans
column11: and forests
column12: with cities built to harmonize with the environment. The University of Alderaan was among the galaxy's most prestigious institutions
column13: while Alderaanian artists and philosophers contributed immeasurably to galactic culture.\n\nAlderaan maintained its commitment to peace throughout its history
column14: refusing to keep a standing military beyond a ceremonial guard. During the Clone Wars
column15: Viceroy Bail Organa led the planet in supporting the Republic while providing humanitarian aid across the galaxy. As Chancellor Palpatine accumulated power
column16: Organa grew increasingly concerned about democratic erosion
column17: working with Senators Padmé Amidala and Mon Mothma to oppose the growing authoritarianism.\n\nAfter Order 66 and the Empire's rise
column18: Bail Organa publicly accepted Imperial rule to protect his people while secretly founding the Alliance to Restore the Republic. He adopted Padmé's daughter Leia
column19: raising her as Princess of Alderaan. The planet became the Rebellion's secret headquarters
column20: with Organa using Alderaan's wealth and diplomatic connections to fund and organize resistance.\n\nPrincess Leia joined her father's cause
column21: serving as both Imperial Senator and key Rebel leader. However
column22: Imperial authorities grew suspicious of Alderaan's role in supporting the Rebellion.\n\nIn 0 BBY
column23: after capturing Princess Leia with the stolen Death Star plans
column24: Grand Moff Tarkin brought the battle station to Alderaan. To force Leia to reveal the Rebel base location
column25: he threatened to destroy her homeworld. Despite Leia providing false information
column26: Tarkin ordered Alderaan destroyed anyway ""to demonstrate the power of this station.""\n\nThe Death Star's superlaser fired
column27: completely destroying Alderaan and killing all two billion inhabitants instantly. The planet shattered into asteroids
column28: erasing thousands of years of culture and civilization in moments. The massive loss of life created a disturbance in the Force felt across the galaxy.\n\nRather than intimidating the galaxy into submission
column29: Alderaan's destruction galvanized support for the Rebellion. ""Remember Alderaan"" became a rallying cry
column30: strengthening resistance against Imperial tyranny. Shortly after
column31: the Rebel Alliance destroyed the Death Star at the Battle of Yavin.\n\nThe asteroid field known as 'the Graveyard' became a memorial to the destroyed world. Only a few hundred thousand Alderaanians who were off-planet survived
column32: scattered as refugees throughout the galaxy. These survivors worked to preserve their culture and ensure their homeworld's legacy endured.\n\nPrincess Leia
column33: devastated but defiant
column34: continued leading the Rebellion with renewed determination. After Endor
column35: she helped establish the New Republic
column36: working to build the democratic institutions Alderaan had championed. Though Alderaan was gone
column37: its ideals of compassion
column38: justice
column39: and commitment to peace continued inspiring the galaxy
column40: serving as both a reminder of Imperial cruelty and a symbol of resistance against tyranny."

Text: "The Andalia system is located in the Lorelli Reach
column4: an area of the Hapes Cluster in the Slice portion of the Inner Rim. It is connected by the hyperlane known as the Lorell Route to the Lorell and Sennex systems."

Text: "Andalia is a star system located in the Lorelli Reach region of the Hapes Cluster
column4: within the Inner Rim Territories. The system lies along the Lorell Route hyperlane
column5: connecting it to the neighboring Lorell and Sennex systems.\n\nThe Hapes Cluster
column6: including the Andalia system
column7: remained isolated from the greater galaxy for thousands of years
column8: protected by the dangerous Transitory Mists that surround the cluster. This isolation allowed the Hapan culture to develop independently under matriarchal rule.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column9: the Andalia system was part of the territory controlled by the Lorell Raiders
column10: pirates who preyed upon passing ships until they were defeated by the Jedi. Following their defeat
column11: the surviving pirates and their captured mates formed the basis of Hapan society
column12: establishing the matriarchal traditions that would define the Hapes Consortium.\n\nThroughout the millennia that followed
column13: Andalia remained under the control of the Queen Mother and the Hapan Royal Court. The system maintained the isolationist policies that characterized the Hapes Consortium
column14: with limited contact with the outside galaxy.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars and throughout the Galactic Civil War
column15: the Hapes Consortium maintained its traditional neutrality
column16: and Andalia remained isolated from the conflict that engulfed much of the galaxy. The Transitory Mists continued to serve as a natural barrier
column17: protecting the system from outside interference.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column18: the Hapes Consortium began to cautiously open diplomatic relations with the outside galaxy."

Text: "Annaj is a fog-covered planet in the Outer Rim. First discovered three hundred years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column4: it is the first stop for most ships into it remote region of the galaxy. It served as a staging area for the Imperial Navy during the construction of the second Death Star
column5: and Imperial forces retreated here after its destruction."

Text: "Annaj is a remote
column4: fog-shrouded planet located in the Outer Rim Territories. A world perpetually covered in thick mists and atmospheric haze
column5: Annaj's surface features varied terrain including forests
column6: plains
column7: and scattered settlements adapted to the planet's limited visibility conditions.\n\nDiscovered approximately three hundred years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column8: Annaj's strategic position made it valuable as a waypoint for vessels traveling into isolated sectors. Despite its remote location
column9: the planet developed a modest population based on serving traders and explorers venturing into the deep Outer Rim and Wild Space.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column10: Annaj maintained a quiet existence as a frontier world. The planet joined the Galactic Republic but remained largely peripheral to Core Worlds politics and conflicts. Throughout the Clone Wars
column11: Annaj's isolation spared it from direct involvement in the conflict between the Republic and the Separatists.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column12: Annaj's fate changed dramatically when Imperial strategists recognized its potential value. The planet's remote location and natural concealment provided by perpetual fog made it attractive for covert military operations.\n\nDuring construction of the second Death Star above Endor
column13: Annaj's importance increased significantly. The Empire designated the planet as a major staging area for the Imperial Navy
column14: coordinating supply shipments and troop movements to the Endor system. The fog-covered world proved ideal for concealing the massive military buildup
column15: with Star Destroyers and supply vessels using Annaj as a mustering point before proceeding to Endor.\n\nImperial forces constructed expanded military facilities on Annaj's surface and in orbit
column16: transforming the quiet frontier world into a bustling military hub. The local population found themselves under increased Imperial oversight as garrison troops and naval personnel flooded the planet. The Empire maintained strict security protocols
column17: restricting civilian traffic and monitoring communications to prevent information leaks to the Rebel Alliance.\n\nFollowing the Battle of Endor and the destruction of the second Death Star
column18: Annaj again played a crucial role. As news of the Emperor's death reached Imperial forces
column19: many commanders ordered vessels to fall back to pre-designated rally points. Annaj
column20: having served as a staging area during construction
column21: was one such location.\n\nImperial forces retreated to Annaj in significant numbers
column22: with Star Destroyers gathering at the fog-shrouded world while commanders assessed the situation. The planet became a temporary refuge for Imperial personnel evacuating from Endor and nearby sectors where Rebel forces advanced.\n\nThe concentration of Imperial assets made Annaj strategically significant immediately after Endor
column23: though the Empire's fractured command structure meant little coordination among forces that had retreated there. Some commanders sought to regroup and continue fighting
column24: while others questioned whether the Empire could survive.\n\nAs months passed and the full extent of the Empire's defeat became clear
column25: Imperial forces at Annaj began to disperse. Some vessels departed to join Imperial warlords and remnant factions
column26: while others were recalled to defend Core territories. The planet's brief moment as a major Imperial stronghold faded as the Empire's authority fragmented.\n\nAfter formation of the New Republic
column27: Annaj's status became uncertain as various factions competed for control of strategic Outer Rim positions."

Text: "Anoat is one of three habitable planets in the Anoat system of the Anoat sector
column4: located in the Greater Javin of the Outer Rim. It is located between the Hoth system and the Bespin system."

Text: "Anoat is a heavily polluted industrial world located in the Anoat system of the Greater Javin region in the Outer Rim Territories. Positioned strategically between the Hoth and Bespin systems along the Ison Corridor
column4: Anoat has long served as a waypoint for travelers navigating this remote sector of space.\n\nThe planet's surface is dominated by sprawling industrial complexes
column5: factories
column6: and mining operations that have transformed much of the landscape into a haze-covered wasteland. Centuries of unchecked industrialization have resulted in severe atmospheric pollution
column7: with toxic smog blanketing many urban areas. Despite these harsh conditions
column8: Anoat maintains a substantial population of workers
column9: traders
column10: and various species drawn by employment opportunities in its factories and shipyards.\n\nAnoat's economy revolves primarily around heavy manufacturing and resource processing. The planet's industrial infrastructure produces everything from starship components to mining equipment
column11: with goods exported throughout the Greater Javin region and beyond. However
column12: the environmental cost of this industrial prowess has been severe
column13: with large sections of the planet rendered nearly uninhabitable by pollution and industrial waste.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column14: Anoat was discovered by early explorers charting the Ison Corridor. The planet's mineral wealth and strategic location made it an attractive target for colonization
column15: and within a few centuries
column16: it had developed into a significant industrial center. However
column17: the lack of environmental regulations during this period of rapid growth set the stage for the ecological degradation that would define the planet's future.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column18: Anoat remained officially neutral
column19: though its industrial output made it valuable to both the Republic and the Separatists. The planet's factories continued operation throughout the conflict
column20: selling to whoever could pay
column21: which earned Anoat a reputation for pragmatism over ideology.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column22: Anoat fell under Imperial control. The Empire pressed the planet's industrial capacity into service
column23: establishing garrison forces and administrative oversight to ensure continued production of military equipment. Imperial occupation brought increased regulation but also increased quotas
column24: further straining the planet's already stressed environment and workforce.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column25: Anoat remained under firm Imperial control due to its strategic position near both Hoth and Bespin. Following the Battle of Hoth
column26: when the Rebel Alliance evacuated their base on that frozen world
column27: many fleeing Rebel ships passed through or near the Anoat system.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column28: the Imperial forces in the Greater Javin region
column29: including Anoat
column30: established what became known as the Iron Blockade. This military cordon sealed off the entire sector from the rest of the galaxy
column31: with Imperial authorities refusing to acknowledge reports of the Emperor's demise. The blockade lasted for several months
column32: during which time the sector remained isolated
column33: with residents unaware of the dramatic changes occurring in the broader galaxy.\n\nEventually
column34: the Iron Blockade collapsed as Imperial authority fragmented
column35: and news of the Empire's defeat finally reached Anoat. The planet subsequently came under the influence of various factions competing for control in the post-Imperial era
column36: including the New Republic
column37: Imperial remnants
column38: and criminal organizations seeking to exploit the power vacuum."

Text: "Ansion is a planet in the Mid Rim near Vortex and Bilbringi
column4: located on the Namadii Corridor."

Text: "Ansion is a temperate grassland planet located in the Mid Rim region of the galaxy
column4: positioned along the Namadii Corridor hyperlane near Vortex and Bilbringi. The planet's surface is dominated by vast prairies known as the Unity of Community
column5: where enormous herds of native herbivores roam freely across the endless plains.\n\nThe planet is home to two sentient species: the Ansionians
column6: a humanoid race who live primarily in cities
column7: and the Alwari
column8: nomadic tribes who inhabit the prairies and maintain a traditional lifestyle centered around herding and tribal customs. The Alwari are divided into numerous clans
column9: each with their own territories and traditions
column10: and they have historically maintained an uneasy relationship with the city-dwelling Ansionians.\n\nAnsion's importance to the Galactic Republic extended beyond its own borders due to a complex web of treaties and alliances with neighboring systems. The planet served as a linchpin in a network of agreements that bound together numerous Mid Rim worlds. Should Ansion secede from the Republic
column11: these treaty obligations would potentially trigger a cascade of secessions throughout the region.\n\nDuring the final years of the Galactic Republic
column12: tensions between the Ansionians and the Alwari threatened the planet's stability. The Separatist movement
column13: recognizing Ansion's strategic importance
column14: sought to exploit these tensions to encourage the planet to join the Confederacy of Independent Systems.\n\nIn the months before the Clone Wars
column15: the Jedi Council dispatched a team of Jedi
column16: including Luminara Unduli and her Padawan Barriss Offee
column17: along with Obi-Wan Kenobi and his Padawan Anakin Skywalker
column18: to mediate the disputes between the Ansionians and the Alwari. The mission proved successful
column19: with the Jedi helping to broker a peace agreement that satisfied both groups and kept Ansion loyal to the Republic.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column20: Ansion remained under Republic control
column21: though its strategic position made it a target of interest for both sides of the conflict. The planet's vast grasslands and relatively sparse urban development meant that much of the world remained largely unaffected by the wider galactic war.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column22: Ansion came under Imperial authority. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to ensure compliance with Imperial law
column23: though the traditional way of life of the Alwari tribes continued much as it had for generations. The grasslands of Ansion remained largely unchanged
column24: with the great herds continuing their ancient migrations across the plains.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column25: Ansion's strategic location along the Namadii Corridor meant it remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. However
column26: the planet's complex treaty network
column27: which had once bound it so closely to the Republic
column28: had largely dissolved under Imperial rule
column29: diminishing its former strategic importance.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column30: Ansion sits precariously on the border on the border of the remnants of the Empire. Many hope that the restoration of democracy will bring renewed prosperity to the planet and its people."

Text: "Arkanis is the sector capital of the Arkanis sector. It is inhabited by Humans such as Devon Fuller. It was the throneworld of the Arkanis Regency
column4: which included the ancient Empress Teeda."

Text: "Arkanis is a terrestrial planet located in the Arkanis sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Triellus Trade Route. The sector capital and a significant regional hub
column5: Arkanis has played an important role in Outer Rim politics and military affairs for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column6: forests
column7: and mountain ranges
column8: with a climate suitable for human habitation. Arkanis developed into a moderately populated world with several major cities and spaceports that served as waypoints for travelers along the Triellus Trade Route.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: Arkanis served as the throneworld of the Arkanis Regency
column10: a powerful government that controlled much of the surrounding sector. The ancient Empress Teeda ruled from Arkanis
column11: establishing traditions and governmental structures that influenced the region for millennia to come.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column12: Arkanis joined the Galactic Republic and became an important administrative center for the Outer Rim. The planet maintained steady economic growth through trade and served as a regional military staging point during various conflicts throughout the millennia.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column13: Arkanis remained loyal to the Republic
column14: serving as a logistics hub for Republic forces operating in the Outer Rim. The planet's strategic position along the Triellus Trade Route made it valuable for military operations in the surrounding sectors.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column15: Arkanis took on even greater importance. The Empire recognized the planet's strategic value and established it as a major military center. The Imperial Academy on Arkanis became one of the most prestigious military training facilities in the Outer Rim
column16: producing officers for both the Imperial Army and Navy.\n\nThe Arkanis Academy developed a reputation for excellence
column17: with its graduates serving throughout the Imperial military. The facility emphasized discipline
column18: tactical training
column19: and loyalty to the Empire
column20: producing some of the Imperial military's most capable officers.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column21: Arkanis remained firmly under Imperial control. The planet's military installations and strategic location made it a priority for Imperial defense. The Empire maintained a strong garrison on Arkanis throughout the conflict
column22: using it as a staging point for operations against Rebel forces in the Outer Rim.\n\nThe planet's industrial infrastructure supported the Imperial war effort
column23: producing military equipment and supplies. Arkanis's shipyards
column24: while smaller than those of major industrial worlds
column25: contributed vessels and components to the Imperial Navy.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column26: Arkanis found itself under Commerce Guild control as various warlords and Imperial remnant factions competed for dominance in the Outer Rim. The planet's military tradition and strategic importance made it a valuable asset in the post-Imperial power struggles."

Text: "Ast Kikorie
column4: also called ""Down Below""
column5: is a planet in Moddell sector. It was a Galactic Republic astrocartographic research outpost with a ring of orbiting telescopes connected to Kikorie City by a skyhook. The planet was abandoned by the Republic at the onset of the Clone Wars in 22 BBY."

Text: "Ast Kikorie is a terrestrial planet located in the Moddell sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned in grid square H-16 of the Standard Galactic Grid. The planet is locally known by the colloquial name ""Down Below
column5: a reference that reflects its position relative to the orbital infrastructure that has defined the system throughout its recorded history.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain suitable for habitation
column6: though it never developed into a major population center. During the Old Republic era
column7: Ast Kikorie was selected by the Galactic Republic as the site for an astrocartographic research outpost
column8: recognizing the system's strategic value for mapping and studying the Outer Rim Territories and the regions beyond.\n\nThe Republic established an extensive orbital telescope array around Ast Kikorie
column9: creating a sophisticated astronomical observation network. Multiple space telescopes were positioned in strategic orbits
column10: their advanced sensor arrays designed to peer deep into unexplored regions of space. These telescopes worked in coordination
column11: providing Republic astronomers and cartographers with unprecedented data about distant star systems
column12: potential hyperspace routes
column13: and stellar phenomena.\n\nKikorie City
column14: the primary settlement on Ast Kikorie's surface
column15: served as the administrative and operational center for the research facility. The city was connected to the orbital telescope ring by an impressive skyhook - a massive space elevator that allowed personnel
column16: equipment
column17: and data to move efficiently between the surface and the orbiting research stations. This engineering marvel became one of the defining features of the Ast Kikorie system
column18: visible from great distances as vessels approached the planet.\n\nThe astrocartographic research conducted at Ast Kikorie proved valuable to the Republic's understanding of the Outer Rim and the Unknown Regions beyond. Data collected by the orbital telescopes helped refine navigational charts
column19: identify potentially habitable worlds for future colonization
column20: and monitor stellar activity that might affect hyperspace routes. Republic scientists and researchers stationed at Kikorie City analyzed this constant stream of information
column21: contributing to the Republic's growing knowledge of the galaxy.\n\nHowever
column22: the outbreak of the Clone Wars in 22 BBY dramatically altered Ast Kikorie's status. As the conflict between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems engulfed much of the galaxy
column23: the Republic was forced to reassess its priorities and redeploy resources to support the war effort. Remote research facilities like Ast Kikorie
column24: while scientifically valuable
column25: were deemed non-essential compared to the immediate needs of the Grand Army of the Republic.\n\nFaced with the necessity of concentrating forces and resources in strategically vital systems
column26: the Republic made the difficult decision to abandon Ast Kikorie at the onset of the Clone Wars. Research personnel were evacuated from both Kikorie City and the orbital stations
column27: taking with them whatever equipment and data could be transported. The orbital telescope array and the skyhook were left behind
column28: too massive and complex to dismantle and relocate on short notice.\n\nThe abandonment of Ast Kikorie represented a significant loss to Republic scientific endeavors
column29: as the sophisticated observation network had been operational for generations and had accumulated vast archives of astronomical data. However
column30: the exigencies of war left Republic leadership with little choice but to prioritize military necessities over scientific research.\n\nFollowing the Republic's withdrawal
column31: Ast Kikorie became a ghost world. Kikorie City stood empty
column32: its buildings and facilities gradually succumbing to neglect and the elements. The orbital telescope array continued to orbit the planet
column33: though without maintenance or supervision
column34: many of the instruments began to fail or drift out of alignment. The skyhook
column35: once a marvel of engineering
column36: remained suspended between surface and orbit
column37: a silent monument to the Republic's abandoned ambitions in the Outer Rim.\n\nThe Clone Wars raged across the galaxy while Ast Kikorie remained isolated and forgotten. Neither the Republic nor the Confederacy showed interest in reoccupying the system
column38: as its scientific infrastructure held little military value and its remote location made it strategically insignificant to the larger conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the end of the Clone Wars
column39: Ast Kikorie remained abandoned. The Empire showed no interest in resuming the Republic's astrocartographic research at the facility
column40: focusing its astronomical efforts elsewhere. The once-proud research outpost continued to deteriorate
column41: with Kikorie City slowly being reclaimed by nature and the orbital infrastructure degrading without maintenance.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column42: Ast Kikorie's abandoned status persisted. The planet's remote location and lack of resources meant neither the Empire nor the Rebel Alliance devoted attention to the forgotten world. Occasional scavengers and salvagers might have visited the system seeking to strip valuable components from the orbital telescopes or the skyhook
column43: though the difficulty of such operations and the remote location limited such activity.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column44: Ast Kikorie remained an abandoned outpost
column45: a reminder of the Republic's peaceful scientific endeavors that had been sacrificed to the necessities of war. The orbital telescope array
column46: or what remained of it
column47: continued to circle the planet
column48: a derelict monument to astronomical research and the cost of galactic conflict."

Text: "Atrisia
column4: also known as Kitel Phard
column5: is a terrestrial planet located in the Core Worlds sector known as the Atrisian Commonwealth. It lay on the Giju Run hyperlane and is the homeworld of the creature known as the shredder bat."

Text: "Atrisia is a terrestrial planet located in the Core Worlds region of the galaxy
column4: positioned along the Giju Run hyperlane within the Atrisian Commonwealth sector. The capital world of the Kitel Phard Dynasty and later the Atrisian Commonwealth
column5: Atrisia has maintained a proud and independent culture for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including mountains
column6: forests
column7: and plains
column8: with a temperate climate suitable for agriculture and habitation. Atrisian society developed a highly refined culture emphasizing honor
column9: martial prowess
column10: and artistic achievement. The native human population
column11: known as Atrisians
column12: are renowned throughout the galaxy for their distinctive cultural traditions
column13: including elaborate tea ceremonies
column14: calligraphy
column15: and martial arts.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column16: Atrisia was discovered by early Republic explorers and became one of the first Core Worlds to join the Galactic Republic. Despite its membership in the Republic
column17: Atrisia maintained considerable autonomy and preserved its unique cultural identity throughout the millennia. The planet developed into a regional power within the Core
column18: with the Atrisian Commonwealth extending influence over several neighboring systems.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column19: Atrisia was known for producing skilled warriors
column20: diplomats
column21: and artists. The planet's military tradition emphasized discipline and strategic thinking
column22: with Atrisian officers serving with distinction in Republic forces. However
column23: Atrisia also maintained its own defense forces
column24: reflecting the world's independent nature.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column25: Atrisia remained loyal to the Republic
column26: though the planet's leadership was cautious about becoming too deeply involved in the conflict. The Atrisian government provided support to the Republic war effort while focusing on maintaining stability within the Commonwealth.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column27: Atrisia initially accepted Imperial rule
column28: though many Atrisians were uncomfortable with the authoritarian nature of the new government. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to ensure compliance
column29: though Atrisia's strategic importance and economic value meant the Empire was cautious about interfering too heavily in local affairs.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column30: Atrisia remained under Imperial control
column31: serving as an important administrative and economic center in the Core Worlds. The planet's shipyards and manufacturing facilities contributed to the Imperial war effort
column32: though many Atrisians privately sympathized with the Rebel Alliance.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column33: Atrisia's leadership retained independance continuing to preserve Atrisian cultural traditions and autonomy."

Text: "Bakura is a planet located in the galaxy's Wild Space. It is connected to the planet Endor by a hyperspace route."
"Bakura is a remote planet located in Wild Space
column4: positioned at the far edge of explored space beyond the Outer Rim Territories. Discovered relatively late in galactic history
column5: Bakura remained isolated from the broader galactic community for much of its existence
column6: connected to the rest of known space by a single
column7: tenuous hyperspace route through the Endor system.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column8: forests
column9: and mountains
column10: with a climate suitable for human habitation. Bakura developed a primarily agricultural economy
column11: known throughout Wild Space for producing high-quality crops and foodstuffs. The planet's isolation meant it maintained a degree of independence from Core Worlds politics
column12: though it eventually joined the Galactic Republic.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column13: Bakura remained a quiet frontier world
column14: its remote location sparing it from most galactic conflicts. The planet's inhabitants developed a conservative
column15: traditional society that valued self-reliance and community cooperation. Despite its isolation
column16: Bakura maintained contact with the Republic through its single hyperspace route.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column17: Bakura's distance from the main conflict zones meant it saw little direct involvement in the fighting. The planet remained nominally loyal to the Republic
column18: though its isolation meant Republic authority was limited.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column19: Bakura came under Imperial control. The Empire established a garrison on the planet and used it as a remote outpost for monitoring Wild Space. Imperial presence brought increased oversight and regulation to the traditionally independent Bakurans
column20: causing growing resentment among the population.\n\nFollowing the Battle of Endor
column21: the planet's strategic position as a gateway to Wild Space and unknown regions made it valuable despite its isolation. However
column22: Bakura maintained a degree of autonomy
column23: with the Bakuran Senate retaining significant control over local affairs."

Text: "Balmorra is a factory world that is located within the Balmorra system
column4: situated in a strategic position between the Colonies and the border of the Core Worlds. Due to its intense industrial manufacturing it is known as one of the most important foundry worlds in the Republic's space
column5: where some of the most advanced weaponry and battle droids were constantly produced throughout most of the planet's history."

Text: "Balmorra is a heavily industrialized planet located in the Balmorra system of the Colonies region
column4: positioned strategically between the Colonies and the Core Worlds along the Hydian Way hyperlane. One of the most important manufacturing worlds in the galaxy
column5: Balmorra has been a major producer of weapons
column6: droids
column7: and military equipment for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface is dominated by sprawling factories
column8: weapons foundries
column9: and industrial complexes that stretch across much of the landmass. Massive production facilities produce everything from blaster rifles to battle droids
column10: with Balmorra's reputation for quality military hardware making it a prize sought by various galactic powers throughout history.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column11: Balmorra was discovered and colonized
column12: quickly developing into an industrial powerhouse. The planet joined the Galactic Republic and became one of its primary sources of military equipment. Balmorran Arms
column13: one of the galaxy's premier weapons manufacturers
column14: established its headquarters on the planet and became synonymous with reliable
column15: effective weaponry.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column16: Balmorra maintained steady growth as demand for its products increased. The planet's factories produced arms for Republic military forces and sold weapons to private buyers throughout known space. Balmorran society became heavily focused on industry and manufacturing
column17: with most of the population employed in factories or related support industries.\n\nApproximately 3
column18: 600 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column19: during the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire
column20: Balmorra became a major target. The Sith Empire recognized the planet's strategic value and launched an invasion to seize control of its weapons production. The Battle of Balmorra saw intense fighting as Republic forces attempted to defend the factories from Sith occupation.\n\nDespite determined resistance
column21: the Sith Empire succeeded in conquering Balmorra
column22: holding the planet for much of the subsequent Cold War period. The occupation proved costly for both sides
column23: with Balmorran resistance fighters conducting guerrilla warfare against Imperial forces while the Sith worked to maintain production of weapons for their war machine. The planet changed hands several times over the following decades as the conflict between Republic and Empire continued.\n\nEventually
column24: Balmorra was liberated and returned to Republic control
column25: though the planet bore significant scars from years of warfare. The factories were rebuilt and modernized
column26: and Balmorra resumed its role as a major weapons supplier to the Republic.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column27: Balmorra remained loyal to the Galactic Republic
column28: with its factories producing military equipment for the Grand Army of the Republic. The planet's droid foundries manufactured battle droids for Republic use
column29: while its weapons facilities supplied blasters and other arms to clone troopers throughout the conflict. Balmorra's industrial capacity proved crucial to the Republic's war effort.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column30: Balmorra came under Imperial control. The Empire immediately recognized the planet's value and established a strong military presence to ensure continued production. Imperial authorities nationalized much of Balmorra's industry
column31: pressing the factories into service producing weapons and equipment exclusively for the Imperial military.\n\nThe transition to Imperial rule proved controversial among Balmorra's population. Many Balmorrans resented the Empire's heavy-handed control over their industries and the loss of independence that came with nationalization. However
column32: the Empire's overwhelming military presence made open resistance difficult.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column33: Balmorra remained under firm Imperial control due to its strategic importance. The Empire maintained a substantial garrison to protect the weapons factories and suppress any potential resistance. However
column34: many Balmorrans secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance
column35: and underground resistance movements operated covertly despite the risks.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column36: Balmorra's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of the valuable industrial world. The planet's weapons production made it a crucial asset in the post-Imperial conflicts
column37: with multiple factions recognizing that controlling Balmorra meant controlling a significant source of military hardware."

Text: "Bandomeer is a planet in the Outer Rim Territories
column4: on the Braxant Run. It is known for its high concentration of ionite
column5: as well as the many predators lurking in its wildernesses. The planet's surface is roughly divided in half by a huge landmass and the Great Sea of Bandomeer."

Text: "Bandomeer is a planet located in the Outer Rim Territories along the Braxant Run hyperlane. A mineral-rich world known for its extensive ionite deposits
