column4: Bandomeer has long been exploited by mining corporations seeking to extract its valuable resources.\n\nThe planet's surface is roughly divided between a single large landmass and the Great Sea of Bandomeer. The terrain is characterized by rocky highlands
column5: deep canyons
column6: and scattered forests
column7: with much of the landscape scarred by open-pit mining operations. Bandomeer's ecosystem includes various predatory species that lurk in the wilderness areas beyond the mining settlements.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column8: Bandomeer was discovered and quickly became a target for mining interests. The planet's ionite deposits
column9: used in various technological applications throughout the galaxy
column10: made it economically valuable despite its remote location. However
column11: the intensive mining operations came at a severe cost to both the environment and the native Meerian species.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column12: Bandomeer fell under the control of various mining corporations
column13: most notably Offworld Mining Corporation and its rival Arcona Mineral Harvest Corporation. These companies employed both free workers and slaves in brutal conditions
column14: with little regard for safety or the wellbeing of their workforce. The planet developed a reputation as a harsh and dangerous place where fortunes could be made
column15: but lives were cheap.\n\nThe Meerians
column16: Bandomeer's native sentient species
column17: suffered greatly under corporate exploitation. Many were displaced from their ancestral lands as mining operations expanded
column18: while others were forced into indentured servitude working in the mines. The Meerians' traditional way of life
column19: which had existed for millennia
column20: was systematically destroyed by the relentless pursuit of profit.\n\nApproximately forty years before the rise of the Empire
column21: the young Jedi Initiate Obi-Wan Kenobi was assigned to the Jedi Agricultural Corps and sent to Bandomeer
column22: having not been chosen as a Padawan. During his journey
column23: he encountered the legendary Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn and became embroiled in a conflict between Offworld Mining Corporation and Arcona Mineral Harvest Corporation. Through these events
column24: Kenobi demonstrated his capabilities and eventually became Qui-Gon's Padawan
column25: beginning a partnership that would have profound implications for galactic history.\n\nThe conflict on Bandomeer exposed the corrupt practices of Offworld Mining Corporation
column26: led by the ruthless Xanatos
column27: a former Jedi who had turned to darkness. The corporation's defeat led to some reforms in mining operations on the planet
column28: though exploitation continued under different management.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column29: Bandomeer remained a relatively minor world
column30: its remote location and focus on resource extraction keeping it largely isolated from the main theaters of conflict. The planet continued to supply ionite and other minerals to the Republic war effort
column31: though under improved labor conditions compared to previous eras.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column32: Bandomeer came under Imperial oversight. The Empire maintained interest in the planet's mineral wealth
column33: using it to supply various Imperial projects. However
column34: the Empire's own labor practices often proved as harsh as those of the old mining corporations
column35: with political prisoners and other forced laborers sent to work in Bandomeer's mines.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column36: Bandomeer remained under Imperial control
column37: serving as a source of raw materials for the Imperial war machine. The planet's isolation and lack of strategic military importance meant it avoided major battles
column38: though local resistance movements occasionally disrupted mining operations.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column39: Bandomeer's status remained uncertain as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of resource-rich worlds in the Outer Rim. The planet's long history of exploitation and environmental degradation continued to impact its population and ecosystem
column40: though there were hopes that new governance might bring reforms to the mining industry and improved conditions for workers and the native Meerians."

Text: "Bastion is an industrialised planet located in the Outer Rim Territories of the galaxy. Also part of the New Territories
column4: it is connected via hyperspace route to Anthan Prime."

Text: "Bastion is a heavily industrialized planet located in the Braxant sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Braxant Run hyperlane. A world of varied terrain including plains
column5: forests
column6: and mountain ranges
column7: Bastion remained relatively obscure for much of galactic history until it became one of the most important worlds in the post-Imperial era.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column8: Bastion was discovered and settled
column9: though it never developed into a major population center. The planet maintained a modest economy based on light manufacturing and agriculture
column10: with most inhabitants living quiet lives far from the political intrigues of the Core Worlds.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column11: Bastion remained under Republic control
column12: though its remote location spared it from major battles. The planet continued its traditional way of life despite the surrounding galactic conflicts.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Bastion fell under Imperial authority. The Empire recognized the planet's potential for industrial development and began establishing manufacturing facilities and military installations. Imperial oversight brought increased regulation and development to what had been a relatively backwater world.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column14: Bastion remained under Imperial control
column15: serving as a minor industrial center and garrison world. The planet's location along the Braxant Run made it strategically useful for Imperial operations in the Outer Rim.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column16: Bastion's importance increased dramatically. As the Empire collapsed and various warlords carved out their own territories
column17: Bastion emerged as a rallying point for Imperial forces seeking to preserve what remained of the New Order.\n\nIn the years following the Emperor's death
column18: Bastion became the de facto capital of the largest and most organized Imperial remnant. The planet's industrial infrastructure was rapidly expanded
column19: with massive shipyards and military facilities constructed to support the remnant Empire's continued resistance against the New Republic. The world's strategic location and growing industrial capacity made it invaluable to Imperial forces attempting to hold the line against the advancing New Republic."

Text: "Bellassa is an astronomical object located in the galaxy's Core Worlds. It is connected via the Hydian Way hyperspace route to Skako and Fedalle."
"Bellassa is a terrestrial planet located in the Core Worlds region along the Hydian Way hyperlane. A world of varied terrain including mountains
column4: forests
column5: and urban centers
column6: Bellassa developed into a significant industrial and commercial hub due to its strategic location on one of the galaxy's most important trade routes.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column7: Bellassa became an important member world
column8: known for its manufacturing capabilities and educated workforce. The planet's industrial capacity made it valuable to the Republic
column9: with Bellassan products and technologies exported throughout the galaxy.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column10: Bellassa remained loyal to the Galactic Republic
column11: contributing significantly to the war effort through its factories and workforce.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column12: Bellassa came under Imperial control. The transition proved traumatic as the Empire moved quickly to consolidate authority and suppress resistance. Imperial forces established a strong presence
column13: recognizing both the planet's industrial importance and strategic position.\n\nThe Empire's occupation was characterized by increasing oppression and exploitation. Imperial authorities seized control of factories and resources
column14: pressing them into service for the Imperial war machine. Many Bellassans opposed the authoritarian regime
column15: and resistance cells formed almost immediately.\n\nApproximately nineteen years before the Battle of Yavin
column16: former Jedi Padawan Ferus Olin lived on Bellassa under an assumed identity. When he was forced to rescue a captured former Jedi Master
column17: his actions drew Imperial attention and inspired local resistance. Despite brutal Imperial repression including public executions and mass arrests
column18: the Bellassan resistance continued to grow
column19: attracting people from all walks of life.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column20: Bellassa remained under firm Imperial control due to its strategic importance. The Empire maintained a strong garrison to protect vital factories and suppress resistance. However
column21: the Bellassan resistance continued operating underground
column22: conducting covert operations and providing intelligence to the Rebel Alliance.\n\nThe planet's position along the Hydian Way made it valuable for Imperial logistics
column23: with supplies flowing through Bellassan spaceports. This also made it a target for Rebel intelligence operations seeking to disrupt Imperial supply lines.\n\nThe Empire's exploitation took a heavy toll on Bellassa's environment and population. Factories operated at maximum output with minimal safety considerations
column24: and workers faced harsh quotas and brutal conditions.\n\nDespite years of occupation
column25: the Bellassan people maintained their determination to resist. The resistance movement never ceased its activities
column26: conducting sabotage operations
column27: gathering intelligence
column28: and protecting those targeted by Imperial persecution.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column29: Imperial control weakened as forces were recalled to defend Core territories. The Bellassan resistance intensified operations
column30: working to drive out remaining Imperial forces.\n\nFollowing liberation with support from New Republic forces
column31: Bellassa joined the New Republic. The planet faced significant challenges rebuilding after years of Imperial exploitation
column32: but the resilient Bellassan people worked to repair the damage and restore their world to prosperity."

Text: "Bescane is a planet near Dantooine
column4: run by Galentro Heavy Works. A cool
column5: temperate world
column6: it is overpopulated and covered in factories
column7: its natural environment destroyed."

Text: "Bescane is a terrestrial planet located in the Sesswenna sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Hydian Way hyperlane near Eriadu. A cool
column5: temperate world that was once covered in forests and natural beauty
column6: Bescane has been transformed into a heavily industrialized planet dominated by the operations of Galentro Heavy Works
column7: one of the galaxy's major manufacturing corporations.\n\nThe planet's surface is now almost entirely covered by factories
column8: refineries
column9: warehouses
column10: and worker housing complexes that stretch across the landscape. The natural environment that once existed has been systematically destroyed by centuries of unchecked industrial expansion
column11: with pollution from manufacturing operations creating a perpetual haze over many urban areas. Despite the environmental devastation
column12: Bescane maintains a substantial population of workers drawn by employment opportunities in its massive industrial facilities.\n\nGalentro Heavy Works established its primary operations on Bescane thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: recognizing the planet's strategic location along the Hydian Way and its suitability for large-scale manufacturing. The corporation produced a wide variety of industrial equipment
column14: construction machinery
column15: and various mechanical components that were exported throughout the Outer Rim and beyond. Over time
column16: Galentro's operations expanded to consume nearly the entire planet
column17: with the corporation wielding enormous influence over planetary governance and the lives of Bescane's inhabitants.\n\nThe planet's population became severely overpopulated as Galentro recruited workers from across the Outer Rim
column18: offering employment but providing minimal living standards. Workers and their families were housed in cramped
column19: poorly maintained tenements built adjacent to the factories where they labored. The corporation maintained tight control over all aspects of life on Bescane
column20: from housing and food distribution to security and local government
column21: effectively creating a company town on a planetary scale.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column22: Bescane remained a loyal member world
column23: though the Galactic Republic showed limited interest in addressing the environmental degradation and labor exploitation that characterized the planet. Republic oversight of corporate practices remained minimal
column24: allowing Galentro Heavy Works to continue its operations with few restrictions.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column25: Bescane remained under Republic control
column26: with Galentro Heavy Works producing equipment and supplies for the Republic war effort. The planet's strategic location along the Hydian Way made it valuable for military logistics
column27: serving as a waypoint for Republic supply convoys moving through the Outer Rim.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column28: Bescane came under Imperial authority. The Empire recognized the planet's industrial capacity and strategic importance
column29: establishing garrison forces to ensure continued production and maintain order among the massive worker population. Imperial oversight brought increased production quotas but little improvement in working conditions or environmental standards.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column30: Bescane remained under firm Imperial control due to its industrial significance and position along the Hydian Way. The Empire maintained a strong presence on the planet to protect vital manufacturing facilities and ensure the continued flow of industrial equipment to Imperial forces throughout the Outer Rim.\n\nThe overpopulated conditions and harsh working environment on Bescane created discontent among the worker population
column31: though Imperial security forces and Galentro's private security ruthlessly suppressed any signs of organized resistance. Despite this oppression
column32: many workers secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance
column33: though few dared to act on these sympathies given the risks involved.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column34: Bescane's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic industrial worlds along the Hydian Way. The planet's massive manufacturing infrastructure made it a valuable asset in the post-Imperial conflicts
column35: with multiple factions recognizing that controlling Bescane meant controlling a significant source of industrial production in the Outer Rim."

Text: "Bespin is a gas giant in the Bespin system of the Anoat sector on the Ison Corridor in the Greater Javin region of the Outer Rim Territories. It is also a major source of tibanna gas
column4: which is refined for production and transport in numerous mining operations including Cloud City and Tibannopolis."

Text: "Bespin is a gas giant in the Anoat sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Ison Corridor. A massive planet of primarily gaseous material orbiting a twin star system
column5: Bespin features a habitable zone called the Life Zone where atmospheric pressure and temperature allow human habitation without protective equipment.\n\nThe Life Zone exists approximately 150-180 kilometers above the core
column6: containing breathable air and stable conditions - rare for gas giants. Above and below lie hostile atmospheres with crushing pressures
column7: toxic gases
column8: and extreme temperatures.\n\nBespin is famous for vast tibanna gas deposits
column9: valuable for industrial and military applications. Tibanna enhances blaster weapons and starship systems
column10: naturally occurring in Bespin's atmosphere where it can be mined by facilities suspended in the Life Zone.\n\nThousands of years before the Galactic Empire
column11: explorers discovered Bespin's tibanna reserves
column12: attracting commercial mining operations. The most famous colony is Cloud City
column13: built by Lord Ecclessis Figg as both a tibanna mining facility and luxury resort. This kilometer-wide platform floats at 60
column14: 000 kilometers altitude
column15: featuring elegant architecture
column16: casinos
column17: and entertainment venues alongside mining operations.\n\nCloud City's upper levels host luxury hotels and tourist attractions
column18: middle sections contain administrative spaces
column19: while lower levels house industrial equipment and worker housing. Tibannopolis
column20: another major facility
column21: focuses on industrial-scale extraction.\n\nDuring the Old Republic and Clone Wars
column22: Bespin remained largely independent and neutral
column23: with mining operations conducting business with various factions while avoiding major conflicts.\n\nFollowing the Empire's rise
column24: Bespin came under Imperial oversight but maintained relative independence. Lando Calrissian
column25: winning Cloud City in a sabacc game
column26: became Baron Administrator and kept the facility profitable while maintaining careful relations with the Empire.\n\nShortly after the Battle of Hoth
column27: Darth Vader arrived at Cloud City
column28: forcing Calrissian's cooperation to trap Luke Skywalker. Han Solo was frozen in carbonite
column29: while Luke confronted Vader in a duel culminating in Vader revealing he was Luke's father. Luke refused to join the dark side
column30: falling through the city until rescued by the Millennium Falcon.\n\nCalrissian helped Leia and Chewbacca escape and ordered Cloud City's evacuation before joining the Rebel Alliance. The Empire formally occupied the facility
column31: using it as a strategic outpost and tibanna production center.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor
column32: Cloud City remained under Imperial occupation during the Iron Blockade
column33: which sealed the Greater Javin region. Following the blockade's collapse
column34: various factions competed for control.\n\nCalrissian eventually returned to reclaim his position as Baron Administrator
column35: working to rebuild Cloud City and restore its independence. Mining operations gradually resumed
column36: ensuring Bespin's continued importance as a tibanna gas source regardless of galactic government."

Text: "Bilbringi is a world located in the galaxy's Inner Rim. It is home to the Bilbringi shipyards
column4: a facility which dismantled the Separatist dreadnaught Lucid Voice within a year after the end of the Clone Wars."

Text: "Bilbringi is a planet located in the Inner Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Namadii Corridor hyperlane. An unremarkable world with modest industrial development
column5: Bilbringi is perhaps best known for its orbital shipyards
column6: which have served various governments throughout galactic history.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column7: Bilbringi's shipyards remained under Republic control
column8: contributing modestly to the war effort by producing support vessels and providing repair facilities for damaged warships. The planet's strategic location along the Namadii Corridor made it a useful waypoint for Republic supply convoys.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the end of the Clone Wars
column9: Bilbringi's shipyards were tasked with dismantling Separatist vessels captured during the conflict. Most notably
column10: within a year after the war's conclusion
column11: the facility successfully dismantled the Providence-class dreadnought 'Lucid Voice'
column12: breaking down the massive warship for scrap and salvageable components.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column13: Bilbringi remained under Imperial control
column14: continuing its role as a minor shipyard and repair facility. The Empire used the planet's orbital facilities to service vessels operating in the Inner Rim
column15: though it never became a major naval center.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column16: Bilbringi's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic shipyard facilities throughout the Inner Rim."

Text: "Bogden is a planet located in the galaxy's Inner Rim on the Hydian Way that is orbited by multiple moons
column4: one of which was the location where the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus secretly hired the bounty hunter Jango Fett to become the cloning template for the future Grand Army of the Republic."

Text: "Bogden is a terrestrial planet located in the Inner Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Hydian Way hyperlane. The planet is orbited by 20 moons
column5: creating a complex orbital system that has made the Bogden system notable among navigators and astronomers throughout galactic history.\n\nThese numerous moons
column6: rather than the planet itself
column7: have been the primary focus of habitation and activity in the Bogden system. Several of the larger moons support atmospheres suitable for humanoid life and have been settled over the millennia
column8: developing their own distinct communities and cultures. The moons became known as havens for smugglers
column9: pirates
column10: and various criminal elements seeking to operate away from the scrutiny of galactic authorities
column11: though legitimate settlements also exist.\n\nDuring the final years of the Galactic Republic
column12: one of Bogden's moons became the site of a secret meeting of tremendous historical significance. Approximately ten years before the Clone Wars
column13: the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus
column14: publicly known as the former Jedi Master Count Dooku
column15: traveled to this moon to meet with the renowned bounty hunter Jango Fett.\n\nThe meeting took place in a decrepit industrial facility on the moon's surface
column16: a location chosen specifically for its isolation and lack of surveillance. Tyranus had been impressed by Fett's skills after observing the bounty hunter's work
column17: and sought to recruit him for a crucial role in the Sith's grand plan to destroy the Jedi Order and take control of the galaxy.\n\nAt this clandestine meeting
column18: Tyranus offered Fett an extraordinary proposition: in exchange for a substantial payment and an unaltered clone for Fett to raise as his son
column19: the bounty hunter would serve as the genetic template for a massive clone army. This army
column20: Tyranus explained
column21: would be created on the remote world of Kamino by the galaxy's most skilled cloners.\n\nFett
column22: motivated by the financial compensation and the opportunity to have an heir
column23: accepted the offer. This decision set in motion events that would reshape the entire galaxy. The Kaminoans used Fett's genetic material to create the clone troopers who would form the Grand Army of the Republic
column24: the massive military force that would fight throughout the Clone Wars.\n\nUnbeknownst to the Jedi Order and the Republic
column25: this clone army had been ordered by the Sith as part of their elaborate scheme to destroy the Jedi. The clones were implanted with inhibitor chips that would later be used to execute Order 66
column26: turning the clone soldiers against their Jedi commanders and facilitating the rise of the Galactic Empire.\n\nThe secret meeting on Bogden's moon remained unknown to galactic authorities for years. Even after the Clone Wars began and the origins of the clone army became a subject of investigation by some Jedi
column27: the full story of how Jango Fett came to be selected as the template remained shrouded in mystery.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars themselves
column28: the Bogden system maintained a relatively low profile
column29: with its numerous moons continuing to serve as waypoints for smugglers and independent traders operating along the Hydian Way. The system's reputation as a haven for those operating outside the law persisted throughout this period.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column30: Bogden fell under Imperial control like most systems along major trade routes. However
column31: the Empire's presence in the system remained relatively minimal
column32: with Imperial authorities focusing their attention on more strategically significant worlds along the Hydian Way. The moons of Bogden continued to harbor various criminal elements
column33: though Imperial patrols occasionally swept through the system to suppress the most blatant illegal activities.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column34: Bogden's status became uncertain as various factions competed for control of strategic positions along the Hydian Way. The system's numerous moons
column35: with their complex web of settlements and their history as refuges for those seeking to avoid government oversight
column36: made establishing clear authority over the region challenging for any government."

Text: "Boonta
column4: formerly known as Ko Vari
column5: is a planet that had been colonised by the Hutts long ago. Despite it being a devastated world
column6: Boonta is famous in the galaxy for its podracing and speeder races."

Text: "Boonta is a terrestrial planet located in the Mid Rim Territories along the Corellian Run hyperlane once known as 'Ko Vari'. However
column4: the peaceful civilization of Ko Vari was destroyed thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire when the Hutt crime lord Boonta Hestilic Shad'ruu arrived on the planet.\n\nBoonta the Hutt was an infamous criminal who had amassed great wealth and power through his illicit enterprises. When he died
column5: his criminal organization brought his remains to Ko Vari
column6: where they conquered the native population and transformed the planet into a memorial to their deceased leader. The world was renamed Boonta in his honor
column7: and the Hutts constructed massive monuments and temples dedicated to his memory.\n\nThe native Ko Vari people were enslaved or killed during the Hutt conquest
column8: and their culture was systematically eradicated. The planet's original name and history were largely forgotten
column9: replaced by the legacy of the Hutt gangster. Over the centuries
column10: Boonta became deeply associated with Hutt culture
column11: though it never achieved the prominence of Nal Hutta or Nar Shaddaa.\n\nThe Hutts transformed much of Boonta's surface through terraforming and industrial development
column12: though large portions of the planet were left as wastelands. The world's environment suffered greatly from Hutt exploitation
column13: with pollution and strip mining rendering many areas uninhabitable. Despite this devastation
column14: Boonta maintained a significant population centered around the entertainment industry the Hutts developed there.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Empire
column15: Boonta became famous throughout the Outer Rim for its podracing circuits. The dangerous
column16: high-speed sport found a natural home on the ravaged planet
column17: with race courses built through canyons
column18: wastelands
column19: and the ruins of the old Ko Vari civilization. The Boonta Eve Classic
column20: held annually to commemorate Boonta the Hutt's ascension to godhood in Hutt religion
column21: became one of the most prestigious podracing events in the galaxy.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column22: Boonta maintained its status as a major podracing destination
column23: attracting racers and spectators from across known space. The planet's economy became heavily dependent on gambling
column24: entertainment
column25: and the various criminal enterprises that operated openly under Hutt protection. While nominally within Republic space
column26: Boonta effectively operated under Hutt law
column27: with Republic authorities having minimal influence over planetary affairs.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column28: Boonta remained under Hutt control
column29: maintaining official neutrality while the Hutts conducted business with both the Republic and the Separatists. The planet's podracing circuits continued to operate throughout the conflict
column30: providing entertainment and gambling opportunities regardless of the surrounding galactic turmoil.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column31: Boonta's status remained largely unchanged. The Empire
column32: like the Republic before it
column33: recognized the impracticality of challenging Hutt dominance over worlds like Boonta. Emperor Palpatine negotiated agreements that allowed the Hutts to maintain control of their territories in exchange for cooperation on matters of Imperial interest.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column34: Boonta continued to serve as a neutral ground where beings from various factions could conduct business. The planet's famous podracing events attracted audiences from throughout the galaxy
column35: including Imperial officers
column36: Rebel sympathizers
column37: and independent traders
column38: all united by their interest in the dangerous sport.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the death of Emperor Palpatine
column39: Boonta went up for grabs as various Hutt kajidics and corporations competed for dominance in the power vacuum. The planet's podracing industry continued to thrive
column40: with the Boonta Eve Classic maintaining its status as one of the premier sporting events in the Outer Rim."

Text: "Bothawui is a planet in the Mid Rim. A temperate
column4: mountainous world
column5: Bothawui is a major trade hub
column6: as well as home to the Bothan people. Though it was an early member of the Republic and a longstanding and influential member of the Senate
column7: the planet maintained neutrality during the Clone Wars. It carried this neutrality into the Imperial era
column8: maintaining some limited autonomy from the Empire
column9: but different Bothan clans supported either the Empire or the Rebellion
column10: and some Rebel-aligned clans aided in the retrieval of the plans for the second Death Star."

Text: "Bothawui is a temperate planet in the Bothan sector of the Mid Rim
column4: positioned along the Bothan Run hyperlane. The homeworld of the Bothan species
column5: it features varied terrain including mountains
column6: forests
column7: and sprawling urban centers serving as major commercial and political hubs.\n\nBothans are humanoid beings renowned for exceptional skills in espionage
column8: information gathering
column9: and political maneuvering. Their culture emphasizes personal honor
column10: clan loyalty
column11: and accumulating prestige through cunning and strategy. ""Bothan honor"" is central to their society
column12: with all actions - diplomatic or covert - serving to increase clan standing.\n\nThousands of years before the Empire's rise
column13: Bothawui joined the Galactic Republic as an early member
column14: quickly establishing itself as an important commercial center. Bothan representatives wielded considerable Senate influence due to their intelligence-gathering reputation.\n\nThe Bothan Spynet
column15: an extensive intelligence network operated by various clans
column16: became one of the galaxy's most effective information-gathering organizations
column17: providing valuable intelligence to governments
column18: corporations
column19: and private interests.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column20: Bothawui maintained official neutrality
column21: refusing to commit to either Republic or Separatists. This allowed Bothans to maintain trade with both sides while spy networks gathered intelligence across the conflict
column22: though individual clans held varying sympathies.\n\nFollowing the Empire's rise
column23: Bothawui came under Imperial oversight but retained more autonomy than most worlds due to Bothan political savvy and the value of their intelligence networks. However
column24: as Imperial policies grew oppressive
column25: different clans held varying views - some collaborated while others secretly opposed the regime.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column26: Bothawui officially remained under Imperial control
column27: though true allegiances were complex. The Bothan Council maintained diplomatic relations with the Empire while allowing clans autonomy
column28: providing cover for operatives working against Imperial interests.\n\nBothan involvement in the Rebellion grew significantly. Several clans committed resources to the Rebel Alliance
column29: with spies infiltrating Imperial installations galaxy-wide.\n\nThe Bothans' most significant contribution came in obtaining the second Death Star plans. This extensive operation proved costly
column30: with many Bothans dying to secure the intelligence. Mon Mothma's acknowledgment - ""Many Bothans died to bring us this information"" - became a somber recognition of this sacrifice.\n\nThough the Death Star intelligence was part of Emperor Palpatine's trap to lure the Rebel fleet to Endor
column31: the Rebels ultimately prevailed
column32: destroying the battle station and killing the Emperor.\n\nAfter Endor
column33: Bothawui fell under Hutt Cartel influence as the New Republic struggled in the Outer Rim. The Bothan Spynet continued operating
column34: now providing intelligence to the New Republic against Imperial remnants.\n\nThe Bothans' contributions to defeating the Empire earned them significant political capital
column35: though their methods and willingness to engage in morally questionable activities remained controversial."

Text: "Brentaal IV
column4: also referred to simply as Brentaal
column5: is a terrestrial planet located in the galaxy's Core Worlds
column6: on both the Hydian Way and the Perlemian Trade Route."

Text: "Brentaal IV
column4: commonly known simply as Brentaal
column5: is a heavily urbanized planet located in the Brentaal system of the Core Worlds region
column6: positioned at the strategic intersection of two of the galaxy's most important hyperspace routes: the Perlemian Trade Route and the Hydian Way. This convergence of major trade lanes has made Brentaal one of the most commercially significant worlds in the galaxy for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface is almost entirely covered by sprawling cities
column7: spaceports
column8: and commercial infrastructure devoted to facilitating the massive volume of trade that flows through the system daily. Brentaal's economy has been built entirely around its role as a major trade hub
column9: with countless shipping companies
column10: trading houses
column11: and commercial enterprises maintaining operations on the planet.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column12: Brentaal was discovered during the early expansion of the Galactic Republic and quickly became one of the Republic's most important commercial centers. The planet joined the Republic as a founding member and maintained its loyalty for over 25
column13: 000 years
column14: with Brentaal's representatives in the Galactic Senate wielding considerable influence due to the world's economic importance.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column15: Brentaal developed into one of the wealthiest worlds in the Core
column16: with fortunes made and lost daily in its bustling trading halls and commodities exchanges. The planet's strategic location ensured continuous prosperity
column17: as virtually all trade moving between the northern and southern regions of the galaxy passed through Brentaal's system.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column18: Brentaal remained firmly loyal to the Galactic Republic
column19: serving as a crucial logistics hub for military supply lines. The planet's position made it strategically vital
column20: and both Republic and Separatist forces recognized that controlling Brentaal meant controlling access to major portions of the Core Worlds. The planet saw increased military traffic throughout the war as Republic convoys moved troops and supplies through the system.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column21: Brentaal came under Imperial control. The Empire recognized the planet's economic and strategic importance
column22: establishing a strong garrison to maintain order and protect the vital trade routes passing through the system. Imperial oversight brought increased regulation to commerce
column23: though Brentaal's economy continued to thrive under the new regime.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column24: Brentaal remained under firm Imperial control for most of the conflict. The planet's strategic location made it a priority target for both sides
column25: with the Empire maintaining substantial defensive forces to prevent any Rebel attempt to seize control of the system. The busy trade routes also made Brentaal valuable for Rebel intelligence operations
column26: as the constant flow of commercial traffic provided cover for covert activities.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column27: Brentaal became a major objective in the struggle between the New Republic and various Imperial remnant factions. The planet changed hands several times during fierce fighting
column28: with both sides recognizing that controlling Brentaal meant controlling access to crucial trade routes throughout the Core Worlds. The New Republic eventually secured control of the planet
column29: making it an important economic center for the new government."

Text: "Byss is a planet located within the galaxy's Deep Core with a Standard Galactic Grid coordinate of K-11. Only discovered late during the Old Republic
column4: it is the endpoint of the Byss Run hyperspace route after Prakith. An unusual world with an uncanny glow caused by its sun
column5: it was considered extremely important by Emperor Palpatine."

Text: "Byss is a planet located deep within the galaxy's Deep Core region
column4: positioned at Standard Galactic Grid coordinates K-11. The world serves as the endpoint of the Byss Run hyperspace route
column5: one of the few stable passages through the treacherous Deep Core that connects the region to the wider galaxy via Prakith.\n\nByss is an unusual world characterized by an eerie
column6: unnatural luminescence that bathes its surface in perpetual twilight. This strange glow
column7: caused by the planet's proximity to its sun and peculiar atmospheric conditions
column8: gives Byss an otherworldly appearance that has both fascinated and unsettled visitors throughout its history. The planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column9: forests
column10: and scattered urban centers
column11: though much of the world remained sparsely populated for millennia due to its remote location deep within the Core.\n\nFor most of galactic history
column12: Byss remained unknown to the Galactic Republic and the wider galaxy. The Deep Core's unstable hyperspace routes
column13: gravitational anomalies
column14: and dense star clusters made exploration extremely dangerous
column15: and most Republic scout missions avoided the region entirely. The few explorers who ventured into the Deep Core rarely returned
column16: and those who did brought back only fragmentary information about the worlds they had discovered.\n\nByss was finally discovered late in the Old Republic era
column17: when improved navigation technology and more detailed stellar cartography allowed explorers to map some of the Deep Core's treacherous hyperspace routes. The planet joined the Galactic Republic
column18: though its extreme isolation meant that Republic influence remained minimal. Byss attracted little colonization
column19: with only a small population of settlers establishing modest communities on the planet's surface.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column20: Byss remained under Republic control
column21: though its location deep within the Core meant it saw no direct involvement in the conflict. The planet continued its quiet existence
column22: largely forgotten by the galactic community as attention focused on the war raging throughout the Outer and Mid Rim territories.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column23: Byss's fate changed dramatically when Emperor Palpatine took a personal interest in the remote world. The Emperor recognized potential in Byss that others had overlooked - its isolation deep within the Core
column24: its limited population
column25: and its eerie
column26: Force-saturated environment made it ideal for his purposes.\n\nPalpatine began secretly transforming Byss into a hidden stronghold
column27: one of several secure locations he established throughout the galaxy as part of his contingency plans. The Emperor poured enormous resources into developing Byss
column28: constructing massive Imperial facilities
column29: fortifications
column30: and research installations across the planet's surface. These projects were conducted in absolute secrecy
column31: with even most high-ranking Imperial officials unaware of Byss's true importance.\n\nThe Emperor's interest in Byss went beyond mere military strategy. Palpatine recognized that the planet existed at a nexus of dark side energies
column32: a confluence of Force power that could be harnessed and manipulated by one sufficiently skilled in the Sith arts. The Emperor established meditation chambers and dark side temples on Byss
column33: using the planet as a location to conduct forbidden Sith rituals and experiments in Force manipulation.\n\nPalpatine also constructed cloning facilities on Byss
column34: part of his long-term plan to achieve immortality through transferring his consciousness into clone bodies should his original form be destroyed. These laboratories represented some of the most advanced cloning technology in the galaxy
column35: surpassing even the famed facilities on Kamino. The Emperor's clones were stored in massive vaults beneath Byss's surface
column36: waiting to receive his essence should the need arise.\n\nThe native population of Byss was systematically displaced or enslaved as the Emperor's projects expanded. Those who remained on the planet were either pressed into service constructing Imperial facilities or subjected to the Emperor's dark side experiments. The Emperor's presence gradually corrupted Byss itself
column37: with the planet's already unusual characteristics becoming even more pronounced as dark side energies saturated the world.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column38: Byss remained one of the Empire's most closely guarded secrets. The planet's location was known only to the Emperor and his most trusted servants
column39: with access to the Byss Run hyperspace route strictly controlled. Imperial forces stationed on Byss were selected for their absolute loyalty and were forbidden from leaving the planet or communicating with the outside galaxy.\n\nThe massive fortress complexes on Byss housed not only clone facilities and dark side temples but also vast archives containing forbidden knowledge
column40: Sith artifacts
column41: and the accumulated secrets of Palpatine's long reign. The Emperor intended Byss to serve as his ultimate refuge
column42: a world so hidden and so powerful in the dark side that it would be impregnable to any threat.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's apparent death
column43: Byss remained hidden and forgotten to the galaxy at large. Fantastical rumours of a 'Dark Empire' and a reborn Emperor belied a more banal reality
column44: Byss is merely a deserted throneworld in a remote region of the Deep Core that never saw its intended rise to prominence."

Text: "Cantonica is a desert planet in the Cantonica system within the Corporate Sector of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. The planet is home to the casino city Canto Bight
column4: which is a destination for wealthy tourists
column5: gamblers
column6: and war profiteers."

Text: "Cantonica is a desert planet located in the Corporate Sector of the Outer Rim Territories. The planet's arid surface is dominated by vast salt flats and barren wastelands
column4: creating a harsh environment inhospitable to most life. Despite these extreme conditions
column5: Cantonica has developed into one of the galaxy's most prestigious destinations due to the presence of Canto Bight
column6: an opulent coastal casino city built along the planet's sole body of water.\n\nCanto Bight
column7: known as the ""playground of the galaxy
column8: is an artificial oasis of luxury constructed along Cantonica's coast. The city features towering casinos
column9: luxury hotels
column10: and entertainment venues that cater exclusively to the galaxy's wealthiest citizens. Elaborate fountains and imported vegetation create an illusion of paradise in stark contrast to the surrounding desert.\n\nThe casino city's economy revolves entirely around high-stakes gambling and luxury tourism. Canto Bight attracts corporate executives
column11: successful merchants
column12: and aristocrats who have accumulated vast fortunes through various means. The city has earned a reputation as a place where credits flow freely and questions about the source of one's wealth are never asked.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Cantonica was discovered during early exploration of the Outer Rim. The planet's inhospitable environment discouraged colonization until enterprising developers recognized the potential of its coastal region. Corporate interests established Canto Bight as a luxury resort destination
column14: investing enormous resources to create an artificial paradise for the galaxy's elite.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column15: Canto Bight developed its reputation as neutral ground where beings from across the galaxy could conduct business regardless of their political affiliations. The Canto Bight Police Department maintained order
column16: primarily protecting the casinos and their wealthy patrons rather than enforcing broader galactic law.\n\nBeneath Canto Bight's glamorous surface existed a darker reality. The city's stables housed fathiers
column17: large creatures used in racing events that provided entertainment for casino patrons. These animals were often mistreated
column18: kept in cramped conditions and subjected to brutal training. Stable workers
column19: many of them children from impoverished backgrounds
column20: labored in harsh conditions while the wealthy gambled above. This stark inequality was accepted as natural by Canto Bight's elite.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column21: Cantonica maintained strict neutrality
column22: welcoming patrons from both the Republic and the Separatists. The casino city became popular with war profiteers from both sides
column23: who used their wealth to enjoy Canto Bight's luxuries while the galaxy burned.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column24: Canto Bight continued operating as before
column25: now welcoming wealthy Imperial officers and corporate executives benefiting from Imperial contracts. The casino city became particularly popular among arms dealers whose businesses thrived during the Galactic Civil War. These war profiteers accumulated vast fortunes selling weapons to the Empire.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column26: Canto Bight adapted with characteristic pragmatism. The casino city welcomed New Republic officials while continuing to serve Imperial remnant leaders and corporate executives. As long as patrons had credits to spend
column27: Canto Bight's casinos remained open to all. The arms dealers who had grown wealthy during the war continued to frequent the city
column28: now selling weapons to various factions competing in the post-Imperial conflicts."

Text: "Celanon is an important spaceport on the Celanon Spur
column4: in the Outer Rim Territories
column5: and is the Nalroni homeworld."

Text: "Celanon is a planet located in the Celanon system of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned at the strategic intersection of the Celanon Spur and several other hyperspace routes. This convergence of trade lanes has made Celanon one of the most important commercial centers in the Outer Rim for millennia
column5: serving as a major hub for interstellar commerce and a crossroads for traders traveling between different regions of the galaxy.\n\nThe planet is the homeworld of the Nalroni species
column6: a humanoid race known throughout the galaxy for their exceptional business acumen and shrewd negotiating skills. Nalroni culture places tremendous emphasis on commerce
column7: with successful merchants and traders holding the highest social status. The species developed a reputation as some of the galaxy's most capable deal-makers
column8: with Nalroni business practices and commercial law influencing trade customs throughout known space.\n\nCelanon's surface features varied terrain including urban centers
column9: agricultural regions
column10: and industrial zones
column11: though the planet is best known for its massive spaceports and commercial districts. The capital city serves as a bustling trade hub where goods from across the galaxy are bought
column12: sold
column13: and transported to their final destinations. The spaceports operate continuously
column14: with vessels arriving and departing at all hours as merchants conduct their business.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column15: Celanon joined the Galactic Republic and quickly established itself as a vital economic center. The planet's strategic position made it invaluable for trade
column16: while the Nalroni's commercial expertise ensured that Celanon remained prosperous through various galactic conflicts and political changes.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column17: Celanon maintained steady growth as trade along the Celanon Spur and connecting routes expanded. The planet became known not just as a trade hub but as a center for commercial law and business education
column18: with Nalroni institutions training merchants and traders from across the galaxy in the arts of negotiation and commerce.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column19: Celanon remained officially neutral
column20: though the planet's merchants conducted business with both the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. This pragmatic approach to the conflict ensured Celanon's continued prosperity
column21: though it also created tensions with both sides who viewed the planet's neutrality as opportunistic profiteering.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column22: Celanon came under Imperial oversight. The Empire recognized the planet's economic importance and established a garrison to monitor trade and collect customs revenues. However
column23: the Nalroni's commercial influence meant they retained considerable autonomy in managing their business affairs
column24: with Imperial authorities focusing primarily on ensuring compliance with Imperial trade regulations.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column25: Celanon remained under nominal Imperial control
column26: though the planet's neutral merchants continued to conduct business with various factions throughout the galaxy. The busy spaceports and constant flow of commercial traffic made Celanon valuable to both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance as a source of supplies and intelligence.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column27: Celanon's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic trade routes in the Outer Rim. The planet's economic importance ensured it remained a prize worth fighting for
column28: with the Nalroni merchants adapting to the changing political landscape while continuing their traditional commercial activities."

Text: "Astronomical object in Outer Rim
column4: little is known about it."

Text: "Celesta is a planet located in the Outer Rim Territories. A lush
column4: forested world with vast oceans and temperate climates
column5: Celesta was discovered by early Republic explorers but remained largely unsettled for millennia due to its remote location. The planet is notable for its unique ecosystem
column6: featuring bioluminescent flora that creates stunning natural light displays during the night cycle.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column7: Celesta maintained strict neutrality
column8: though both the Republic and Separatists sought to establish outposts in the system due to its strategic position along lesser-known hyperspace routes.\n\nUnder the Galactic Empire
column9: the planet became a haven for smugglers and independent traders operating on the fringes of Imperial space."

Text: "Centares is a planet in the Maldrood sector of the Mid Rim. It have a temperate climate and no moons."
"Centares is a temperate planet located in the Maldrood sector of the Mid Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Perlemian Trade Route hyperlane. A world of varied terrain including plains
column5: forests
column6: and scattered urban centers
column7: Centares developed as a modest commercial and agricultural hub due to its strategic location on one of the galaxy's most important trade routes.\n\nThe planet's surface features expansive grasslands and farming regions that produce agricultural goods for export throughout the Mid Rim. Centares maintained a relatively peaceful existence for much of galactic history
column8: with most inhabitants living in small farming communities or working in the planet's modest spaceports and trade facilities.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: Centares joined the Galactic Republic and became a waypoint for merchants traveling the Perlemian Trade Route. The planet maintained steady economic growth through agriculture and trade
column10: though it never achieved the prominence of major commercial centers.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Centares was known for its neutrality and peaceful nature. The planet's government emphasized non-interference in galactic conflicts
column12: preferring to focus on trade and maintaining good relations with all parties. This approach served Centares well for millennia
column13: allowing it to prosper while avoiding entanglement in the wars that periodically swept through the galaxy.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column14: Centares initially maintained its traditional neutrality
column15: refusing to commit forces to either the Galactic Republic or the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The planet's leadership believed that remaining neutral would protect Centares from the devastation affecting so many other worlds.\n\nHowever
column16: Centares' strategic position along the Perlemian Trade Route made neutrality difficult to maintain. Both the Republic and the Separatists recognized the value of controlling this key waypoint
column17: and the planet inevitably became drawn into the conflict despite its government's wishes.\n\nLate in the Clone Wars
column18: Separatist forces occupied Centares
column19: recognizing its value for controlling traffic along the Perlemian Trade Route. The occupation proved brief but traumatic for the Centari people
column20: who had long enjoyed peace and independence. Republic forces eventually liberated the planet
column21: though the experience left lasting scars on Centares' traditionally neutral society.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the end of the Clone Wars
column22: Centares came under Imperial authority. The Empire established a presence on the planet to maintain order and monitor traffic along the Perlemian Trade Route
column23: though the garrison remained relatively modest given Centares' limited military significance.\n\nUnder Imperial rule
column24: Centares returned to its quiet existence as an agricultural world and minor trade hub. The planet's traditional way of life continued largely unchanged
column25: with farmers tending their fields and merchants conducting business in the spaceports much as they had for generations. The Empire's primary interest in Centares lay in its position along the trade route rather than in exploiting the planet's resources or population.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column26: Centares remained under Imperial control
column27: serving as a waypoint for Imperial supply convoys moving through the Mid Rim. The planet saw little direct fighting
column28: as both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance focused their attention on more strategically significant worlds. However
column29: many Centari privately sympathized with the Rebellion
column30: though few dared to act on these sympathies given the Imperial presence.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column31: Centares' status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of key positions along the Perlemian Trade Route. The planet eventually joined the Corporate Sector Authority
column32: with its inhabitants hoping to return to the peaceful neutrality that had characterized their world before the Clone Wars.\n\nCentares' experience during the Clone Wars and under Imperial occupation taught its people that complete neutrality was impossible in an interconnected galaxy. While the planet returned to its agricultural traditions and modest commercial role
column33: the Centari maintained a cautious awareness that their position along a major trade route would always make them vulnerable to the ambitions of galactic powers."

Text: "Cerea is a planet located in the Mid Rim region of the galaxy. The homeworld of the Cerean species
column4: Cerea is notable for its inhabitants' harmonious relationship with nature. Technology and pollution are frowned upon by the conservative government
column5: a major point in the planet's decision not to join the Galactic Republic."

Text: "Cerea is a temperate planet located in the Mid Rim region along the Cerean Reach hyperlane. The homeworld of the Cerean species
column4: characterized by their large craniums housing binary brains
column5: Cerea has maintained a unique balance between technological advancement and environmental preservation for thousands of years.\n\nThe Cereans' binary brain structure provides exceptional mental processing capabilities
column6: making them naturally gifted in logic
column7: strategy
column8: and meditation. Their society emphasizes contemplation
column9: philosophy
column10: and living in harmony with nature. This cultural focus made many Cereans natural candidates for the Jedi Order.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column11: Cerea joined the Galactic Republic as a respected member world. However
column12: the Cereans maintained fierce independence regarding planetary development. The planetary government
column13: led by the Council of Elders
column14: established strict regulations limiting surface technology to prevent industrial pollution and environmental degradation.\n\nCerean society is matriarchal
column15: with females significantly outnumbering males due to an unusual birth ratio of approximately 20 females to every male. This shaped many cultural aspects
column16: including marriage customs typically involving one male bonding with multiple female partners. The Council of Elders
column17: composed primarily of older males who demonstrated exceptional wisdom
column18: governed with focus on preserving traditional values and protecting the environment.\n\nThe Cereans developed the ""Outsider Citadels"" approach to technology - confining all high-technology activities to specific designated cities isolated from the rest of the planet. In these citadels
column19: offworlders and Cereans could use advanced technology without affecting traditional settlements. This compromise allowed galactic contact while preserving pristine forests
column20: plains
column21: and grasslands where most Cereans lived simple lives focused on agriculture
column22: philosophy
column23: and communion with nature.\n\nOne of the most famous Cereans was Ki-Adi-Mundi
column24: who served on the Jedi High Council during the Republic's final years. Master Ki-Adi-Mundi was granted a rare exception to the Jedi Code's marriage prohibition due to the Cerean species' low birth rate. He maintained families on Cerea while serving the Order
column25: balancing duties to both his people and the Jedi.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column26: Cerea remained loyal to the Republic
column27: contributing primarily through diplomatic channels and Cerean Jedi like Ki-Adi-Mundi serving in leadership positions. The conservative Council of Elders worked to ensure Cerea remained insulated from the conflict.\n\nMaster Ki-Adi-Mundi served with distinction throughout the Clone Wars
column28: but was killed when Order 66 was executed. Commander Bacara and his clone troopers turned on Ki-Adi-Mundi during the Battle of Mygeeto
column29: eliminating one of Cerea's most prominent galactic representatives.\n\nFollowing the Empire's rise
column30: Cerea came under Imperial authority. The Council of Elders faced a delicate challenge navigating Imperial rule
column31: as authoritarian policies conflicted with Cerean values. However
column32: they recognized open resistance would destroy the way of life they sought to protect. The planet's technological isolation provided some protection from Imperial exploitation.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column33: Cerea remained officially loyal to the Empire
column34: though many Cereans privately sympathized with the Rebel Alliance. The loss of Ki-Adi-Mundi and other Cerean Jedi during Order 66 profoundly impacted Cerean society
column35: though the Council maintained careful political discretion.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor
column36: Cerea's status became contested as various factions competed for Mid Rim influence. The Council carefully evaluated their options while maintaining their commitment to environmental preservation and contemplative philosophy."

Text: "Chardaan is an Inner Rim world that lay at the intersection of the Hydian Way and Shipwrights' Trace. The planet is orbited by the Chardaan Shipyards."
"Chardaan is a terrestrial planet located in the Inner Rim Territories
column4: positioned at the strategic intersection of two major hyperspace routes: the Hydian Way and the Shipwrights' Trace. This convergence of trade lanes has made Chardaan a significant commercial and industrial center
column5: particularly known for its orbital shipbuilding facilities.\n\nThe Chardaan Shipyards
column6: massive orbital construction facilities encircling the planet
column7: have produced starships for various governments and organizations throughout galactic history.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column8: Chardaan's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic shipyard facilities throughout the Inner Rim. The planet's position at the intersection of two major hyperspace routes ensured it remained valuable to all factions seeking to establish or maintain control over key trade corridors."

Text: "Columex
column4: once known as Nardolin
column5: is a planet in the Outer Rim. Originally a minor Republic outpost
column6: it was settled by Commenorian investors in the millennia before the Clone Wars
column7: and became a prosperous trade world on the Perlemian Trade Route. Columex seceded from the Republic during the Clone Wars
column8: but after its fall
column9: the planet accepted Imperial rule."

Text: "Columex is a terrestrial planet located in the Columex system of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Perlemian Trade Route. The homeworld of the Columi species
column5: a highly intelligent race characterized by their massive craniums and atrophied bodies
column6: Columex has maintained a unique position in galactic history due to the exceptional intellectual capabilities of its native inhabitants.\n\nThe Columi evolved on Columex millions of years ago
column7: developing extraordinary mental faculties while their bodies atrophied from disuse. Their civilization achieved technological advancement far earlier than most other species in the galaxy
column8: developing space travel and exploring nearby systems long before the formation of the Galactic Republic. However
column9: the Columi's early explorations led them to conclude that other species in the galaxy were primitive and unworthy of contact
column10: prompting them to largely isolate themselves on their homeworld.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column11: Columex was discovered by Republic explorers who were astounded to find a civilization that had independently developed advanced technology. The planet joined the Galactic Republic
column12: though the Columi maintained their characteristic aloofness from galactic affairs. Despite their intellectual superiority
column13: the Columi showed little interest in participating in Republic governance or commerce
column14: preferring to focus on their own scientific and philosophical pursuits.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column15: Columex attracted settlers from other worlds
column16: particularly from Commenor
column17: drawn by the planet's strategic location along the Perlemian Trade Route. These colonists established their own communities separate from the reclusive Columi
column18: developing Columex into a modest trade hub. The planet's economy grew steadily through commerce
column19: though it never achieved the prominence of major trade worlds like Corellia or Alderaan.\n\nThroughout the millennia
column20: the Columi remained largely withdrawn from galactic society despite living on a Republic member world. They occasionally contributed their intellects to solving complex scientific or mathematical problems when approached
column21: but generally viewed interaction with other species as beneath them. This attitude
column22: while intellectually justified given their superior mental capabilities
column23: created a divide between the native Columi and the growing population of offworld settlers.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column24: Columex's status became complicated when the planet seceded from the Republic and joined the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The reasons for this decision remain unclear
column25: though some historians speculate that the Columi's analytical assessment of the Republic's political situation led them to conclude that alignment with the Separatists was more logical. Alternatively
column26: the offworld population may have driven the secession for economic reasons
column27: with the Columi remaining characteristically uninvolved in the political decision.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the end of the Clone Wars
column28: Columex came under Imperial control. The Empire established a presence on the planet to maintain order and ensure compliance with Imperial regulations
column29: though the Columi's tendency toward isolation meant they posed little threat to Imperial authority. The offworld population accepted Imperial rule
column30: and Columex continued its role as a waypoint along the Perlemian Trade Route.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column31: Columex remained under Imperial control. The planet's strategic position made it valuable for Imperial logistics
column32: though it never became a major battleground in the larger conflict. The Columi continued their isolated existence
column33: largely ignoring the political upheavals that consumed much of the galaxy.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column34: Columex's status became contested as various factions competed for control of strategic positions along the Perlemian Trade Route. The planet eventually joined the Corporate Sector Authority
column35: though as always
column36: the Columi themselves showed little interest in which government claimed authority over their world
column37: remaining focused on their own intellectual pursuits while the galaxy changed around them."

Text: "Commenor is a planet in the Commenor system of the Colonies
column4: just outside of the Core Worlds."

Text: "Commenor is a terrestrial planet located in the Commenor system of the Colonies region
column4: positioned along the Commenor Run hyperlane near the Core Worlds border. One of the most prosperous and strategically important trade worlds in the galaxy
column5: Commenor has served as a major commercial hub for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column6: forests
column7: and sprawling urban centers that developed around its massive spaceports and commercial districts. Commenor's economy has long been tied to interstellar trade
column8: with goods from across the galaxy flowing through its ports daily. The planet's position along the Commenor Run made it an essential waypoint for merchants traveling between the Core Worlds and the Outer Rim.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: Commenor joined the Galactic Republic and quickly established itself as one of the Colonies' most important commercial centers. The planet maintained steady economic growth throughout the millennia
column10: with Commenoran merchants and trading houses wielding considerable influence in regional commerce.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Commenor was known for its peaceful nature and diplomatic approach to galactic affairs. The planet's government emphasized free trade and maintained friendly relations with neighboring systems
column12: contributing to its reputation as a stable and prosperous world.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column13: Commenor remained loyal to the Galactic Republic
column14: though its strategic location made it a target of interest for both sides of the conflict. The planet's busy trade routes and commercial infrastructure made it valuable for military logistics
column15: and both Republic and Separatist forces recognized its importance. However
column16: Commenor managed to avoid major battles
column17: with Republic forces maintaining control throughout the war.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: Commenor came under Imperial oversight. The Empire recognized the planet's economic importance and established a garrison to maintain order and protect vital trade routes. Imperial authorities implemented increased regulation of commerce passing through the system
column19: though Commenor's economy continued to thrive under the new regime.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column20: Commenor remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. The planet's strategic position and economic value made it a priority for Imperial defense
column21: with garrison forces protecting the trade routes and commercial infrastructure from Rebel attacks.\n\nHowever
column22: as the war progressed and the Empire's authority began to fracture following the Battle of Endor
column23: Commenor's status became increasingly contested. The planet's leadership began to question their allegiance to the crumbling Empire
column24: and diplomatic contacts with the New Republic increased.\n\nApproximately nine years after the Battle of Endor
column25: Commenor formally joined the New Republic. The planet's defection dealt a significant blow to Imperial remnant forces in the region
column26: as Commenor's strategic location and economic resources provided substantial support to the New Republic's efforts to consolidate control over the Colonies.\n\nThe transition to New Republic governance proved beneficial for Commenor
column27: as the restoration of democratic institutions and reduced military oversight allowed the planet's commercial sector to flourish even more than under Imperial rule. Commenor's ports once again became centers of free trade
column28: with merchants from across the galaxy conducting business in an environment of reduced regulation and increased opportunity."

Text: "Concord Dawn is an agricultural frontier world in the Mandalore sector of the Outer Rim Territories. The planet has strong ties to the Mandalorians
column4: its population share many Mandalorian values
column5: and genetic markers specific to the natives of Concord Dawn are present throughout the Mandalorian populace."

Text: "Concord Dawn is a frontier agricultural world located in the Mandalore sector of the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of varied terrain including plains
column4: forests
column5: and scattered farming settlements
column6: Concord Dawn has maintained strong cultural ties to the Mandalorian people throughout its history.\n\nThe planet is home to the Journeyman Protectors
column7: a law enforcement organization that has served Concord Dawn for generations. These peacekeepers maintain order across the planet's settlements and rural areas
column8: upholding a code of justice that shares many values with traditional Mandalorian warrior culture.\n\nConcord Dawn's population exhibits genetic markers that are common throughout the broader Mandalorian population
column9: suggesting significant historical connections between the world and Mandalore. Many inhabitants of Concord Dawn identify strongly with Mandalorian culture and traditions
column10: though the planet has maintained its own distinct identity.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Concord Dawn remained relatively isolated from Core Worlds politics
column12: focusing on its agricultural economy and maintaining its traditional way of life. The planet's inhabitants developed a reputation for being tough
column13: self-reliant frontier colonists who valued honor and justice.\n\nOne of the most famous natives of Concord Dawn was Jaster Mereel
column14: who served as a Journeyman Protector before being exiled after killing a superior officer who he claimed was corrupt. Mereel eventually became Mand'alor
column15: leader of the Mandalorians
column16: and worked to reform Mandalorian culture by establishing the Supercommando Codex
column17: a set of honorable guidelines for Mandalorian warriors.\n\nMereel's adopted son
column18: Jango Fett
column19: was also from Concord Dawn. After Mereel's death during the Mandalorian Civil War
column20: Fett became one of the most renowned bounty hunters in the galaxy. Approximately ten years before the Clone Wars
column21: Fett was selected by the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus to serve as the genetic template for the Republic's clone army
column22: making Concord Dawn the ancestral homeworld of millions of clone troopers.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column23: Concord Dawn remained under the control of local authorities
column24: though its proximity to Mandalore meant it was affected by the conflicts that plagued the Mandalorian system. The planet maintained its agricultural economy throughout this period
column25: supplying food to nearby systems.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column26: Concord Dawn came under Imperial oversight as part of the Empire's control over the Mandalore sector. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to ensure compliance with Imperial regulations
column27: though local governance largely remained in the hands of planetary authorities and the Journeyman Protectors.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column28: Concord Dawn remained under nominal Imperial control
column29: though the planet's isolation from major conflict zones meant it saw little direct involvement in the fighting between the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. The inhabitants continued their traditional agricultural way of life while maintaining their cultural connections to Mandalorian heritage.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column30: Concord Dawn quickly became part of the new Mandalorian government as the clans unified and established themselves."

Text: "Corellia is a planet located in the galaxy's Core Worlds known for its ace pilots and large starship manufacturers. Vessels such as the Millennium Falcon and Imperial starships are built on Corellia."
"Corellia is a planet in the Core Worlds
column4: located along the Corellian Run and Corellian Trade Spine hyperspace routes. Known for its shipbuilding industry
column5: Corellia is the homeworld of the Corellian Engineering Corporation
column6: which produces some of the galaxy's most iconic starships
column7: including the YT-series freighters and CR90 corvettes.\n\nThe planet's surface features sprawling cities such as Coronet City
column8: vast shipyards
column9: and temperate landscapes with forests
column10: plains
column11: and oceans. Corellians are renowned for their piloting skills
column12: independence
column13: and adventurous spirit
column14: with many famous smugglers and heroes
column15: including Han Solo
column16: originating from the world.\n\nCorellia was a founding member of the Galactic Republic and played a significant role in galactic politics and commerce for millennia. During the Clone Wars
column17: Corellia remained loyal to the Republic
column18: though its leadership maintained a degree of autonomy and neutrality in some galactic affairs. The planet's shipyards contributed to the Republic war effort
column19: and Corellian Security Force (CorSec) maintained order locally.\n\nAfter the rise of the Galactic Empire
column20: Corellia came under Imperial control. The Empire expanded ship production and maintained a strong military presence
column21: though Corellians continued to value their independence. The planet's shipyards produced vessels for the Imperial Navy
column22: and Imperial rule brought increased regulation and surveillance.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column23: Corellia remained under Imperial authority
column24: but many Corellians secretly supported the Rebel Alliance. The planet's strategic location and shipbuilding capacity made it a valuable asset for both the Empire and the Rebellion. Han Solo
column25: a native Corellian
column26: became a key figure in the Rebellion and the fight against the Empire.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fall of the Empire
column27: Corellia joined the New Republic. The planet continued to serve as a major commercial and industrial center
column28: maintaining its reputation for producing skilled pilots and advanced starships. Corellia's independent spirit persisted
column29: and its citizens played important roles in the rebuilding of galactic government and society."

Text: "Corsin is a planet located in the Greater Plooriod sector of the Expansion Region."
"Corsin is a terrestrial planet located in the Corsin system of the Expansion Region
