column6: and urban centers that developed around key trade hubs and spaceports. Milagro's economy has long been tied to its role as a major trade nexus
column7: with commerce
column8: manufacturing
column9: and shipping forming the backbone of planetary prosperity.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Milagro was discovered during the early expansion era of the Galactic Republic. Corellian colonists were among the first to recognize the planet's strategic value and established settlements that would grow into thriving commercial centers. The planet joined the Galactic Republic and maintained steady economic growth as trade along both the Corellian Run and Harrin Trade Corridor expanded.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Milagro became known as a regional trade hub
column12: with goods flowing through its spaceports from across the galaxy. The planet's position made it valuable for merchants and shipping companies establishing distribution networks throughout the Expansion Region and beyond. Milagro's shipyards and manufacturing facilities contributed to the galactic economy
column13: producing both civilian and military equipment.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column14: Milagro remained loyal to the Galactic Republic
column15: serving as an important logistics hub for military supply lines. The planet's strategic location meant it saw increased military traffic
column16: though it avoided becoming a major battlefield. Republic forces used Milagro as a staging point for operations throughout the Expansion Region.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column17: Milagro fell under Imperial authority. The Empire recognized the planet's economic and strategic importance
column18: establishing a garrison to maintain order and protect vital trade routes. Imperial oversight brought increased regulation to commerce passing through the system
column19: though Milagro's economy continued to benefit from its position as a major trade nexus.\n\nThe Imperial garrison maintained security in the system and ensured compliance with Imperial trade laws. Despite the Imperial presence
column20: Milagro retained much of its commercial character
column21: with traders and merchants from across the galaxy continuing to conduct business through its ports.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column22: Milagro remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. The planet's location made it strategically valuable to both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance
column23: though the strong Imperial garrison deterred major Rebel operations in the system.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column24: Milagro's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of key trade routes in the Expansion Region. The planet's economic importance ensured it remained a prize worth fighting for as the galaxy entered a new era of political upheaval."

Text: "Mimban is a swamp planet in the Expansion Region. Typically ignored by its neighbours
column4: it was the site of decades of conflict between the native people and mining corporations. During the Clone Wars
column5: the Galactic Republic aided the natives in repelling Separatist forces
column6: but once the Galactic Empire was declared
column7: the same soldiers that protected the planet instead began to subjugate it."

Text: "Mimban
column4: also known as Circarpous V
column5: is a perpetually fog-shrouded swamp planet located in the Circarpous system of the Expansion Region. The planet's surface is dominated by dense jungles
column6: murky swamps
column7: and treacherous mudflats. Mimban is home to the native Mimbanites
column8: including the surface-dwelling Coway and primitive deep-dwelling tribes.\n\nThe planet's primary value lies in vast deposits of hyperbaride minerals beneath its muddy surface
column9: used in various technological applications. Extracting them from Mimban's hostile environment has proven consistently difficult and costly.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Mimban was home to an ancient civilization that practiced Force traditions distinct from the Jedi. Ruins of their temples
column11: including the legendary Temple of Pomojema
column12: remained scattered across the surface. Among the artifacts left behind was the Kaiburr crystal
column13: a powerful Force-sensitive gem.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column14: Mimban remained largely ignored due to its remote location and inhospitable conditions. Mining corporations occasionally attempted operations to extract valuable minerals
column15: though these ventures frequently failed due to the challenging environment and resistance from the native Mimbanites.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column16: the Confederacy of Independent Systems invaded Mimban to secure its mineral wealth. The Galactic Republic deployed clone troopers to liberate the planet
column17: earning the gratitude of the native population.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: the very soldiers who had once protected Mimban were ordered to subjugate it. The Empire established a significant military presence
column19: constructing facilities and pressing the local population into forced labor in the mines. What had been defended by the Republic became another world crushed under Imperial rule.\n\nThe Empire's occupation proved brutal and prolonged. Imperial garrison bases spread across the surface
column20: though the hostile environment and constant guerrilla resistance from the Mimbanites made full control difficult. The swamps became a quagmire for Imperial forces as the native population waged persistent insurgency.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column21: Mimban served as a battleground between Imperial forces and local resistance fighters. The Empire conducted extensive mining operations
column22: extracting hyperbaride minerals while treating both planet and inhabitants with callous disregard. Soldiers endured constant exposure to muddy terrain
column23: limited visibility due to perpetual fog
column24: and frequent ambushes by resistance fighters and dangerous native creatures. The planet became known among Imperial forces as one of the worst possible postings.\n\nShortly before the Battle of Yavin
column25: the smuggler Han Solo was briefly imprisoned on Mimban after desertion from the Imperial Navy. His experiences reinforced his cynical view of galactic governments and conflicts.\n\nFollowing the Battle of Endor
column26: Imperial control over Mimban weakened considerably
column27: though the planet remained contested. Various Imperial remnant factions sought to maintain control over mining operations
column28: while local resistance groups worked to drive out remaining Imperial presence.\n\nAfter the formation of the New Republic
column29: Mimban's status remained uncertain. The native Mimbanites
column30: having endured decades of exploitation
column31: maintained strong distrust of offworld governments and continued fighting for independence and control over their world's resources."

Text: "The Calamari system
column4: also known as the Mon Calamari system and called the Daca system by the natives
column5: is an eight-planet binary star system that is the home of the planet Mon Calamari. It is the capital system of the Calamari sector in the Outer Rim"

Text: "Mon Calamari
column4: also known as 'Mon Cala' and 'Dac'
column5: is an oceanic planet located in the Calamari system of the Outer Rim Territories. The planet's surface is entirely covered by water
column6: with no landmasses visible above the waves. Beneath the turbulent oceans lie sprawling underwater cities built by the planet's two native sentient species: the amphibious Mon Calamari and the squid-headed Quarren.\n\nThe Mon Calamari are known throughout the galaxy for their shipbuilding prowess and peaceful nature
column7: while the Quarren tend to be more conservative and isolationist. Despite their differences and occasional conflicts
column8: the two species have generally coexisted through a shared planetary government
column9: though tensions between them have erupted into violence at various points in history.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Mon Calamari joined the Galactic Republic and became a prominent member world. The planet's shipbuilding industry
column11: centered around Mon Calamari Shipyards
column12: produced elegant vessels known for their organic
column13: flowing designs and exceptional durability. These ships became prized throughout the galaxy for both civilian and military applications.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column14: Mon Calamari remained loyal to the Republic despite brief occupation by Separatist forces. The planet's strategic importance and industrial capacity made it a target for both sides of the conflict. Following the rise of the Galactic Empire
column15: Mon Calamari initially accepted Imperial oversight
column16: though many Mon Calamari were uncomfortable with the authoritarian nature of the new government.\n\nThe Empire's occupation of Mon Calamari proved brutal and exploitative. Imperial forces enslaved much of the population and attempted to adapt Mon Calamari technology for Imperial use
column17: though they never fully succeeded in understanding the unique construction methods. The Mon Calamari and Quarren were forced to work in their own shipyards under Imperial supervision
column18: producing vessels for the Imperial Navy.\n\nThe oppression eventually sparked resistance movements among both species. When the Quarren Isolation League attempted to collaborate with the Empire against the Mon Calamari
column19: it nearly triggered a civil war between the two species. However
column20: Mon Calamari leader Admiral Ackbar helped unite both species against their Imperial oppressors.\n\nMon Calamari's liberation from Imperial rule came through a coordinated uprising supported by the Rebel Alliance. The planet's inhabitants seized control of their shipyards and converted their civilian vessels into warships. Mon Calamari Star Cruisers
column21: retrofitted from luxury liners and passenger ships
column22: became the backbone of the Rebel fleet and some of the most formidable capital ships in the galaxy.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column23: Mon Calamari became one of the Alliance's most important allies and members. The planet's contribution of capital ships and skilled officers
column24: including the legendary Admiral Ackbar
column25: proved crucial to the Rebellion's success. Mon Calamari vessels participated in numerous major battles
column26: including the Battle of Endor where they helped destroy the second Death Star.\n\nFollowing the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column27: Mon Calamari became one of the New Republic's strongest supporters. The planet's shipyards continued producing vessels for the New Republic Defense Fleet
column28: including advanced Star Cruiser designs that improved upon the original wartime conversions. The planet remained a vital economic and military center for the New Republic despite being nominally under Corporate Sector Authority control
column29: with its shipbuilding industry adapting to peacetime production while maintaining the capability to produce warships when needed."

Text: "Mon Gazza system is a star system located within the Lambda sector of the Mid Rim
column4: and contain the planet Mon Gazza."

Text: "Mon Gazza is a temperate planet located in the Lambda sector of the Mid Rim Territories. A world known for its gambling industry and entertainment districts
column4: Mon Gazza developed into a significant waypoint for travelers and traders moving through the region.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column5: forests
column6: and scattered urban centers that grew around its famous casinos and racing circuits. Mon Gazza's economy has long been tied to tourism and entertainment
column7: with gambling establishments and podracing tracks attracting visitors from across the galaxy.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column8: Mon Gazza was discovered and settled
column9: developing a reputation as a destination for those seeking recreation and games of chance. The planet maintained membership in the Galactic Republic for thousands of years
column10: though its focus on entertainment meant it remained somewhat peripheral to major political affairs.\n\nMon Gazza became particularly famous for its podracing events
column11: hosting numerous competitions that drew both professional racers and spectators from throughout the galaxy. The planet's racing circuits were considered among the most challenging and prestigious in the sport
column12: with victories at Mon Gazza bringing significant fame to successful podracers.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column13: Mon Gazza remained under Republic control
column14: though its remote location spared it from major battles. The planet continued to host podracing events and maintain its entertainment industry despite the surrounding galactic conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column15: Mon Gazza came under Imperial oversight. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to ensure order and collect taxes from the lucrative gambling and entertainment industries
column16: though local authorities retained considerable autonomy in managing day-to-day affairs.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column17: Mon Gazza remained under nominal Imperial control
column18: serving as a waypoint for Imperial supply lines operating in the Mid Rim. The planet's focus on entertainment and its distance from major conflict zones allowed it to avoid much of the devastation that befell other worlds during this period.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column19: Mon Gazza's status became uncertain as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for influence throughout the Mid Rim territories. The planet's entertainment industry continued to operate
column20: adapting to the changing political landscape of the post-Imperial era."

Text: "The Mustafar system in the Outer Rim Territories is centered around the star Priate
column4: around which orbiting five planets
column5: including Jestefad
column6: Mustafar
column7: and Lefrani."

Text: "Mustafar is a small
column4: volcanic planet located in the Mustafar system of the Outer Rim Territories. The planet's surface is dominated by rivers of lava
column5: volcanic peaks
column6: and ash-covered wastelands
column7: making it one of the most inhospitable worlds in the known galaxy. Despite its harsh environment
column8: Mustafar has been inhabited for thousands of years due to the valuable minerals that can be extracted from its lava flows.\n\nThe planet's native species
column9: the insectoid Mustafarians
column10: evolved to survive in this extreme environment
column11: developing heat-resistant exoskeletons and building their settlements on platforms above the lava flows. The Mustafarians are divided into two distinct subspecies: the tall
column12: thin Northern Mustafarians who manage the lava mining operations
column13: and the shorter
column14: stockier Southern Mustafarians who serve as laborers.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column15: Mustafar was discovered by the Techno Union
column16: who recognized the planet's potential for mining valuable ores and crystals from the lava. The Techno Union established massive mining facilities across the planet's surface
column17: employing the native Mustafarians to operate the complex machinery required to extract and process the minerals.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column18: Mustafar remained under Techno Union control and served as a Separatist stronghold. The planet's remote location and hostile environment made it an ideal refuge for Separatist leaders seeking to avoid Republic forces.\n\nAt the end of the Clone Wars
column19: Mustafar became the site of one of the most significant events in galactic history. Following the execution of Order 66 and the transformation of the Republic into the Galactic Empire
column20: the Separatist Council fled to Mustafar
column21: believing they would be safe in the heavily fortified mining facilities. However
column22: the newly anointed Darth Vader arrived on the planet with orders from Emperor Palpatine to eliminate the Separatist leadership.\n\nVader systematically executed the members of the Separatist Council in the main control center of the mining facility
column23: ending the Clone Wars and eliminating the final remnants of the Separatist movement. Following this massacre
column24: Vader's former master
column25: Obi-Wan Kenobi
column26: confronted him on Mustafar in a desperate attempt to stop his former apprentice's fall to the dark side.\n\nThe duel between Kenobi and Vader
column27: fought across the treacherous lava flows and collapsing mining structures
column28: resulted in Vader's defeat and severe injuries. Left burning on the shores of a lava river
column29: Vader was rescued by Emperor Palpatine and encased in the black armor that would become synonymous with his reign of terror.\n\nFollowing these events
column30: Mustafar fell under Imperial control. The Empire maintained the mining operations and used the planet as a source of valuable minerals for military production. The Emperor also constructed a fortress on Mustafar for Darth Vader
column31: built on the site where Vader had been defeated by Kenobi. This dark stronghold served as Vader's personal retreat and a place of meditation in the dark side of the Force.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column32: Mustafar remained an Imperial-controlled world
column33: though its strategic importance diminished. The mining operations continued under various Imperial remnant factions
column34: with the native Mustafarians maintaining their role in the extraction and processing of the planet's mineral wealth."

Text: "The Muunilinst system is a 6-orbit system that contain the planet of Muunilinst."
"Muunilinst is a prosperous banking world located in the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Braxant Run hyperlane. The capital planet of the InterGalactic Banking Clan and homeworld of the Muun species
column5: Muunilinst has served as one of the galaxy's primary financial centers for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column6: mountain ranges
column7: and sprawling urban centers dominated by towering financial institutions and corporate headquarters. The native Muuns
column8: known for their extraordinary mathematical abilities and shrewd business acumen
column9: built their civilization around banking
column10: investments
column11: and financial management
column12: establishing Muunilinst as an essential hub for galactic commerce.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Muunilinst joined the Galactic Republic and quickly became its primary financial institution. The InterGalactic Banking Clan
column14: headquartered on Muunilinst
column15: managed Republic credits
column16: financed major projects
column17: and provided loans to governments and corporations throughout the galaxy. The Muuns' reputation for financial expertise made them indispensable to the galactic economy.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column18: Muunilinst maintained strict neutrality in most conflicts
column19: viewing war as detrimental to business interests. However
column20: the Banking Clan's influence grew so substantial that it wielded considerable political power within the Republic Senate
column21: often using its financial leverage to advance Muun interests.\n\nIn the decades before the Clone Wars
column22: tensions between the Republic and various commercial interests grew. San Hill
column23: Chairman of the InterGalactic Banking Clan
column24: began to question the Republic's stability and the security of Muun investments. When Count Dooku founded the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column25: Hill secretly aligned the Banking Clan with the Separatist movement
column26: providing crucial financial backing for their military buildup.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column27: Muunilinst officially declared for the Confederacy
column28: becoming one of the Separatists' most important financial centers. The planet's wealth and the Banking Clan's resources proved vital to sustaining the Separatist war effort. However
column29: this alignment made Muunilinst a priority target for Republic forces.\n\nThe Battle of Muunilinst occurred when Republic forces launched a major assault on the planet to cripple Separatist finances. The battle saw intense fighting both in space and on the planet's surface
column30: with Republic clone troopers engaging battle droids while Republic starfighters dueled Separatist vessels. During this battle
column31: Jedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi led Republic forces against the formidable bounty hunter Durge. The Republic ultimately claimed victory
column32: dealing a significant blow to Separatist financial operations.\n\nFollowing the Republic's conquest
column33: Muunilinst came under military occupation. The Banking Clan's assets were seized
column34: and San Hill was arrested for his role in funding the Separatist war machine. The occupation proved controversial
column35: as many neutral systems viewed it as the Republic overstepping its authority and interfering in legitimate business operations.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column36: Muunilinst was forcibly integrated into the Imperial financial system. Emperor Palpatine nationalized the Banking Clan
column37: absorbing its assets and using Muunilinst's banking infrastructure to manage Imperial finances. The Muuns
column38: while resentful of their loss of independence
column39: had little choice but to cooperate with the new regime. Imperial oversight brought increased regulation and surveillance to the planet's financial sector.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column40: Muunilinst remained under firm Imperial control due to its financial importance. The Empire maintained a strong garrison to protect the planet's banking institutions and ensure the continued flow of credits to Imperial coffers. However
column41: many Muuns privately sympathized with the Rebel Alliance
column42: though few dared to act on these sympathies given the Empire's heavy presence.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column43: Muunilinst's status became uncertain. Various Imperial remnant factions sought to control the planet and its financial resources
column44: while the New Republic also recognized its strategic importance. The Banking Clan
column45: having operated under Imperial control for decades
column46: worked in the shadows to reestablish its independence."

Text: "The Mygeeto system is a star system located in the Albarrio sector of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: and contain the crystalline planet Mygeeto. It is home to the native Lurmen species."

Text: "Mygeeto is a frozen crystalline planet located in the Albarrio sector of the Outer Rim Territories. Covered in ice and dotted with jagged crystal formations
column4: Mygeeto's harsh environment belies its immense strategic and economic value. Beneath the planet's frozen surface lie vast deposits of precious crystals and valuable minerals
column5: making it one of the wealthiest worlds in the galaxy.\n\nThe InterGalactic Banking Clan maintained a significant presence on Mygeeto for thousands of years
column6: using the planet as a repository for some of their most valuable assets. Massive vaults built deep within the ice contained not only credits and treasures
column7: but also artwork
column8: historical artifacts
column9: and other items of immense worth. The Banking Clan's control over Mygeeto's resources made it one of their most important holdings.\n\nThe planet is also home to the native Lurmen species
column10: a peaceful
column11: pacifistic people who prefer to avoid conflict. However
column12: the Banking Clan's exploitation of the planet meant that the Lurmen had little say in the fate of their homeworld.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column13: Mygeeto's allegiance to the Banking Clan meant it fell under Separatist control. The planet became a major Separatist stronghold
column14: with Chairman San Hill overseeing operations from the planet's surface. The Banking Clan's wealth and Mygeeto's strategic location made it a priority target for the Republic.\n\nThe Battle of Mygeeto was one of the final major engagements of the Clone Wars
column15: occurring simultaneously with battles on other Separatist worlds as part of the Republic's final push. Jedi Master Ki-Adi-Mundi led Republic clone troopers in an assault on the planet's crystal cities
column16: fighting through heavy Separatist resistance. The battle was brutal
column17: with fighting taking place among the towering crystal spires and frozen streets.\n\nDuring the battle
column18: Order 66 was executed. Commander Bacara and his clone troopers turned on Ki-Adi-Mundi
column19: killing the Jedi Master on the frozen battlefield. Following the Republic's victory and the rise of the Galactic Empire
column20: Mygeeto fell under Imperial control.\n\nThe Empire maintained a strong presence on Mygeeto to secure the Banking Clan's vaults and the planet's mineral wealth. Imperial forces established garrisons throughout the crystal cities
column21: using the planet's resources to fund Imperial operations. The frozen world remained an important Imperial asset throughout the Galactic Civil War
column22: with its wealth helping to sustain the Imperial war machine.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column23: control of Mygeeto became contested between various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic. The planet's immense wealth made it a prize worth fighting for
column24: with multiple factions seeking to claim the Banking Clan's vaults and the crystalline resources buried beneath the ice."

Text: "Being located in Wild space
column4: at 'the end of the galaxy'
column5: this system is avoided by most people around the galaxy.\nFormerly hosting a Corporate Sector Authority penal facility
column6: the system is now devoid of any meaningful activity
column7: except for the occasional miners and pirates."

Text: "Being located in Wild space
column4: at 'the end of the galaxy'
column5: this system is avoided by most people around the galaxy.\n\nFormerly hosting a Corporate Sector Authority penal facility
column6: the system is now devoid of any meaningful activity
column7: except for the occasional miners and pirates."

Text: "The Naboo system is a large star system located within the Chommell sector of the Mid Rim
column4: which contain planets such as Naboo
column5: Erep and Widow as well as their moons. It is centered around the star Naboo."

Text: "Naboo is a lush
column4: verdant world located in the Chommell sector of the Mid Rim Territories. A planet of rolling hills
column5: vast grasslands
column6: and pristine bodies of water
column7: Naboo is renowned for its extraordinary natural beauty and harmonious society.\n\nThe planet is inhabited by two native sentient species. The amphibious Gungans dwell in underwater cities like Otoh Gunga in Lake Paonga
column8: while the human Naboo inhabit elegant surface cities
column9: with Theed serving as the capital.\n\nNaboo's government is unique - an elected constitutional monarchy where the monarch serves alongside the Royal Advisory Council. This democratic approach has created a stable
column10: prosperous society valuing peace
column11: education
column12: and the arts.\n\nApproximately 32 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: this peaceful existence shattered when the Trade Federation
column14: manipulated by Darth Sidious
column15: invaded the planet. Queen Padmé Amidala escaped with Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn and Padawan Obi-Wan Kenobi
column16:
encountering young Anakin Skywalker on Tatooine during their journey.

Amidala courageously returned and forged an unprecedented alliance with the Gungan Grand Army led by Boss Nass. This historic cooperation between the two peoples proved decisive in liberating Naboo. The crisis led to Senator Palpatine of Naboo becoming Supreme Chancellor - actually Darth Sidious executing his plan to rule the galaxy.

Following her term as Queen
column17: Amidala became Naboo's senator
column18: advocating for peace and democracy. During the Clone Wars
column19: Naboo remained loyal to the Republic despite its pacifist traditions. Amidala's secret marriage to Anakin Skywalker was consummated on Naboo
column20: in the beautiful lake country.\n\nFollowing the Empire's rise
column21: Naboo came under Imperial control. The planet's connection to Emperor Palpatine ensured favorable treatment
column22: though Imperial presence ended democratic processes. Queen Apailana secretly aided surviving Jedi
column23: leading to her assassination by Imperial forces.\n\nDespite occupation
column24: Naboo maintained its cultural identity and beauty. The Empire avoided over-industrialization of their Emperor's homeworld
column25: though Imperial demonstrations became regular occurrences in Theed.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column26: Naboo officially remained loyal to the Empire. Following the Emperor's death at Endor
column27: massive celebrations erupted as citizens tore down Imperial monuments. Many Naboo felt betrayed that their homeworld had produced such evil.\n\nAfter Endor
column28: Naboo allied with the New Republic while still establishing its independence. The monarchy resumed its traditional role
column29: and cooperation between humans and Gungans strengthened as both species worked to ensure their homeworld would never again be used as a tool for galactic domination."

Text: "Nal Hutta
column4: also known simply as Hutta
column5: is a hot
column6: swampy planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories that is the homeworld of the Hutt species. The planet is a haven for the criminal elements of the galaxy
column7: located far from galactic authorities."

Text: "Nal Hutta
column4: known simply as 'Hutta' and formerly called 'Evocar'
column5: is a hot
column6: swampy planet located in the Hutt Space region of the Outer Rim Territories. The homeworld of the powerful Hutt species
column7: Nal Hutta orbits the star Ardos within the Y'Toub system
column8: accompanied by five moons including the infamous Smuggler's Moon of Nar Shaddaa.\n\nThe planet's surface is dominated by fetid bogs
column9: stagnant meres
column10: and patches of sickly forest
column11: creating a humid and noxious environment that most species find unpleasant. Ancient metallic structures from the original inhabitants rise from the swamps
column12: now claimed by the Hutts as their palaces and strongholds. The atmosphere itself is polluted and hazy
column13: the result of millennia of industrial activity and deliberate environmental degradation.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column14: Evocar was home to the Evocii
column15: a primitive humanoid species. When the Hutts arrived in the system fleeing the destruction of their original homeworld Varl
column16: they purchased land from the Evocii through a series of treaties and agreements. Over time
column17: through legal manipulation and exploitation
column18: the Hutts gradually acquired the entire planet
column19: eventually relocating the Evocii to Nar Shaddaa. There
column20: the displaced species were forced into servitude and poverty
column21: ultimately devolving over generations due to harsh conditions and exploitation.\n\nThe Hutts terraformed much of Evocar to match the humid
column22: swampy environment of lost Varl
column23: renaming it Nal Hutta
column24: meaning ""Glorious Jewel"" in Huttese. The planet became the center of Hutt Space
column25: a region of the galaxy largely independent from Republic and later Imperial control. From their palaces on Nal Hutta
column26: powerful Hutt crime lords
column27: known as kajidics
column28: conducted their business operations spanning smuggling
column29: slavery
column30: spice trafficking
column31: and countless other illicit enterprises.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column32: Nal Hutta maintained nominal membership in the Galactic Republic while operating with near-complete autonomy. The Republic had little control over Hutt Space
column33: with Senate representatives from the region often serving as mere formalities while the Hutt Grand Council wielded true power. The planet became synonymous with corruption and crime
column34: attracting outlaws
column35: smugglers
column36: bounty hunters
column37: and others seeking to operate beyond the reach of Republic law.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column38: Nal Hutta and the Hutt Cartel maintained official neutrality
column39: though individual Hutts conducted business with both the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The planet avoided major battles
column40: with the Hutts skillfully playing both sides against each other for profit. Jabba the Hutt
column41: one of the most powerful crime lords of the era
column42: maintained his primary operations from Tatooine but retained significant holdings on Nal Hutta.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column43: Nal Hutta's status remained largely unchanged. Emperor Palpatine
column44: recognizing the impracticality of conquering Hutt Space
column45: negotiated agreements that allowed the Hutts to maintain their independence in exchange for certain concessions and cooperation on matters of Imperial interest. The Empire maintained only a minimal presence in the system
column46: with Hutt crime syndicates continuing to operate openly.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column47: Nal Hutta remained neutral territory
column48: with the Hutts conducting business with the Empire
column50: and various other factions as opportunities arose. The planet served as a safe haven for criminals and fugitives from across the galaxy
column51: its swamps and palaces hosting countless dealings in contraband
column53: and information.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the death of Jabba the Hutt
column54: Nal Hutta saw increased competition among Hutt kajidics vying for dominance in the vacuum left by Jabba's demise. The planet remained independent throughout the formation of the New Republic
column55: with the Hutts seeking to expand their criminal enterprises and territorial control over Hutt Space."

Text: "The Nanth'ri system is a star system located in the Kurost sector in the region of the galaxy known as the Mid Rim. The system contain the planet Nanth'ri."
"Nanth'ri is a terrestrial planet located in the Kurost sector of the Mid Rim Territories. A world of varied terrain including plains
column4: forests
column5: and scattered settlements
column6: Nanth'ri remained largely isolated from major galactic conflicts for much of its history.\n\nThe planet maintained a relatively quiet existence during the Old Republic era
column7: serving as a minor agricultural and trade center. Its remote location kept it peripheral to the political intrigues of the Core Worlds.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column8: Nanth'ri's isolation spared it from major battles
column9: though the planet was nominally within Separatist space. The world's inhabitants continued their traditional way of life despite the surrounding galactic turmoil.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Nanth'ri fell under Imperial authority
column11: however given the world's limited strategic importance it was de facto controlled by the Hutt Cartell.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column12: Nanth'ri remained under nominal Imperial control. However
column13: the planet's distance from major conflict zones and lack of significant military infrastructure meant it avoided much of the devastation that befell other worlds during this turbulent period.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the fragmentation of Imperial authority
column14: Nanth'ri's status became uncertain as various Imperial remnant factions
column15: the Hutt Cartel
column16: and the New Republic competed for influence throughout the Mid Rim territories. The planet's inhabitants continued their agrarian traditions."

Text: "Nar Shaddaa
column4: nicknamed the ""Smuggler's Moon
column5: is the notorious moon of the planet Nal Hutta
column6: homeworld of the Hutt species. It is home to a large criminal underworld dominated by bounty hunters and Hutt crime lords."

Text: "Nar Shaddaa
column4: known as the ""Smuggler's Moon
column5: is the largest moon orbiting the Hutt homeworld of Nal Hutta in the Hutt Space region of the Outer Rim Territories. A massive ecumenopolis entirely covered by urban sprawl
column6: Nar Shaddaa is one of the most infamous worlds in the galaxy
column7: renowned as a haven for smugglers
column8: criminals
column9: and those seeking to operate beyond the reach of galactic law.\n\nThe moon's surface is dominated by towering skyscrapers that reach kilometers into the atmosphere
column10: creating artificial canyons of durasteel and transparisteel. The lower levels
column11: shrouded in perpetual darkness
column12: are home to the poorest inhabitants and most dangerous criminals
column13: while the upper levels host casinos
column14: cantinas
column15: and the palatial estates of crime lords. Unlike the swamps of Nal Hutta below
column16: Nar Shaddaa is entirely urbanized
column17: with no natural environment remaining.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: Nar Shaddaa was originally home to the Evocii
column19: the native species of the Nal Hutta system. When the Hutts arrived after the destruction of their original homeworld Varl
column20: they gradually acquired the moon through a series of exploitative treaties and legal manipulations. The Evocii were eventually forced into servitude and poverty
column21: their civilization destroyed by Hutt expansion.\n\nThe Hutts transformed Nar Shaddaa into a massive spaceport and industrial center
column22: using it as a hub for their criminal enterprises while ruling from the swamps of Nal Hutta below. Over millennia
column23: the moon developed into a lawless refuge where any commodity could be bought or sold
column24: and any service obtained for the right price. The Hutt Cartel maintained loose control over the moon
column25: collecting tribute from various criminal organizations while allowing them considerable autonomy.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column26: Nar Shaddaa operated largely outside Republic jurisdiction despite nominal membership in the galactic government. The Republic had minimal presence on the moon
column27: with Hutt influence ensuring that Republic law enforcement could accomplish little. The moon became a major center for the slave trade
column28: spice trafficking
column29: and smuggling operations that supplied illegal goods throughout the galaxy.\n\nThe moon's refugee sector grew over the centuries as beings from across the galaxy fled war
column30: poverty
column31: and persecution
column32: seeking refuge in Nar Shaddaa's shadows. These desperate populations provided cheap labor for the moon's factories and easy recruits for criminal organizations. The refugee sector became one of the most densely populated areas in the known galaxy
column33: with beings living in squalid conditions while crime lords profited from their misery.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column34: Nar Shaddaa remained neutral territory
column35: with the Hutt Cartel refusing to commit to either the Republic or the Separatists. However
column36: individual Hutts conducted business with both sides
column37: selling weapons
column38: supplies
column39: and information to whoever could pay. The moon's shipyards and factories continued producing civilian vessels and equipment
column40: though many of these found their way to both Republic and Separatist forces through black market channels.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column41: Nar Shaddaa's status remained largely unchanged. Emperor Palpatine
column42: recognizing the impracticality of conquering Hutt Space
column43: negotiated agreements that allowed the Hutts to maintain independence in exchange for certain concessions. The Empire maintained only a token presence on Nar Shaddaa
column44: with most Imperial activity limited to pursuing specific high-value targets or conducting covert operations.\n\nThe moon became an even more important haven for those fleeing Imperial persecution
column45: including former Jedi
column46: Rebel sympathizers
column47: and political dissidents. The Empire's inability to effectively police Nar Shaddaa made it a valuable resource for the Rebel Alliance
column48: which used the moon as a source of supplies
column51: the moon's criminal underworld proved as dangerous to Rebels as to Imperials
column52: with bounty hunters and mercenaries hunting Alliance members for profit.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column53: Nar Shaddaa thrived as a neutral ground where representatives of the Empire
column55: and various criminal organizations could conduct business. The moon's cantinas and establishments hosted countless deals and betrayals
column56: with information and contraband flowing freely through its endless corridors and landing bays. Jabba the Hutt maintained significant operations on Nar Shaddaa despite ruling primarily from Tatooine
column57: using the moon as a hub for his far-reaching criminal empire.\n\nThe Black Sun crime syndicate also maintained a strong presence on Nar Shaddaa
column58: competing with the Hutt Cartel for control of various criminal enterprises. The Exchange
column60: operated throughout the moon's lower levels
column61: exploiting the desperate refugee populations and maintaining networks of informants and enforcers.\n\nThe moon's red light sector
column62: became infamous throughout the galaxy for its entertainment establishments
column63: many of which operated on the edge of or beyond legal boundaries even by Nar Shaddaa's lax standards. The sector catered to every vice and desire
column64: attracting wealthy patrons from across the galaxy while generating enormous profits for its criminal operators.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the death of Emperor Palpatine
column65: Nar Shaddaa continued its existence as a criminal haven. The formation of the New Republic brought little change to the moon
column66: as the new government proved as unable as the Empire to exert meaningful control over Hutt Space. Following Jabba the Hutt's death
column67: various Hutt kajidics competed for control of his former territories
column69: leading to increased violence and instability.\n\nThe moon remained a vital stopover point for smugglers running the Corellian Run and other major trade routes
column70: its shipyards and repair facilities serving vessels of all types regardless of their origins or cargo. Despite its reputation for danger and lawlessness
column72: Nar Shaddaa continued to attract beings from across the galaxy seeking fortune
column74: or simply a place to disappear."

Text: "The Nazzri system is a star system located in the Lantillian sector of the Mid Rim that contain the planet Nazzri
column4: which is inhabited by the Nazzar. It was the site of a major battle in the Great Sith War
column5: and another in the Mandalorian Wars"

Text: "Nazzri is a terrestrial planet located in the Lantillian sector of the Mid Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Perlemian Trade Route. A world of varied terrain including mountains
column5: forests
column6: and plains
column7: Nazzri is home to the native Nazzar species
column8: a humanoid race known for their martial traditions and strong sense of honor.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: Nazzri became embroiled in galactic conflicts due to its strategic location along the Perlemian Trade Route. During the Great Sith War
column10: approximately four thousand years before the rise of the Empire
column11: the planet was the site of a significant battle as Sith forces sought to control the vital trade corridor. The conflict left lasting scars on Nazzri's infrastructure and population.\n\nCenturies later
column12: during the Mandalorian Wars
column13: Nazzri once again became a battleground as Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders swept through the Mid Rim in their campaign of conquest. The Battle of Nazzri saw intense fighting between Mandalorian forces and Republic defenders
column14: with the Nazzar themselves taking up arms to defend their homeworld. Though the Republic ultimately prevailed
column15: the planet suffered significant damage and loss of life.\n\nFollowing these conflicts
column16: Nazzri recovered slowly
column17: maintaining its membership in the Galactic Republic while developing a reputation for producing skilled warriors and military officers. The Nazzar's martial culture
column18: forged through centuries of defending their world
column19: made them valued recruits for Republic military forces.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column20: Nazzri remained loyal to the Republic
column21: contributing both troops and resources to the war effort. The planet's strategic position along the Perlemian Trade Route made it an important logistics hub for Republic forces operating in the Mid Rim.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column22: Nazzri came under Imperial control. The Empire maintained a garrison on the planet to protect the vital trade route and ensure compliance with Imperial regulations. Many Nazzar continued to serve in military capacities
column23: though now under the Imperial banner rather than the Republic.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column24: Nazzri remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. However
column25: the planet's population was divided
column26: with some Nazzar supporting the Empire while others sympathized with the Rebel Alliance. The planet's martial traditions meant that whichever side controlled Nazzri gained access to skilled warriors and officers.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column27: Nazzri's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions
column28: criminal syndicates
column29: corporations
column30: and the New Republic competed for control of key positions along the Perlemian Trade Route. The planet's strategic importance ensured it remained a valuable prize in the post-Imperial conflicts that shaped the early years of the New Republic."

Text: "Necropolis is a tombworld located on the Giju Run of the Core Worlds. Serving as a burial place for beings from all over the Core
column4: it is also the home of boneworms and cryptberries."

Text: "Necropolis is a remote tombworld located in the Core Worlds region of the galaxy
column4: positioned along the Giju Run hyperlane. Unlike most inhabited worlds
column5: Necropolis serves primarily as a massive cemetery and burial ground
column6: with its surface dominated by endless fields of graves
column7: crypts
column8: mausoleums
column9: and memorial monuments stretching across its landscape.\n\nFor thousands of years
column10: wealthy families and prominent individuals from across the Core Worlds have chosen Necropolis as their final resting place. The planet's entire economy revolves around funerary services
column11: with undertakers
column12: gravediggers
column13: monument crafters
column14: and various death-care professionals forming the bulk of the living population. The world maintains a somber
column15: reverent atmosphere
column16: with strict regulations governing conduct and commerce.\n\nThe planet's ecosystem includes several species that have adapted to its unique environment. Boneworms
column17: creatures that feed on decaying organic matter
column18: can be found throughout the graveyards
column19: serving an important role in the natural decomposition process. Cryptberries
column20: a plant species that grows among the graves
column21: produce fruit that the local population harvests and processes into various products.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column22: Necropolis maintained its role as a prestigious burial world
column23: with senators
column24: Jedi Masters
column25: war heroes
column26: and wealthy merchants all seeking interment on its hallowed grounds. The planet joined the Galactic Republic early in its history and remained a loyal member world
column27: though its population remained small and focused entirely on mortuary services.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column28: Necropolis continued its traditional function despite the surrounding galactic conflict. The war brought an increased number of burials as casualties mounted
column29: with many Republic officers and clone troopers laid to rest on the tombworld alongside civilians who perished in the conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column30: Necropolis came under Imperial oversight
column31: though the planet's unique purpose meant it received little direct interference. The Empire maintained only a minimal garrison
column32: primarily to ensure order and prevent grave robbing or other criminal activities. Imperial officers and loyalists continued to choose Necropolis for burial
column33: alongside Republic veterans and other citizens.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column34: Necropolis remained largely isolated from the conflict due to its lack of strategic military or economic value. The planet continued to serve its mortuary function for all sides
column35: with Imperial officers
column36: Rebel soldiers
column37: and civilians all finding their final rest among its endless graves.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column38: Necropolis maintained its status as the Core Worlds' premier cemetery world. The planet's vast graveyards now contained the remains of beings from multiple eras of galactic history
column39: serving as a silent monument to all those who had lived and died throughout the millennia of galactic civilization."

Text: "The Neimoidia system is a star system located in the galaxy's Colonies. It contain the planet Neimoidia along with its moon. The Trellen Trade Route run through the Neimoidia system."
"Neimoidia is a wealthy planet located in the Colonies region of the galaxy
column4: positioned along the Trellen Trade Route. The homeworld of the Neimoidian species
column5: Neimoidia is known for its extravagant architecture and ostentatious displays of wealth. The planet's surface features towering bridge cities suspended over deep canyons and valleys
column6: with elaborate spires and platforms connected by graceful arches.\n\nThe Neimoidians are a humanoid species descended from Duro colonists who settled the planet thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Over time
column7: the harsh environment of Neimoidia shaped their evolution
column8: with grubs competing for limited food supplies creating a culture that emphasized wealth accumulation and personal advancement above all else. This cultural trait would define Neimoidian society for millennia.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Empire
column9: Neimoidia joined the Galactic Republic and quickly became an important commercial center. The Neimoidians proved to be shrewd businesspeople and traders
column10: establishing commercial networks throughout the galaxy. Their natural aptitude for commerce led many Neimoidians to pursue careers in trade and finance.\n\nThe Trade Federation
column11: one of the galaxy's most powerful commercial organizations
column12: came under Neimoidian control
column13: with its leadership dominated by wealthy Neimoidian merchants. The Federation's headquarters were established on Neimoidia
column14: making the planet the center of one of the galaxy's most influential corporate entities. The Neimoidians used their control of the Trade Federation to amass enormous wealth and political influence within the Republic.\n\nDuring the final decades of the Republic
column15: the Trade Federation grew increasingly powerful and brazenly corrupt. Neimoidia became synonymous with corporate greed and political manipulation
column16: with Neimoidian leaders like Nute Gunray using their positions to enrich themselves while exploiting legal loopholes to avoid Republic taxation and regulation.\n\nApproximately 32 years before the rise of the Empire
column17: the Trade Federation
column18: under Neimoidian leadership and secret manipulation by Darth Sidious
column19: blockaded and invaded Naboo. This act
column20: known as the Invasion of Naboo
column21: was ostensibly in protest of taxation of trade routes
column22: though it was actually part of Sidious's grand plan to destabilize the Republic. The invasion failed when Queen Padmé Amidala rallied her people and defeated the droid army
column23: but the incident revealed the extent of Neimoidian willingness to use military force for commercial advantage.\n\nDespite the Trade Federation's role in the Naboo Crisis
column24: Nute Gunray and the Neimoidian leadership escaped serious punishment due to legal maneuvering and corruption within the Republic courts. This failure of justice would have far-reaching consequences for the galaxy.\n\nWhen Count Dooku founded the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column25: the Trade Federation
column26: under Neimoidian control
column27: became one of the Separatist movement's most important members. Neimoidia officially joined the Confederacy
column28: providing substantial financial resources and battle droid armies to the Separatist cause. The planet became a major Separatist stronghold and remained so throughout the Clone Wars.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column29: Republic forces launched several campaigns against Neimoidia
column30: recognizing its importance as both a Separatist fortress world and the headquarters of the Trade Federation. The planet's strong defenses and strategic location made it a difficult target
column31: and fighting on Neimoidia was fierce. The famous Jedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi led Republic forces in attacks on the planet on multiple occasions.\n\nToward the end of the Clone Wars
column32: Neimoidia hosted members of the Separatist Council
column33: who believed the planet's defenses would protect them from Republic attacks. However
column34: following the rise of the Galactic Empire and the execution of Order 66
column35: the Separatist leadership was forced to flee to Mustafar
column36: where they were ultimately executed by Darth Vader.\n\nFollowing the Empire's rise
column37: Neimoidia came under Imperial control. The planet's commercial importance meant the Empire maintained oversight of its economic activities
column38: though the Neimoidians' business acumen ensured they continued to prosper under the new regime. However
column39: the Trade Federation was reorganized and brought under Imperial authority
column40: ending Neimoidian dominance of that organization.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column41: Neimoidia remained under Imperial control
column42: serving as an important commercial center for the Empire. The planet's wealth and industrial capacity contributed to Imperial economic strength
column43: though many Neimoidians privately resented Imperial oversight of their business operations.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column44: Neimoidia's status became contested. The planet's commercial value made it a prize for various factions competing for control in the post-Imperial era. The Neimoidians
column45: pragmatic as always
column46: sought to position themselves advantageously regardless of which government ultimately prevailed."

Text: "The Nimban system is located in Hutt Space. It contain the planet Nimban."
"Nimban is a terrestrial planet located in Hutt Space within the Outer Rim Territories. A humid
column4: swampy world covered in dense jungles and murky wetlands
column5: Nimban is the homeworld of the Nimbanel species
column6: a highly intelligent humanoid race known for their exceptional mathematical and computational abilities.\n\nThe Nimbanel developed a sophisticated society centered around logic
column7: mathematics
column8: and bureaucratic efficiency. Their natural aptitude for calculations and data analysis made them highly valued throughout the galaxy as accountants
column9: statisticians
column10: and financial experts. Many Nimbanel left their humid homeworld to pursue careers in banking
column11: commerce
column12: and corporate management on more developed worlds.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Nimban fell under the control of the Hutt Cartel. The Hutts recognized the value of the Nimbanel's analytical skills and incorporated them into their criminal enterprises
column14: employing many as accountants and financial managers for their vast business operations. Despite Hutt dominance
column15: the Nimbanel maintained their own governmental structures on Nimban
column16: though ultimate authority rested with the Hutts.\n\nThe planet's location in Hutt Space meant it remained largely peripheral to major galactic conflicts for much of its history. During the Clone Wars
column17: Nimban
column18: like most of Hutt Space
column19: maintained official neutrality
column20: though individual Nimbanel served various factions throughout the galaxy in financial and administrative capacities.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column21: Nimban remained under Hutt control as the Empire generally avoided direct interference in Hutt Space. However
column22: the Empire recognized the Nimbanel's talents and recruited many to serve in Imperial financial institutions and bureaucratic offices. The Nimbanel's reputation for precision and efficiency made them ideal candidates for managing the Empire's complex economic systems.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column23: Nimban remained in Hutt Space
column24: with the planet continuing its traditional role as a source of financial expertise for various criminal and legitimate organizations throughout the galaxy. The humid world attracted little military attention from either the Empire or the Rebel Alliance due to its lack of strategic military value.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column25: Nimban's status remained largely unchanged. The planet continued under Hutt influence
column26: but nominally under control of the Commerce Guild
column27: with the Nimbanel population serving as administrators and financial experts across the galaxy while their homeworld remained a backwater world of swamps and jungles in the outer reaches of Hutt Space."

Text: "The N'zoth system is a star system in the Core Worlds that contain Y'ness
column4: a moon on which kimber stones can be found."

Text: "N'zoth is a star system located in the Farlax sector of the Core Worlds region
column4: positioned along the Byss Run hyperlane. The primary inhabited world in the system is the planet N'zoth
column5: though the system also contains the moon Y'ness
column6: known for its deposits of kammris
column7: or Adegan crystals
column8: which are prized for their use in lightsaber construction and various technological applications.\n\nN'zoth is the homeworld of the Yevetha
column9: a fiercely xenophobic and militaristic species characterized by their gray skin
column10: six-fingered hands with retractable climbing claws
column11: and prominent cranial horns. Yevethan society is rigidly hierarchical and dominated by males
column12: with the species having developed a complex caste system centered around their concept of ""purity"" and martial prowess. The Yevetha are known for their extreme territorial nature and their practice of ritual suicide rather than accept defeat or dishonor.\n\nFor much of galactic history
column13: N'zoth remained isolated from the broader galactic community due to the Yevetha's hostile attitude toward outsiders. When the Galactic Republic first made contact with the species thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column14: the encounters were marked by violence and mutual distrust. The Yevetha's aggressive nature and unwillingness to engage in peaceful trade or diplomatic relations meant that N'zoth remained largely cut off from galactic civilization.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column15: the system was occasionally visited by miners seeking kammris crystals from Y'ness
column16: though such expeditions were dangerous due to Yevethan hostility. The Republic maintained minimal contact with N'zoth
column17: recognizing that any attempt to establish permanent presence would likely result in prolonged conflict with the xenophobic Yevetha.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column18: N'zoth's isolation meant it avoided involvement in the conflict between the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The Yevetha showed no interest in joining either side
column19: preferring to focus on their own territorial concerns and internal affairs.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column20: N'zoth's fate changed dramatically. The Empire
column21: recognizing the system's strategic location along the Byss Run and seeing an opportunity to exploit the Yevetha's martial nature
column22: invaded N'zoth and subjugated the species. The Empire established the Black Fifteen shipyards in orbit over N'zoth
column23: a massive construction facility where some of the Empire's most advanced warships were built.\n\nThe Yevetha were pressed into forced labor
column24: working in brutal conditions to construct Imperial vessels. Many Yevetha died in the shipyards
column25: though their resilient nature and natural climbing abilities made them effective
column26: if unwilling
column27: workers in the zero-gravity construction environment. The Empire maintained strict control over N'zoth
column28: viewing the Yevetha as nothing more than expendable labor for their military-industrial complex.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column29: the Black Fifteen shipyards continued operation
column30: producing Star Destroyers and other capital ships for the Imperial Navy. The facility was heavily guarded by Imperial forces
column31: both to protect the valuable shipyards and to prevent Yevethan uprisings. Despite their subjugation
column32: the Yevetha never fully accepted Imperial rule
column33: and resistance movements periodically emerged
column34: though these were brutally suppressed.\n\nFollowing the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column35: the Imperial presence at N'zoth collapsed as forces were recalled to defend Core Imperial territories. The Yevetha
column36: led by Nil Spaar
column37: seized control of the Black Fifteen shipyards and the Imperial vessels docked there
column38: effectively liberating their homeworld from Imperial occupation. The New Republic has tacit control over the sector
column39: however there are whispers that the Yevetha are seeking to establish a ""Yevethan Protectorate"" and purge all alien presence from what they considered their rightful territory."

Text: "Ord Mantell is a terrestrial planet located into the Bright Jewel system of the Bright Jewel sector in the Mid Rim Territories. It is located near Anobis and was originally settled by the Galactic Republic circa 12
column4: 000 BBY as an Ordnance/Regional Depot."

Text: "Ord Mantell is a terrestrial planet located in the Bright Jewel system of the Bright Jewel sector in the Mid Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Celanon Spur hyperlane. Originally settled by the Galactic Republic circa 12
column5: 000 BBY as an Ordnance/Regional Depot
column6: Ord Mantell developed into a strategically important military supply world and trade hub.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including mountains
column7: plains
column8: and the Great Scrap Yard - a massive junkyard containing decommissioned military equipment and starship hulks accumulated over millennia. The capital city of Worlport serves as the primary spaceport and commercial center
column9: though it has earned a reputation as a haven for smugglers
column10: bounty hunters
column11: and other fringe elements.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column12: Ord Mantell maintained its role as a military depot and manufacturing center
column13: with the Republic stockpiling weapons and equipment in massive warehouses. The planet's strategic location along the Celanon Spur made it valuable for supplying Republic forces operating in the Mid Rim and Outer Rim.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column14: Ord Mantell remained under Republic control
column15: continuing to serve as a supply depot for the Grand Army of the Republic. The planet's factories and shipyards contributed to the war effort
column16: though its distance from major battle zones spared it from direct conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column17: Ord Mantell came under Imperial authority. However
column18: the Empire's control over the planet remained tenuous
column19: with much of Ord Mantell operating as a semi-lawless frontier world. Criminal organizations
column20: particularly the Black Sun syndicate
column21: maintained significant influence in Worlport and other settlements.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column22: Ord Mantell became a contested world. The planet's underworld connections made it attractive to both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance as a source of supplies and information. Shortly after the Battle of Hoth
column23: the bounty hunter IG-88 attempted to capture Han Solo on Ord Mantell
column24: though Solo managed to escape.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column25: Ord Mantell's status remained uncertain. The planet's criminal underworld continued to thrive in the power vacuum
column26: with various factions competing for control of the lucrative smuggling and salvage operations centered around the Great Scrap Yard."

Text: "Orto Plutonia is a frigid planet located in the Pantora system of the Outer Rim Territories' Sujimis sector. It is orbited by the moon Pantora
column4: which was long believed to be the only inhabited world in the system. It is home to a Talz colony
column5: which was discovered during the Clone Wars following an investigation of a Separatist outpost. After a brief conflict between the Pantorans and the Talz
column6: a peace agreement was reached."

Text: "Orto Plutonia is a remote
column4: frigid world located in the Pantora system of the Sujimis sector in the Outer Rim Territories. The planet's surface is perpetually covered in ice and snow
column5: with temperatures well below freezing across most of the landscape. Massive glaciers
column6: frozen tundra
column7: and towering ice formations dominate the terrain
column8: creating a harsh environment inhospitable to most forms of life.\n\nFor much of galactic history
column9: Orto Plutonia was believed to be completely uninhabited. The planet's extreme cold and isolation kept it off most galactic charts
column10: with explorers and colonists showing little interest in the frozen world. Its moon
column11: Pantora
column12: developed into a thriving civilization and became the administrative center of the Pantora system
column13: while Orto Plutonia remained largely ignored.\n\nUnknown to the Pantorans and the wider galaxy
column14: Orto Plutonia was actually home to a indigenous species called the Talz. These tall
column15: furry humanoids were perfectly adapted to the planet's frozen environment
column16: with thick white fur providing insulation against the extreme cold and four eyes that allowed them to see through frequent blizzards. The Talz lived in scattered tribal communities across the planet's icy wastes
column17: maintaining a primitive but sustainable lifestyle based on hunting and gathering.\n\nThe Talz had inhabited Orto Plutonia for thousands of years
column18: developing their own culture and traditions in complete isolation from galactic civilization. They were a peaceful species
column19: though fiercely protective of their territory and way of life. The extreme conditions of their homeworld meant that they rarely ventured far from their settlements
column20: and their primitive technology level meant they had no means of space travel or communication with other worlds.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column21: approximately 22 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column22: the Galactic Republic established a small outpost on Orto Plutonia to monitor Separatist activity in the region. The outpost
column23: manned by clone troopers
column24: was intended to serve as an early warning station should Separatist forces attempt to move through the system.\n\nShortly after its establishment
column25: the Republic outpost lost contact with command. When a relief force arrived to investigate
column26: they discovered that both the Republic outpost and a nearby Separatist outpost had been completely wiped out
column27: with all personnel killed. The discovery of the Separatist outpost confirmed fears that the Confederacy of Independent Systems had been operating in the system.\n\nJedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker were dispatched to investigate the incident
column28: accompanied by Pantoran Chairman Chi Cho and Senator Riyo Chuchi. The investigation revealed that both outposts had been attacked by the native Talz
column29: who viewed the military installations as threats to their territory and way of life. The Talz had emerged from the frozen wilderness to destroy both Republic and Separatist forces
column30: demonstrating surprising military capability despite their primitive technology.\n\nThe revelation that Orto Plutonia was inhabited came as a shock to the Pantorans
column31: who had long believed they were the only sentient species in the system. Chairman Chi Cho immediately claimed Orto Plutonia as Pantoran territory and attempted to assert sovereignty over the planet and its inhabitants. This claim led to tension with the Talz
column32: who had no interest in Pantoran governance and simply wanted to be left alone on their homeworld.\n\nChairman Cho
column33: ignoring the advice of the Jedi and Senator Chuchi
column34: ordered a military strike against the Talz. He led a contingent of clone troopers into the frozen wastes to engage the natives
column35: viewing them as primitives who needed to be brought under Pantoran control. The Talz
column36: defending their homeland
column37: ambushed the Pantoran forces in the ice plains. Despite being armed only with spears and other primitive weapons
column38: the Talz proved to be formidable warriors in their native environment.\n\nDuring the battle
column39: Chairman Cho was mortally wounded by Talz warriors. As he lay dying
column40: Senator Riyo Chuchi convinced him to transfer his authority to her
column41: allowing her to negotiate with the Talz. With the Jedi serving as mediators
column42: Senator Chuchi met with Thi-Sen
column43: the chieftain of the Talz
column44: and apologized for the Pantoran aggression.\n\nIn the negotiations that followed
column45: Senator Chuchi recognized the Talz as the sovereign inhabitants of Orto Plutonia and renounced all Pantoran claims to the planet. The Talz
column46: in return
column47: agreed to peaceful coexistence with Pantora and allowed the Pantorans to maintain a presence on their moon. This diplomatic resolution prevented further bloodshed and established a foundation for peaceful relations between the two species.\n\nThe discovery of the Talz and the subsequent conflict had lasting implications for both species. The Pantorans
column48: who had always viewed Orto Plutonia as part of their domain
column49: were forced to accept that they shared their system with another sentient species. The Talz
column51: gained recognition as a sovereign people
column52: though they continued to avoid contact with the wider galaxy and maintained their traditional way of life on the frozen world below.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire and the end of the Clone Wars
column53: Orto Plutonia remained under Talz control
column54: with the Empire showing little interest in the frozen world. The planet's extreme environment and lack of valuable resources meant it attracted minimal Imperial attention. The Talz continued their isolated existence
column55: occasionally trading with Pantoran merchants but otherwise avoiding involvement in galactic affairs.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column56: Orto Plutonia's isolation kept it far from the conflict between the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. Neither side showed interest in establishing a presence on the frozen world
column57: and the Talz were content to remain neutral in the larger struggle.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column58: the status of Orto Plutonia remained unchanged. The Talz maintained their sovereignty over the planet
column59: living much as they had for thousands of years. The peace agreement established by Senator Chuchi continued to govern relations between the Talz and the Pantorans
column60: with both species respecting the territorial rights of the other."

Text: "The Ord Trasi system is a system in the Outer Rim. It contain the planet Ord Trasi."
"Ord Trasi is a terrestrial planet located in the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned along the Entralla Route hyperlane. Originally established as an Ordnance/Regional Depot by the Galactic Republic circa 12
column5: 000 BBY
column6: Ord Trasi developed into a significant military supply world and strategic outpost.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column7: forests
column8: and urban centers that grew around its military installations and supply depots. Like other Ord worlds established by the Republic

column10: with Rakata Prime serving as its capital.\n\nThe Rakata constructed massive edifices on their homeworld
column11: including temples and facilities that harnessed the dark side of the Force. Most notable among these was the Star Forge
column12: an ancient space station of Rakatan design that orbited the planet. The Star Forge was capable of producing an endless supply of ships and war material by drawing energy directly from nearby stars and channeling the dark side energies of its Rakatan crew.\n\nApproximately 25
column13: 000 years before the rise of the Empire
column14: the Infinite Empire collapsed catastrophically. A plague swept through the Rakata species
column15: and they mysteriously lost their connection to the Force. Without their Force abilities
column16: the Rakata could no longer maintain their technology or control their slave populations. Slave revolts erupted across the Infinite Empire
column17: and the once-mighty civilization crumbled. The Rakata who survived on their homeworld regressed to a primitive tribal state
column18: while knowledge of Rakata Prime's location was lost to the galaxy at large.\n\nFor millennia
column19: Rakata Prime remained hidden in the Unknown Regions
column20: its existence becoming the stuff of legend. The descendants of the Rakata split into two main tribes: the Elders
column21: who sought to reclaim their ancestors' peaceful traditions
column22: and the more numerous tribal Rakata
column23: who embraced violence and warfare. These tribes warred with each other for thousands of years among the ruins of their once-great civilization.\n\nDuring the Jedi Civil War
column24: approximately 3
column25: 956 years before the rise of the Empire
column26: Darth Revan and Darth Malak rediscovered Rakata Prime and the Star Forge. Malak used the ancient station to produce an endless fleet of warships for his Sith Empire. The planet became the site of a crucial battle when the redeemed Revan returned with the Republic fleet to destroy the Star Forge. After a massive space battle in orbit
column27: the Star Forge was destroyed
column28: ending its threat to the galaxy.\n\nFollowing the destruction of the Star Forge
column29: Rakata Prime once again faded into obscurity. The planet's location remained largely forgotten
column30: known only to a handful of scholars and explorers. The native Rakata continued their existence on the tropical islands
column31: their numbers dwindling over the centuries.\n\nThe dangerous anomalies and strange energy readings surrounding the Lehon system
column32: combined with its location deep in the Unknown Regions
column33: continued to discourage exploration even by those few who might have heard legends of the Unknown World. The system remained effectively isolated from the rest of the galaxy throughout the rise of the Galactic Empire and the subsequent Galactic Civil War.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column34: Rakata Prime remained one of the galaxy's most elusive mysteries
column35: its ruins holding secrets of an ancient civilization that had once ruled the stars through their mastery of both technology and the Force."

Text: "Randon is a planet from which the Randoni originated. It's a large business world with crowded bazaars and elegant corporate towers. It's at the intersection with several major trade routes
column4: including the Trax Tube
column5: Ootmian Pabol
column6: Pabol Sleheyron
column7: and the Randon Run."

Text: "Randon is an unremarkable terrestrial planet located in the Randon system of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: positioned at the strategic intersection of multiple major hyperspace routes including the Trax Tube
column5: Ootmian Pabol
column6: Pabol Sleheyron
column7: and the Randon Run. This convergence of trade lanes has made Randon a significant waypoint for commerce despite the planet's lack of inherent resources or manufacturing capability.\n\nThe planet's surface features varied terrain including plains
column8: forests
column9: and scattered urban centers that developed around trade hubs and spaceports. Randon's economy has long been tied entirely to its role as a crossroads world
column10: with merchant activity and transshipment forming the backbone of what modest prosperity the planet enjoys.\n\nThe native Randoni species
column11: humanoid beings who evolved on the planet
column12: have built their civilization around facilitating trade and providing services to the constant flow of travelers passing through their system. Randon's cities feature crowded bazaars filled with goods from across the galaxy
column13: alongside corporate towers housing the regional offices of various trading companies seeking to capitalize on the planet's position.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column14: Randon was discovered during the early expansion of galactic trade routes. The planet joined the Galactic Republic
column15: though its membership was largely nominal given its distance from the Core Worlds and its limited political influence. Randon maintained steady but unremarkable growth as the various trade routes passing through the system expanded over the millennia.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column16: Randon served primarily as a rest stop and transfer point for merchants moving goods between different regions of the galaxy. The planet never developed significant manufacturing or agriculture
