column4: known for its shipyards and native species
column5: the insectoid Yagai. As a member of the Galactic Republic
column6: Yaga Minor was the starting point of the famed Outbound Flight project
column7: which sadly never completed its objective. During the Imperial Era
column8: the Yagai were enslaved by the Empire and used as technicians throughout the Imperial Navy
column9: and Yaga Minor itself became an important trade world and fortress."

Text: "Yaga Minor is a temperate terrestrial world located in the Yaga system of the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of varied terrain including plains
column4: forests
column5: and urban centers
column6: Yaga Minor is home to the Yagai
column7: an insectoid species known for their exceptional technical skills and contributions to galactic shipbuilding.\n\nThe Yagai evolved on Yaga Minor and developed a sophisticated civilization centered around engineering and starship construction. Their natural aptitude for technical work and their species' keen attention to detail made them valuable contributors to the galaxy's shipbuilding industry. For thousands of years
column8: the Yagai maintained their own independent culture while participating in galactic commerce.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column9: Yaga Minor joined the Galactic Republic and became an established member of galactic civilization. The planet's shipyards grew in importance
column10: with Yagai technicians earning recognition throughout the galaxy for their craftsmanship and reliability. The Yaga Minor Shipyards became a significant facility for both commercial and military vessel construction.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column11: Yaga Minor maintained steady growth as a shipbuilding center. The planet's strategic location in the Outer Rim made it valuable for constructing and maintaining vessels operating in that region of space. The Yagai continued developing their technical expertise
column12: with many leaving their homeworld to work in shipyards throughout the galaxy.\n\nApproximately 27 years before the rise of the Empire
column13: Yaga Minor achieved historical significance as the launching point for the Outbound Flight project. This ambitious expedition
column14: led by Jedi Master Jorus C'baoth
column15: aimed to explore the Unknown Regions and potentially establish contact with civilizations beyond known space. Six Dreadnaught-class heavy cruisers were assembled at Yaga Minor and linked together to form the massive Outbound Flight vessel
column16: carrying thousands of colonists
column17: Jedi
column18: and crew members.\n\nThe Outbound Flight departed from Yaga Minor amid great fanfare and hope for expanding the Republic's knowledge of the galaxy. However
column19: the expedition met with disaster in the Unknown Regions when it was destroyed by forces under the command of Thrawn of the Chiss Ascendancy
column20: acting under orders from Darth Sidious. The loss of Outbound Flight became one of the Republic's greatest tragedies
column21: and Yaga Minor's role as the project's starting point ensured the planet would be remembered in connection with this failed venture.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column22: Yaga Minor remained under Republic control
column23: continuing its role as a shipbuilding center. The planet's yards contributed to the Republic's war effort
column24: though its distance from major battle zones meant it avoided direct involvement in most of the conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column25: Yaga Minor's fate changed dramatically. The Empire recognized the strategic value of the planet's shipyards and the technical expertise of the Yagai. Imperial forces occupied Yaga Minor and began exploiting both the facilities and the native population.\n\nThe Empire enslaved the Yagai
column26: pressing them into forced labor as technicians throughout the Imperial Navy. Yagai workers were dispersed across the Empire's fleet
column27: maintaining and repairing vessels while receiving minimal compensation and living in harsh conditions. Their natural technical abilities made them valuable to the Empire
column28: but they were treated as expendable labor rather than valued citizens.\n\nUnder Imperial rule
column29: the Yaga Minor Shipyards underwent massive expansion. The Empire invested heavily in enlarging the facilities
column30: transforming them into one of the most important shipbuilding centers in the Outer Rim. The yards began producing Star Destroyers and other capital ships for the Imperial Navy
column31: with enslaved Yagai technicians performing much of the detailed work.\n\nYaga Minor became a fortress world
column32: heavily defended by Imperial forces to protect its vital shipbuilding capacity. The Empire established extensive military installations on the planet and in orbit
column33: ensuring that the yards remained secure from potential Rebel attacks. The planet's strategic importance to the Imperial war machine meant it received priority for resources and defensive emplacements.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column34: Yaga Minor remained firmly under Imperial control throughout the conflict. The shipyards continued producing vessels for the Imperial fleet despite the growing threat from the Rebel Alliance. The Empire maintained a strong garrison to prevent any resistance movements from disrupting production or attempting to free the enslaved Yagai population.\n\nThe Yagai suffered greatly under Imperial occupation
column35: with many dying from harsh working conditions
column36: accidents
column37: or Imperial brutality. However
column38: the species maintained their cultural identity despite the oppression
column39: with Yagai workers secretly preserving their traditions and hoping for eventual liberation.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column40: Yaga Minor became a contested prize as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of its valuable shipyards. The planet's importance to military production ensured it remained a strategic objective for all parties seeking to establish naval superiority in the post-Imperial era."

Text: "Yag'Dhul is a small
column4: rocky world
column5: home to the mathematically-inclined Givin species. Its three moons produce such extreme tidal effects that much of the world's water and atmosphere are pulled to different parts of the planet
column6: leaving the rest in vacuum. During the Clone Wars
column7: the Givin came to the mathematical conclusion that remaining in the Republic would be more devastating than joining the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column8: and provided ships and a staging point for Separatist forces. In the age of the Galactic Empire
column9: some factions in Yag'Dhul's government supported the Rebel Alliance
column10: and the world has been contested by various governments and warlords since."

Text: "Yag'Dhul is a harsh
column4: rocky world located in the Givin system of the Outer Rim Territories
column5: positioned along the Rimma Trade Route hyperlane. The planet is subjected to extreme tidal forces from its three moons
column6: which produce such dramatic gravitational effects that the world's oceans and atmosphere are constantly pulled to different hemispheres
column7: leaving much of the surface in vacuum at any given time. Only the twilight zones between these extremes maintain stable conditions.\n\nThe native Givin species evolved to survive these extreme conditions
column8: developing extraordinary mathematical abilities and exoskeletons that allow them to survive in vacuum. Givin society places supreme value on mathematics and logic
column9: with all aspects of their culture governed by mathematical principles. Their ability to perform complex calculations mentally and their natural adaptability to vacuum make them exceptional navigators and engineers.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Yag'Dhul joined the Galactic Republic and became known for producing skilled mathematicians and engineers. The planet's shipyards
column11: run by Givin Colonies Expansion Services
column12: constructed vessels renowned for their precise engineering. Givin navigators became highly sought after throughout the galaxy for their ability to calculate hyperspace routes with exceptional accuracy.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column13: the Givin faced a critical decision when both the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems courted their allegiance. Using their mathematical prowess
column14: the Givin government calculated that remaining loyal to the Republic would result in greater devastation than joining the Separatists. Based on this cold mathematical conclusion
column15: Yag'Dhul seceded to the Confederacy.\n\nThe planet became an important Separatist stronghold
column16: with its shipyards producing vessels for the Confederacy and serving as a staging point for military operations. The Republic launched several campaigns to retake Yag'Dhul
column17: recognizing its strategic position along the Rimma Trade Route and the value of its shipbuilding capabilities.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: Yag'Dhul came under Imperial control. The Empire maintained oversight of the planet's shipyards and continued to employ Givin mathematicians and engineers in various Imperial projects. However
column19: the Givin's logical approach to governance sometimes conflicted with Imperial authoritarianism
column20: creating tensions between the occupiers and the native population.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column21: Yag'Dhul's government remained divided. Some Givin calculated that supporting the Empire remained the most logical choice
column22: while others concluded that the Rebel Alliance's chances of success warranted support. This mathematical analysis of political outcomes led to factions within Givin society backing different sides.\n\nThe planet became contested territory
column23: with both Imperial and Rebel forces attempting to secure control of its strategic position and industrial capacity. The Givin's neutral mathematical approach meant they were willing to work with whoever held power
column24: provided the calculations supported such cooperation.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column25: Yag'Dhul's status remained uncertain. Various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of the planet and its valuable shipyards. The Givin government continued to make decisions based on mathematical probability
column26: calculating which faction offered the best prospects for their world's survival and prosperity.\n\nThe planet's strategic importance along the Rimma Trade Route ensured it remained a prize worth fighting for
column27: with control changing hands multiple times as different factions sought to dominate this vital hyperspace corridor and exploit Yag'Dhul's engineering expertise."

Text: "Yavin 4 is the fourth moon of the gas giant Yavin
column4: in the Outer Rim. A lush jungle world
column5: Yavin was home to ancient Massassi warriors under the rule of the Sith Lord Naga Sadow thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Through conflicts between Sith
column6: and with the Jedi
column7: Yavin 4 was once completely ravaged by war
column8: but has since been terraformed back to its former glory
column9: with life growing over the ruined Massassi temples. The largest of these
column10: the Great Temple
column11: was a military base for the Rebel Alliance
column12: and from here the Rebellion struck out against the Galactic Empire at Jedha
column13: and shortly afterwards destroyed the Death Star in orbit above the parent gas giant. The Empire and Rebellion have fought over the planet for years afterward."

Text: "Yavin 4 is the fourth moon orbiting the gas giant Yavin in the Yavin system of the Outer Rim Territories. A lush jungle world covered by dense rainforests
column4: towering massassi trees
column5: and ancient stone temples
column6: Yavin 4 has played a pivotal role in galactic history despite its remote location.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column7: Yavin 4 was inhabited by the primitive Massassi species. The moon's surface became dominated by massive temples constructed by these ancient inhabitants
column8: structures that would endure for millennia beneath the encroaching jungle canopy.\n\nFor most of galactic history
column9: Yavin 4 remained largely forgotten and unexplored. The dense jungle
column10: dangerous wildlife including predatory creatures
column11: and the moon's remote location in the Outer Rim kept it isolated from major civilizations. The ancient temples slowly crumbled and were consumed by vegetation
column12: becoming mysterious ruins hidden within the forest.\n\nShortly before what would become known as the Battle of Yavin
column13: the Rebel Alliance discovered the abandoned moon and recognized its potential as a hidden base of operations. The remote location
column14: thick jungle providing natural camouflage
column15: and existing temple structures made Yavin 4 ideal for concealing their headquarters from the Galactic Empire. The Alliance established their main base within the Great Temple
column16: the largest of the ancient Massassi structures
column17: converting the massive pyramid into a modern military facility while preserving its exterior.\n\nFrom Yavin 4
column18: the Rebellion coordinated operations against the Empire
column19: including the mission that successfully stole the Death Star plans from Scarif. When Princess Leia Organa was captured by Darth Vader
column20: she falsely claimed the Rebel base was on Dantooine
column21: buying time for the Alliance. However
column22: the Empire eventually tracked the stolen plans to Yavin 4.\n\nThe Battle of Yavin became the defining moment of the early Rebellion. Grand Moff Tarkin brought the Death Star to the Yavin system
column23: intending to destroy the Rebel base and demonstrate the battle station's overwhelming power. As the massive space station orbited Yavin
column24: waiting to achieve firing position on the moon once it cleared the gas giant
column25: Rebel strategists identified a critical weakness in the Death Star's design.\n\nRebel starfighters launched a desperate assault
column26: with Red and Gold Squadrons attacking the Death Star's thermal exhaust port. The Empire's defenses
column27: including TIE fighters led by Darth Vader
column28: inflicted heavy casualties on the attackers. In the battle's climactic moments
column29: Luke Skywalker fired the torpedoes that destroyed the Death Star
column30: mere seconds before the station could fire on Yavin 4. Han Solo's last-minute intervention
column31: arriving in the Millennium Falcon to drive off Vader's TIE fighter
column32: proved crucial to the Rebellion's victory.\n\nThe destruction of the Death Star at Yavin marked the Rebellion's first major military victory against the Empire. The battle demonstrated that the Empire was not invincible and provided hope to resistance movements across the galaxy. The Rebel Alliance held a ceremony in the Great Temple's main hangar
column33: where Princess Leia awarded medals to Luke Skywalker and Han Solo for their heroism.\n\nFollowing the battle
column34: the Alliance recognized that the Empire would soon return with overwhelming force to attack their now-exposed base. The Rebels evacuated Yavin 4
column35: relocating their headquarters to the ice planet Hoth. However
column36: the moon retained tremendous symbolic importance as the site of the Rebellion's greatest early victory.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column37: Yavin 4 remained largely abandoned
column38: its ancient temples standing as monuments to both its mysterious past and its crucial role in the Galactic Civil War. The dense jungles continued to grow over the Massassi ruins
column39: while the Great Temple bore witness to the triumph that had changed galactic history."

Text: "Zeltros is a world of rampant hedonism and excess
column4: dominated by constant partying and never-ending revelry. Though it joined the Galactic Republic four thousand years before the creation of the Galactic Empire
column5: it never did join the Empire
column6: and has never successfully been invaded
column7: as the easy-going atmosphere (and the pheromones of the native Zeltron) quickly overwhelm most hostile parties."

Text: "Zeltros is a verdant terrestrial planet located in the Inner Rim Territories. A world of stunning natural beauty featuring lush forests
column4: pristine beaches
column5: and temperate climate
column6: Zeltros is the homeworld of the Zeltrons
column7: a near-human species characterized by their pink to red skin tones and exceptional empathic abilities.\n\nThe Zeltrons evolved as a highly social and pleasure-seeking species
column8: developing a culture centered around joy
column9: entertainment
column10: and emotional connection. Their natural ability to sense and influence emotions through both empathy and pheromone production made them uniquely suited to careers in entertainment
column11: diplomacy
column12: and hospitality throughout the galaxy.\n\nZeltron society places supreme value on happiness and the pursuit of pleasure
column13: with their entire civilization organized around maximizing joy and minimizing suffering. This philosophical approach extends to all aspects of their culture
column14: from their architecture and city planning to their economic systems and social customs. The Zeltrons built their cities to emphasize natural beauty and comfort
column15: creating urban environments that blend seamlessly with the planet's spectacular landscapes.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column16: Zeltros joined the Galactic Republic and became known throughout the galaxy as a premier destination for tourism and entertainment. The planet's reputation for hospitality and its inhabitants' legendary parties attracted visitors from across known space
column17: making tourism one of Zeltros's primary industries.\n\nThe Zeltrons' empathic abilities and pheromone production have profound effects on most humanoid species. Their pheromones naturally induce feelings of attraction
column18: contentment
column19: and euphoria in those around them
column20: while their empathic senses allow them to read and respond to the emotional states of others with remarkable precision. This combination makes Zeltrons exceptional hosts
column21: entertainers
column22: and negotiators.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column23: Zeltros maintained its reputation as the galaxy's ultimate pleasure planet. Wealthy beings from the Core Worlds regularly visited Zeltros for vacation
column24: with the planet's resorts
column25: casinos
column26: and entertainment districts catering to every conceivable desire. The Zeltron government actively promoted tourism while carefully managing the planet's resources to prevent overdevelopment.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column27: Zeltros maintained official neutrality
column28: refusing to join either the Republic or the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The planet's leadership recognized that involvement in the conflict would disrupt the peaceful
column29: joyful society they had cultivated for millennia. Both sides respected Zeltros's neutrality
column30: valuing the planet as neutral ground where informal negotiations could occur.\n\nThe Zeltrons' empathic abilities proved valuable during wartime
column31: as many Zeltron diplomats and mediators worked to facilitate peace talks and resolve conflicts throughout the galaxy. Their natural talent for understanding and influencing emotions made them effective intermediaries
column32: though their culture's emphasis on pleasure sometimes put them at odds with more militaristic societies.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column33: Zeltros maintained its independence through a combination of diplomatic skill and their species' unique biological advantages. When Imperial forces attempted to establish control over the planet
column34:
the Zeltrons' pheromones and empathic abilities had profound effects on the occupying troops.

Imperial soldiers and officials stationed on Zeltros quickly became distracted by the planet's pleasures and the overwhelming sense of contentment induced by Zeltron pheromones. Military discipline broke down as troops abandoned their duties in favor of participating in Zeltros's famous parties and celebrations. Officers found themselves unable to maintain order or enforce Imperial regulations as their subordinates succumbed to the planet's intoxicating atmosphere.

The Empire made multiple attempts to occupy Zeltros
column35: each ending in failure as garrison forces became ineffective within days of arrival. Stormtroopers discarded their armor to join beach parties
column36: officers neglected their duties to pursue romantic entanglements with Zeltrons
column37: and even the most disciplined Imperial personnel found their resolve crumbling in the face of the planet's overwhelming atmosphere of pleasure and joy.\n\nThe Emperor himself eventually recognized the futility of attempting to control Zeltros through conventional means. The planet's unique circumstances made it effectively ungovernable by external forces
column38: as any occupying army would inevitably be absorbed into Zeltron society rather than subjugating it. Palpatine grudgingly allowed Zeltros to maintain its independence
column39: though Imperial Intelligence maintained surveillance on the planet.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column40: Zeltros remained neutral territory
column41: welcoming visitors from all factions. Imperial officers
column42: Rebel agents
column43: smugglers
column44: and bounty hunters all frequented Zeltros's entertainment districts
column45: drawn by the planet's reputation and its inhabitants' legendary hospitality. The Zeltrons' empathic abilities allowed them to manage potential conflicts between visitors of opposing allegiances
column46: maintaining peace through emotional influence rather than security forces.\n\nMany throughout the galaxy viewed Zeltros as a symbol of what civilization could achieve when organized around happiness and mutual pleasure rather than power and control. However
column47: critics argued that Zeltron society was shallow and irresponsible
column48: suggesting that their culture's emphasis on pleasure came at the expense of more substantial achievements.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column49: Zeltros enthusiastically joined the new government. The planet's representatives advocated for policies emphasizing individual freedom
column51: and the pursuit of happiness as fundamental galactic values. Zeltros continued its traditional role as a center of tourism and entertainment
column52: now welcoming visitors celebrating the Empire's defeat and the promise of a freer

Text: "Ziost is a temperate blue-green world in the far reaches of the Outer Rim. Formerly the capital of many Sith Empires
column4: ranging from the empire of the late Pureblood Sith King Adas to the Sith Lord Adjunta Pall
column5: to the True Sith Empire
column6: and later the Brotherhood of Darkness
column7: the planet has seen numerous climate changes and conflicts
column8: including one conflict that rendered it entirely uninhabitable thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Since that time it has slowly recovered
column9: though it was largely forgotten after the New Sith Wars one thousand years before the founding of the Galactic Empire."

Text: "Ziost is a frozen world located in the Outer Rim Territories
column4: deep within what would become known as Sith Space. A planet of ice-covered landscapes
column5: bitter cold
column6: and ancient ruins
column7: Ziost has served as a focal point for dark side Force users for thousands of years
column8: second only to Korriban in its importance to Sith history.\n\nApproximately 28
column9: 000 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: King Adas of the Sith species united the warring nations of Korriban and expanded Sith territory to include nearby worlds. Ziost became one of the first conquests of this early Sith Empire
column11: establishing a pattern that would repeat throughout millennia - Ziost serving as either capital or major stronghold for various Sith empires.\n\nFollowing Adas's death and the subsequent invasion by the Rakata Infinite Empire
column12: Ziost fell under Rakatan control along with much of Sith Space. When the Infinite Empire collapsed approximately 25
column13: 000 years before the rise of the Empire
column14: Ziost was liberated but remained a Sith world
column15: its significance to dark side practitioners already firmly established.\n\nApproximately 6
column16: 900 years before the Empire's rise
column17: a group of Dark Jedi exiled from the Galactic Republic after the Hundred-Year Darkness discovered Sith Space. These fallen Jedi
column18: led by Ajunta Pall
column19: subjugated the native Sith species and established themselves as the new Sith Lords. Ziost became the capital of this Sith Empire
column20: with Ajunta Pall ruling from the planet until his death.\n\nFor thousands of years
column21: Ziost served as the political and administrative capital of the Sith Empire while Korriban remained the spiritual heart and burial world of the Sith Lords. Massive citadels and dark side temples were constructed across Ziost's frozen surface
column22: with the planet becoming a center of Sith government
column23: military command
column24: and dark side knowledge.\n\nDuring the Great Hyperspace War approximately 5
column25: 000 years before the Empire's rise
column26: Ziost served as a major staging ground for the Sith Empire's invasion of Republic space. Following the Sith defeat
column27: the Republic destroyed much of Ziost's infrastructure
column28: though the planet remained inhabited by Sith cultists and dark side practitioners who continued to maintain the ancient temples and fortresses.\n\nThe planet gained renewed importance when the True Sith Empire
column29: which had been rebuilding in the Unknown Regions under Sith Emperor Vitiate
column30: returned to known space approximately 3
column31: 681 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Ziost once again became a major Sith world
column32: serving as an administrative center while Dromund Kaas functioned as the Empire's capital. The planet's strategic location and historical significance made it valuable for Sith military operations throughout the Great Galactic War and subsequent Cold War.\n\nDuring this period
column33: Ziost housed important Imperial facilities including military bases
column34: dark side academies
column35: and government ministries. The planet's frozen wastes contained numerous ancient Sith ruins that continued to attract archaeologists and dark side adepts seeking lost knowledge and artifacts.\n\nApproximately 3
column36: 637 years before the Empire's rise
column37: a catastrophic event occurred when the Sith Emperor consumed all life on Ziost through a dark side ritual of unprecedented scale. The ritual transformed the living world into a lifeless frozen wasteland
column38: with every plant
column39: animal
column40: and sentient being on the planet drained of their life force. The devastation was so complete that Ziost became synonymous with the destructive potential of the dark side.\n\nFollowing this cataclysm
column41: Ziost remained largely abandoned for thousands of years. The planet's extreme conditions and reputation as a cursed world kept most visitors away
column42: though occasional dark side cultists and Sith archaeologists ventured to the frozen surface seeking ancient knowledge or artifacts that survived the devastation.\n\nDuring the New Sith Wars
column43: approximately 2
column45: 000 years before the rise of the Empire
column46: various Sith factions occasionally used Ziost as a base or rallying point
column47: drawn by the planet's dark side aura and historical significance. However
column49: and Ziost remained a frozen monument to Sith power and destruction.\n\nFollowing the Ruusan Reformation and the supposed extinction of the Sith approximately 1
column51: Ziost faded from galactic memory. The planet's location in the remote Outer Rim and its lack of resources or habitable conditions meant few had reason to visit or even remember its existence.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars and the subsequent rise of the Galactic Empire
column52: Ziost remained unknown to most of the galaxy. Emperor Palpatine
column53: with his extensive knowledge of Sith history
column54: was certainly aware of Ziost's existence and significance
column55: though whether he visited the frozen world or sought artifacts there remains unclear. The planet's extreme isolation and harsh conditions meant it attracted no attention from either the Galactic Republic or the Confederacy of Independent Systems.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column56: Ziost continued its existence as a frozen
column57: lifeless world in the Outer Rim
column58: known only through fragmentary historical records and ancient texts. The planet stood as a testament to the destructive power of the dark side and the long

Text: "Zygerria is a rocky world in the Outer Rim known for being a center of slave trading. Once the center of a mighty slave empire
column4: it had since faded from glory after that empire was destroyed by the Jedi. During the Clone Wars
column5: the native Zygerrians resumed their slaving ways with the support of the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column6: but their queen was executed by Count Dooku after she attempted to seduce Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker."

Text: "Zygerria is a temperate world located in the Zygerria system of the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of varied terrain including plains
column4: forests
column5: and urban centers
column6: Zygerria is the homeworld of the Zygerrian species
column7: a feline-like humanoid race known throughout galactic history for their involvement in the slave trade.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column8: the Zygerrians built a vast Slave Empire that stretched across significant portions of the Outer Rim. This empire was based on the capture
column9: trade
column10: and exploitation of sentient beings
column11: with the Zygerrians viewing slavery as a fundamental aspect of their culture and economy. Their empire became one of the most powerful slaving operations in the known galaxy.\n\nThe Zygerrian Slave Empire eventually came into conflict with the Jedi Order
column12: who viewed the practice of slavery as an abomination. The Jedi launched a campaign against the Zygerrians
column13: ultimately destroying their slave empire and freeing countless beings who had been held in bondage. This defeat marked a turning point in Zygerrian history
column14: forcing them to abandon their openly slaving ways.\n\nFollowing the collapse of their empire
column15: Zygerria fell into decline. The planet remained inhabited by the Zygerrian species
column16: but their former glory and power faded. The Zygerrians harbored deep resentment toward the Jedi for destroying their empire
column17: and many dreamed of one day restoring their civilization to its former prominence.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column18: the Zygerrians saw an opportunity to resume their slaving operations. With the galaxy divided by conflict between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column19: the Zygerrians aligned themselves with the Separatists. Count Dooku and the Confederacy provided support for the Zygerrians to rebuild their slave empire
column20: viewing them as useful allies in the war effort.\n\nUnder the leadership of Queen Miraj Scintel
column21: the Zygerrians began conducting slaving operations throughout the Outer Rim. They captured colonists from the planet Kiros
column22: taking the entire Togruta population into slavery. This act drew the attention of the Jedi Order and the Republic.\n\nJedi Knights Anakin Skywalker
column23: Obi-Wan Kenobi
column24: and Ahsoka Tano traveled to Zygerria to rescue the enslaved Togrutas. The mission became complicated when Queen Scintel became attracted to Anakin Skywalker and attempted to seduce him. She believed she could turn him to her side and make him her personal slave.\n\nDuring the Jedi's mission on Zygerria
column25: tensions arose between Queen Scintel and Count Dooku. When Scintel's obsession with Skywalker interfered with Separatist plans
column26: Dooku Force-choked the queen
column27: ultimately killing her. The Jedi successfully freed the Togruta slaves and escaped from Zygerria
column28: dealing a blow to the Zygerrians' attempts to rebuild their slave empire.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column29: Zygerria came under Imperial authority. The Empire's policies toward slavery were complex
column30: as while the Empire officially condemned many forms of slavery
column31: it engaged in forced labor and exploitation of numerous species. The relationship between the Zygerrians and the Empire remains unclear from available records.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column32: Zygerria's status remained largely unknown. The planet's remote location in the Outer Rim meant it avoided major involvement in the conflict between the Empire and the Rebel Alliance.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column33: Zygerria's fate became uncertain. The New Republic worked to abolish slavery throughout the galaxy
column34: which would have put them in direct opposition to any continuation of Zygerrian slaving traditions. Whether the Zygerrians attempted to resume their practices or adapted to the changing galactic order remains unclear from available historical records."

Text: "Corulag is a populated terrestrial world in the Core Worlds. Originally a colony of Coruscant
column4: it was an early member of the Galactic Republic and produced many advanced technologies and luxury goods. During the Imperial Era
column5: it was home to the Corulag Imperial Military Academy
column6: training many of the finest minds the Imperial military had to offer. Following the death of the Emperor it lost much of its influence."

Text: "Corulag is a terrestrial world located in the Corulag system of the Core Worlds
column4: positioned along the Perlemian Trade Route. A planet of varied terrain including urban centers
column5: agricultural regions
column6: and manufacturing districts
column7: Corulag has served as an important commercial and military hub for thousands of years.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column8: Corulag was colonized by settlers from Coruscant and became one of the early members of the Galactic Republic. The planet's strategic location along the Perlemian Trade Route ensured steady economic growth and political influence within the Republic Senate.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column9: Corulag developed a reputation for producing luxury goods
column10: advanced technology
column11: and skilled professionals. The planet's economy thrived on manufacturing and trade
column12: with Corulag's products highly sought after throughout the Core Worlds. The planet maintained strong ties with Coruscant and other major Core Worlds throughout this period.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column13: Corulag remained loyal to the Galactic Republic
column14: contributing both resources and personnel to the war effort. The planet's factories increased production to support Republic military operations
column15: while many Corulag citizens served in the Grand Army of the Republic.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column16: Corulag embraced the new regime with enthusiasm. The Empire established the Corulag Academy
column17: one of the most prestigious military training institutions in the galaxy. The Academy became renowned for producing exceptional officers
column18: strategists
column19: and administrators who served throughout the Imperial military and government.\n\nThe Corulag Academy's curriculum emphasized discipline
column20: tactical thinking
column21: and unwavering loyalty to the Empire. Graduates of the Academy were highly sought after by Imperial command
column22: with many achieving prominent positions within the Imperial Navy
column23: Army
column24: and various governmental agencies. The Academy's reputation made it a symbol of Imperial excellence and martial prowess.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column25: Corulag remained firmly under Imperial control throughout most of the conflict. The planet's population largely supported the Empire
column26: viewing it as the legitimate successor to the Republic. The Corulag Academy continued producing officers for the Imperial war machine
column27: contributing significantly to the Empire's military strength.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column28: Corulag's status became uncertain. The planet had invested heavily in supporting the Empire
column29: and the sudden collapse of Imperial authority created economic and political challenges. Many graduates of the Corulag Academy found themselves serving various Imperial remnant factions as the Empire fragmented.\n\nThe New Republic eventually secured control of Corulag as part of their campaign to liberate the Core Worlds. However
column30: the transition proved difficult
column31: as much of the population retained loyalty to Imperial ideals and resented New Republic authority. The fate of the Corulag Academy remained uncertain under the new government
column32: with debates over whether to reform or close the institution."

Text: "The second planet of a weak red star in Wild Space
column4: Nirauan is a jungle world inhabited by two sentient avian species
column5: the Qom Jha and Qom Qae. It is also the headquarters of Grand Admiral Thrawn's Empire of the Hand
column6: operating from an ancient tower called the Hand of Thrawn."

Text: "Nirauan is a remote jungle world located deep within the Unknown Regions. The planet's surface is dominated by dense rainforests
column4: towering trees
column5: and humid conditions that support diverse flora and fauna. Despite its isolation and harsh environment
column6: Nirauan is home to two native sentient species: the Qom Jha and the Qom Qae
column7: both avian creatures adapted to life in the planet's forest canopy.\n\nFor most of galactic history
column8: Nirauan remained completely unknown to the major civilizations of the galaxy. Its location deep within the treacherous Unknown Regions
column9: where hyperspace navigation is extremely hazardous due to stellar anomalies and gravitational distortions
column10: kept it isolated from Republic exploration efforts. The planet existed in complete obscurity
column11: with only its native inhabitants aware of its existence.\n\nThe Qom Jha are intelligent avian creatures capable of limited speech and tool use
column12: dwelling in the planet's forests and developing a simple tribal society. The Qom Qae
column13: closely related to the Qom Jha
column14: maintain their own separate communities. Both species evolved to navigate the dense jungle canopy
column15: using their wings to travel between the massive trees that dominate Nirauan's landscape.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column16: an unknown civilization discovered Nirauan and constructed a massive fortress on the planet's surface. This structure
column17: later known as the Hand of Thrawn
column18: was built into a mountain face and featured technology far more advanced than anything the native Qom Jha and Qom Qae could comprehend. The builders' identity and their reasons for constructing such a facility on this remote world remain mysteries
column19: though the structure survived for millennia.\n\nThe Hand of Thrawn featured sophisticated cloaking technology that rendered it virtually invisible to sensors and visual detection. The fortress contained multiple levels with advanced computer systems
column20: automated defenses
column21: and extensive storage facilities. The native Qom Jha and Qom Qae avoided the fortress
column22: viewing it with superstitious fear and referring to it in their legends as a place of great power and danger.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column23: Nirauan remained undiscovered and uncharted. The planet's position deep within the Unknown Regions meant that even the most adventurous Republic explorers never reached it. The Qom Jha and Qom Qae continued their traditional way of life
column24: unaware of the vast galactic civilization that existed beyond their world.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars and the subsequent rise of the Galactic Empire
column25: Nirauan remained in complete isolation. Neither the Republic nor the Separatists
column26: and later neither the Empire nor the Rebel Alliance
column27: had any knowledge of the planet's existence. The ancient fortress stood silent and abandoned
column28: its original purpose lost to time.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column29: Nirauan continued its existence in isolation. The planet remained unknown to galactic civilization
column30: its jungles undisturbed by offworld visitors and its native species continuing their traditional way of life beneath the forest canopy. Nirauan stands as a testament to the vastness of the Unknown Regions and the countless mysteries that remained undiscovered in the unexplored reaches of space."

Text: "Corbos is a desert planet near the Yavin system. Though rich in ores
column4: it is uninhabited
column5: and typically avoided by colonists and miners
column6: due to massive thunderstorms that render large sections of the surface inhospitable. Thousands of years ago
column7: Corbos was the site of the final battle of the Hundred-Year Darkness
column8: a major conflict between the Jedi Order and Dark Jedi separatists. Though the Dark Jedi lost the battle and were exiled from the Republic
column9: they left bioengineered creatures known as Leviathans on the planet's surface
column10: which destroyed the periodic mining colonies brave enough to set up on Corbos."

Text: "Corbos is a remote desert world located in the Quelii sector of the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of harsh terrain dominated by rocky wastelands
column4: deep ravines
column5: and perpetual sandstorms
column6: Corbos is notable primarily for its rich mineral deposits and its dark historical significance in the annals of the Jedi Order.\n\nThe planet's surface features extreme conditions that make sustained habitation difficult. Massive electrical storms frequently sweep across the landscape
column7: creating dangerous conditions for any vessels attempting to land or conduct operations. Despite these hazards
column8: Corbos's substantial ore deposits have attracted periodic mining operations throughout its history
column9: though few such ventures have proven successful or long-lasting.\n\nApproximately seven thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Corbos became the site of one of the most significant conflicts in early Jedi history. The Hundred-Year Darkness
column11: a schism within the Jedi Order caused by philosophical disagreements about the use of the Force
column12: culminated in open warfare between orthodox Jedi and Dark Jedi who had embraced forbidden practices.\n\nThe Dark Jedi
column13: having been defeated in numerous engagements throughout known space
column14: made their final stand on Corbos. During the conflict
column15: these fallen Jedi employed Sith alchemy to create monstrous creatures known as Leviathans - massive beasts bioengineered through dark side corruption to serve as weapons of war. These creatures represented a perversion of the natural order
column16: twisted through malevolent Force manipulation into instruments of destruction.\n\nThe Battle of Corbos saw intense fighting between Jedi forces and the Dark Jedi defenders. Despite the Dark Jedi's deployment of their Leviathan creations
column17: the orthodox Jedi ultimately prevailed
column18: crushing the rebellion. However
column19: rather than executing the defeated Dark Jedi
column20: the Jedi Council chose exile
column21: banishing them to the Unknown Regions in the hope they would find redemption far from Republic space.\n\nThe exiled Dark Jedi would eventually discover the Sith species in the Unknown Regions and establish themselves as the rulers of what would become the Sith Empire
column22: setting in motion conflicts that would plague the galaxy for millennia. However
column23: Corbos itself was left with a different legacy - the Leviathans created during the battle remained on the planet's surface.\n\nThese creatures
column24: abandoned by their creators
column25: survived in Corbos's harsh environment and reproduced
column26: establishing a permanent population of dark side-corrupted beasts. The Leviathans proved extraordinarily resilient
column27: adapting to the planet's extreme conditions while retaining their aggressive nature and unnatural strength. Their presence transformed Corbos into one of the most dangerous worlds in the Outer Rim.\n\nFor thousands of years following the battle
column28: the Leviathans of Corbos remained a threat to anyone attempting to establish operations on the planet. Mining companies periodically attempted to exploit Corbos's mineral wealth
column29: establishing temporary colonies and extraction facilities. However
column30: these ventures invariably ended in disaster as Leviathans attacked the settlements
column31: killing workers and destroying equipment.\n\nThe creatures' hostility toward sentient life and their remarkable durability made them nearly impossible to eradicate. Even heavily armed security forces found Leviathans difficult to kill
column32: as the beasts possessed thick hides resistant to most weapons and demonstrated surprising intelligence in their attacks. Multiple mining operations reported total loss of personnel and equipment to Leviathan assaults.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column33: Corbos remained largely avoided by colonists and legitimate mining operations due to its reputation for danger. The planet appeared on navigational charts with warnings about the Leviathan population
column34: and most spacers gave the world a wide berth. Only the most desperate or foolhardy attempted to extract resources from Corbos
column35: and few survived to profit from such ventures.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column36: Corbos remained uninhabited and dangerous. Neither the Galactic Republic nor the Confederacy of Independent Systems showed interest in the remote
column37: hostile world. The planet continued its existence as a testament to the consequences of dark side corruption and the lasting impact of ancient conflicts.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column38: Corbos remained isolated and avoided. The Empire showed no interest in the dangerous world
column39: focusing its attention on more strategically valuable territories. The Leviathans continued to dominate the planet's surface
column40: ensuring that Corbos would remain one of the Outer Rim's most inhospitable and avoided worlds.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column41: Corbos's status remained unchanged. The planet stood as a reminder of the Hundred-Year Darkness and the dangers of dabbling in Sith alchemy
column42: with its population of corrupted creatures ensuring that the legacy of that ancient conflict continued to manifest in a very tangible and deadly form."

Text: "Thule is a dry
column4: arid world that has long been connected to the Dark Side of the Force. Originally a part of the empire of Xim the Despot
column5: Thule was colonised by ancient Sith who eventually drove many of its native life to extinction. For thousands of years
column6: it has remained isolated and relatively unknown to the galaxy at large. From the Sith Empires of the Old Republic Era
column7: to the Confederacy of Independent Systems
column8: to the Galactic Empire and Emperor Palpatine
column9: Thule has served as an isolated stronghold and resource world for Sith Lords. During the Clone Wars
column10: the Techno Union deployed soldiers to Thule to reconstruct and reactivate an ancient Sith superweapon
column11: the Dark Reaper. It was destroyed by Jedi Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi before it could be used. During the Imperial Era
column12: Emperor Palpatine erased knowledge of Thule of the planet from all databases
column13: historical accounts
column14: and navigational records."

Text: "Thule is a remote
column4: arid world located in the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of barren deserts
column5: rocky wastelands
column6: and ancient ruins
column7: Thule has been intrinsically connected to the dark side of the Force for thousands of years
column8: serving as a stronghold for various Sith powers throughout galactic history.\n\nApproximately 25
column9: 000 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Thule was part of the empire of Xim the Despot
column11: a legendary warlord who conquered vast territories in the Pre-Republic era. Following Xim's defeat at the Third Battle of Vontor
column12: his empire collapsed
column13: and Thule faded into obscurity for millennia.\n\nThousands of years later
column14: Thule was rediscovered by the ancient Sith Empire. Dark side practitioners recognized the planet's strong connection to the dark side and established it as a Sith stronghold. The Sith constructed temples
column15: fortresses
column16: and research facilities across Thule's surface
column17: conducting experiments in Sith alchemy and dark side rituals. Over centuries of Sith occupation
column18: much of Thule's native flora and fauna were driven to extinction
column19: either through environmental corruption caused by dark side energies or through deliberate Sith experimentation.\n\nThe Sith also constructed a superweapon on Thule known as the Dark Reaper. This ancient device was designed to harvest the life force of living beings and convert it into destructive dark side energy. The Dark Reaper represented one of the Sith's most ambitious attempts to weaponize the Force itself
column20: capable of draining entire populations to fuel its devastating attacks.\n\nFollowing the eventual collapse of the ancient Sith Empire
column21: Thule was abandoned and largely forgotten by galactic civilization. The planet's remote location and the stigma associated with Sith worlds ensured few ventured there. The Dark Reaper and other Sith artifacts remained buried beneath Thule's sands
column22: waiting to be rediscovered.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column23: the Confederacy of Independent Systems learned of Thule's existence and its Sith heritage. Count Dooku
column24: secretly the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus
column25: recognized the potential value of the ancient Sith technologies hidden on the planet. The Techno Union
column26: a major corporate supporter of the Separatist cause
column27: dispatched forces to Thule to excavate and reactivate the Dark Reaper.\n\nSeparatist engineers and scientists worked to restore the ancient superweapon
column28: believing it could turn the tide of the war against the Republic. However
column29: Republic Intelligence discovered the Separatist activities on Thule
column30: recognizing the threat posed by the Dark Reaper.\n\nThe Galactic Republic dispatched Jedi Knights Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi to Thule to investigate and prevent the Separatists from activating the superweapon. The mission proved successful
column31: with Skywalker and Kenobi destroying the Dark Reaper before it could be deployed against Republic forces. The destruction of this ancient Sith weapon eliminated one of the most dangerous threats the Separatists had attempted to unleash.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column32: Emperor Palpatine took extraordinary measures to conceal Thule's existence. Recognizing the planet's significance to Sith history and fearing that knowledge of it could lead rivals to discover other Sith secrets
column33: Palpatine ordered Thule completely erased from all Imperial databases
column34: historical archives
column35: and navigational records.\n\nThis systematic deletion extended beyond simple data removal. Imperial agents confiscated or destroyed any private records mentioning Thule
column36: altered historical texts that referenced the planet
column37: and eliminated individuals whose knowledge of Thule's location could not be suppressed through other means. Even within the Imperial hierarchy
column38: only the Emperor himself and perhaps a handful of his most trusted servants retained knowledge of Thule's existence and location.\n\nThe thoroughness of this erasure meant that Thule effectively disappeared from galactic consciousness. Navigators and explorers who might stumble upon the planet's coordinates would find no reference to it in any database. Historians researching ancient Sith sites would encounter gaps in records where Thule should have appeared. The planet became a ghost world
column39: known only through fragmentary legends and the Emperor's secret archives.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column40: Thule remained hidden and forgotten
column41: its dark side energies continuing to permeate the barren world while the galaxy fought over the Empire's future. Neither the Rebel Alliance nor most Imperial forces had any knowledge of the planet's existence
column42: exactly as Palpatine intended.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column43: Thule continued its existence in complete isolation. The planet's location died with Palpatine
column44: its ancient Sith ruins and dark side corruption standing as silent monuments to the long history of Sith power in the galaxy. Only through discovery of the Emperor's most secret archives might Thule's location ever be recovered
column45: making it one of the galaxy's most thoroughly hidden secrets."

Text: "The planet Ordo
column4: in the Ordo system of the Mandalore sector
column5: is the homeworld of the Mandalorian Clan Ordo
column6: whose ancient member Canderous Ordo became Mandalore the Preserver after the Mandalorian Wars. It is mostly a desert planet
column7: though its equator is ringed with some vegetation. Ordo is home to the Archaic Arsenal
column8: a museum which housed a number of Mandalorian weaponry and armour."

Text: "Ordo is a harsh desert world located in the Mandalore sector of the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of barren wastelands
column4: rocky terrain
column5: and minimal vegetation concentrated around its equatorial regions
column6: Ordo is the ancestral homeworld of Clan Ordo
column7: one of the most prominent and storied Mandalorian clans throughout galactic history.\n\nThe planet's inhospitable environment shaped the hardy nature of its inhabitants
column8: with Clan Ordo developing a reputation for producing some of Mandalore's finest warriors
column9: strategists
column10: and leaders. The clan's ancient fortress-cities
column11: built to withstand both the planet's harsh conditions and potential attacks
column12: stand as testaments to Mandalorian engineering and martial culture.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Ordo served as a key stronghold during the Mandalorian Wars. Canderous Ordo
column14: one of the clan's most celebrated members
column15: fought alongside Mandalore the Ultimate during the Neo-Crusaders' campaign of conquest across the Outer Rim. Following the Mandalorians' devastating defeat at Malachor V and the subsequent fragmentation of Mandalorian society
column16: Canderous spent years as a mercenary and soldier of fortune.\n\nApproximately four thousand years before the Empire's rise
column17: Canderous Ordo accompanied the amnesiac Revan during the Jedi Civil War
column18: eventually helping to defeat Darth Malak and save the Republic. Following these events
column19: Revan challenged Canderous to reunite the scattered Mandalorian clans and restore their warrior culture. Accepting this charge
column20: Canderous took up the mask of Mandalore
column21: becoming Mandalore the Preserver.\n\nAs Mandalore the Preserver
column22: Canderous worked tirelessly to rebuild Mandalorian society
column23: calling scattered warriors back to their homeworlds and reestablishing the traditional clan structures. His leadership marked a crucial turning point in Mandalorian history
column24: preventing the complete dissolution of their culture following their defeat in the Mandalorian Wars.\n\nOrdo is also home to the Archaic Arsenal
column25: an ancient museum and armory that houses some of the most significant artifacts in Mandalorian history. The Arsenal contains weapons
column26: armor
column27: and relics dating back thousands of years
column28: including pieces worn by legendary Mandalores and weapons used in pivotal battles. The facility serves both as a repository of Mandalorian heritage and as a reminder of their warrior traditions.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column29: Ordo remained a symbol of Mandalorian resilience and cultural continuity. While the Mandalorians no longer posed the existential threat they once did to the Republic
column30: Ordo continued producing skilled warriors who served as mercenaries and soldiers throughout the galaxy.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column31: Ordo's status remained complicated by the schism within Mandalorian society. The rise of the pacifist New Mandalorians under Duchess Satine Kryze created tensions with traditional warrior clans
column32: including Clan Ordo
column33: who viewed the rejection of martial culture as a betrayal of Mandalorian identity. However
column34: the planet remained under the nominal authority of the Mandalorian government.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column35: Ordo came under Imperial oversight as part of the Empire's control over the Mandalore sector. The Empire recognized the martial prowess of Mandalorian warriors and sought to exploit their skills
column36: though many traditionalist clans
column37: including Clan Ordo
column38: resented Imperial interference in Mandalorian affairs.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column39: Ordo remained under Imperial control
column40: though individual members of Clan Ordo took various positions regarding the conflict. Some served the Empire as mercenaries or soldiers
column41: while others sympathized with the Rebel Alliance's fight against tyranny. The planet's warrior culture meant that skilled fighters from Ordo could be found on multiple sides of the galactic conflict.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column42: Ordo quickly became part of the new Mandalorian government though its long-term fate remains uncertain as numberous factions covet the Mandalore sector. The planet continued to serve as the homeworld of Clan Ordo
column43: maintaining its traditions and producing warriors who would shape Mandalorian society in the post-Imperial era.\n\nThe Archaic Arsenal remained a vital cultural institution
column44: preserving Mandalorian heritage through the tumultuous changes that swept the galaxy. For members of Clan Ordo and Mandalorians throughout the sector
column45: the Arsenal represented continuity with their warrior past and hope for their future as a people."

Text: "Kalevala is the fourth planet in the Mandalore system
column4: and neighbour to the Mandalorian's homeworld of Mandalore. A toxic desert world
column5: Kalevala is the home of House Kryze
column6: and the birthplace of the late Duchess Satine Kryze
column7: former ruler of the Mandalorian Sector. The planet produces fine wines and rich textiles
column8: and Kalevala Spaceworks manufactures custom luxury spacecraft such as the Nau'ur-class yachts First Light
column9: owned by Dryden Vos
column10: and the Coronet
column11: used by Duchess Satine and her New Mandalorian Government."

Text: "Kalevala is a terrestrial world located in the Mandalore system of the Outer Rim Territories
column4: sharing its star with the legendary Mandalorian homeworld. A planet of harsh desert landscapes and toxic atmospheric conditions
column5: Kalevala has nevertheless maintained an important position in Mandalorian society for thousands of years.\n\nThe planet is most notably the ancestral seat of House Kryze
column6: one of the most prominent and influential Mandalorian houses throughout galactic history. The Kryze family maintained their traditional stronghold on Kalevala while wielding considerable political power across the Mandalore sector.\n\nDespite its inhospitable surface conditions
column7: Kalevala developed a sophisticated civilization centered around enclosed cities that protected inhabitants from the toxic atmosphere. The planet became renowned throughout the sector for producing luxury goods
column8: particularly fine wines and rich textiles that were highly sought after by wealthy patrons across the galaxy.\n\nKalevala is also home to Kalevala Spaceworks
column9: a prestigious starship manufacturer specializing in custom luxury spacecraft. The company's designs became synonymous with elegance and refinement
column10: with their vessels serving as status symbols for the galaxy's elite. Most notably
column11: Kalevala Spaceworks produced the Nau'ur-class yacht
column12: vessels that combined exceptional performance with luxurious appointments.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column13: Kalevala maintained its position within Mandalorian space while the warrior culture of Mandalore dominated the sector. The planet's focus on refinement and culture sometimes created tensions with more traditionalist Mandalorian clans who emphasized martial prowess above all else.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column14: Kalevala continued its role as a center of Mandalorian culture and commerce. House Kryze wielded significant influence within Mandalorian politics
column15: with family members frequently serving in leadership positions within the sector government.\n\nIn the decades before the Clone Wars
column16: Mandalorian society underwent profound changes as a pacifist movement gained strength. Duchess Satine Kryze of House Kryze
column17: born on Kalevala
column18: became the leader of the New Mandalorians
column19: a faction that rejected the traditional warrior culture and sought to transform Mandalorian society into a peaceful
column20: neutral power.\n\nDuchess Satine's reforms proved controversial
column21: creating deep divisions within Mandalorian society. Traditional warrior clans viewed the pacifist ideology as a betrayal of Mandalorian heritage
column22: while the New Mandalorians argued that their people's violent past had brought nothing but suffering and that a new path was necessary.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column23: Duchess Satine led the New Mandalorian government from Mandalore while maintaining close ties to Kalevala and House Kryze. She utilized a Kalevala Spaceworks vessel
column24: the Coronet
column25: as her personal transport and mobile command center. The luxury yacht served not only as transportation but also as a symbol of the New Mandalorians' commitment to refinement and diplomacy over militarism.\n\nThe Mandalore system
column26: including Kalevala
column27: attempted to maintain neutrality during the Clone Wars
column28: with Duchess Satine refusing to align with either the Galactic Republic or the Confederacy of Independent Systems. However
column29: the Death Watch
column30: a terrorist organization of traditional Mandalorian warriors
column31: actively opposed Satine's pacifist government and conducted attacks throughout the sector.\n\nApproximately 19 years before the rise of the Empire
column32: the rogue Sith Lord Darth Maul seized control of Mandalore through manipulation of Death Watch and other criminal elements. Maul's forces overthrew Duchess Satine's government
column33: and the Duchess herself was killed by Maul during his occupation of Mandalore. Her death marked the end of the New Mandalorian movement's dominance and the beginning of a darker era for the Mandalore sector.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column34: Kalevala came under Imperial oversight as part of the Empire's control over the Mandalore sector. The Empire recognized the strategic importance of maintaining influence over Mandalorian space
column35: though the fractured nature of Mandalorian society following Satine's death made complete Imperial control difficult to achieve.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column36: Kalevala remained under nominal Imperial control
column37: though various Mandalorian factions operated with varying degrees of independence. The planet's luxury goods industries continued operating
column38: now serving Imperial clients and wealthy Core Worlders who could afford Kalevala's prestigious products.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column39: Kalevala became a core world of the new Mandalorian government as Imperial control over the Mandalore sector weakened. Various Mandalorian factions competed for influence
column40: with the legacy of Duchess Satine and House Kryze remaining significant in debates about Mandalore's future direction and the nature of Mandalorian identity in the post-Imperial era."

Text: "Taris"
"blank"
"Taris is a polluted urban planet located in the Outer Rim. Although Taris is a heavily populated ecumenopolis
column4: much of the surface itself was polluted with wrecked starships and dense
column5: overgrown swamps. Makeshift tenements made of shipping containers and crashed starships stacked on top of one another
column6: while yellow smog drifted in the atmosphere. The elite of the planet dwelled in nicer skyscrapers."

Text: "blank"
"No information on this system."
"Morellia is an unremarkable
column4: near-lifeless world located in the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of barren
column5: rocky terrain and thin atmosphere
column6: Morellia has remained largely isolated from galactic affairs throughout its history due to its inhospitable conditions and lack of valuable resources.\n\nFor thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column7: Morellia was known only as a desolate waypoint occasionally noted by explorers and spacers traversing the Outer Rim. The planet's harsh environment discouraged settlement
column8: with only the hardiest colonists attempting to establish outposts on its surface. Most such efforts failed within years
column9: unable to sustain themselves in the unforgiving conditions.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column10: Morellia continued its existence in obscurity. The barren world remained one of countless forgotten planets scattered throughout the Outer Rim
column11: notable only for its complete unremarkability in a galaxy filled with more vibrant and strategically important worlds."

Text: "Anteevy is an icy world in the Mid Rim. Once conquered by Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders
column4: it eventually fell into Republic hands. Anteevy seceded during the Clone Wars
column5: but was later annexed by the Galactic Empire
column6: which created a factory to manufacture specially-modified AT-ATs that could withstand extreme cold."

Text: "Anteevy is a terrestrial world located in the Spadja sector of the Mid Rim Territories. A planet of harsh
column4: frozen terrain dominated by icy plains and brutal winter conditions
column5: Anteevy has remained largely isolated from major galactic events throughout most of its history.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column6: Anteevy was discovered during the early expansion of the Galactic Republic. However
column7: the planet's extreme cold and inhospitable environment discouraged extensive colonization
column8: with only small settlements established by hardy colonists willing to brave the perpetual winter.\n\nDuring the Mandalorian Wars
column9: approximately 3
column10: 976 years before the rise of the Empire
column11: Anteevy fell under the control of the Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders as they swept through the Mid Rim in their campaign of conquest. The Mandalorians occupied the planet for a time
column12: though its limited strategic value and harsh conditions meant they maintained only a modest presence.\n\nFollowing the defeat of the Mandalorians
column13: Anteevy was reclaimed by the Galactic Republic. The planet remained a quiet Republic member world for thousands of years
column14: contributing little to galactic affairs beyond serving as a waypoint for vessels traveling through the Mid Rim. The native population adapted to their frozen world
column15: developing technologies and survival techniques suited to the extreme cold.\n\nDuring the Clone Wars
column16: Anteevy seceded from the Republic to join the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The planet's motivations for joining the Separatists remain unclear
column17: though the Separatists may have recognized potential military applications for Anteevy's extreme environment. The world remained under Separatist control throughout much of the conflict.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: Anteevy was brought under Imperial authority. The Empire recognized the planet's unique environment as ideal for testing and developing specialized military equipment designed to operate in extreme cold conditions. Imperial engineers established facilities on Anteevy to develop cold-weather variants of standard military vehicles.\n\nMost notably
column19: the Empire constructed a factory on Anteevy dedicated to producing modified All Terrain Armored Transport walkers specifically designed to withstand the planet's brutal cold. These specialized AT-ATs featured enhanced insulation
column20: upgraded heating systems
column21: and reinforced components capable of functioning in temperatures that would disable standard models. The Anteevy facility became an important testing ground for Imperial cold-weather military technology.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column22: Anteevy remained under Imperial control. The planet's military production facilities continued operating
column23: supplying specialized equipment for Imperial forces deployed to ice worlds throughout the galaxy. The Empire maintained a garrison to protect the factories and ensure continued production.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the Emperor's death
column24: Anteevy's status became uncertain. The planet's specialized manufacturing capabilities made it valuable to factions seeking to expand military production capacity. The frigid world continued its existence as a center for cold-weather military technology development in the uncertain post-Imperial era."

Text: "Baros is a remote
column4: arid world in the Outer Rim. Although it was first discovered many thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column5: it did not attract attention until that government received reports of coded messages being transmitted from its surface. Its reptilian natives
column6: the Brubb
column7: had begun sending those messages after theorizing that other sapient life existed in the galaxy."

Text: "Baros is a remote desert world located in the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of arid landscapes
column4: rocky terrain
column5: and harsh conditions
column6: Baros remained largely unknown to galactic civilization for most of its history due to its isolation and lack of strategic value.\n\nThe planet is home to the Brubb
column7: a reptilian species characterized by their distinctive appearance and modest technological development. For thousands of years
column8: the Brubb lived in relative isolation on their desert homeworld
column9: developing their own culture and civilization without contact with the broader galaxy.\n\nThousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire
column10: Baros was briefly discovered during early Republic exploration efforts. However
column11: the planet's remote location and the Brubb's primitive technology meant it was catalogued but largely ignored. The Republic maintained no presence on Baros
column12: and the world faded from galactic consciousness.\n\nThe Brubb civilization gradually advanced over the millennia
column13: developing increasingly sophisticated technology while remaining unaware that they shared the galaxy with countless other sentient species. Their isolated development meant they progressed at their own pace
column14: shaped entirely by their desert environment and internal cultural evolution.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column15: Baros remained unknown to most galactic powers. The planet's position in the remote Outer Rim and the Brubb's lack of spacefaring capability meant no meaningful contact occurred between Baros and the Republic for thousands of years.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column16: Baros continued its existence in isolation. Neither the Galactic Republic nor the Confederacy of Independent Systems had any knowledge of the planet or its inhabitants
column17: and the Brubb remained unaware of the massive galactic conflict occurring beyond their world.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column18: Baros's status changed dramatically when Imperial scouts detected unusual transmissions emanating from the planet's surface. Investigation revealed that the Brubb had recently developed radio technology and
column19: theorizing that other intelligent life might exist in the galaxy
column20: had begun broadcasting messages into space.\n\nThese transmissions consisted of mathematical formulas
column21: scientific data
column22: and attempts at communication
column23: representing the Brubb's first effort to reach out beyond their world. The messages were encoded in ways the Brubb believed might be universally comprehensible to other intelligent species
column24: should any exist.\n\nImperial authorities recognized the significance of this discovery - a previously unknown sentient species attempting first contact. The Empire dispatched representatives to Baros to make official contact with the Brubb civilization. This first contact proved momentous for the Brubb
column25: who learned they were far from alone in a galaxy teeming with life.\n\nThe Brubb's reaction to discovering the galactic community remains poorly documented in available records. However
column26: the Empire's interest in Baros appeared primarily focused on assessing whether the planet held any strategic or economic value worth exploiting. Finding little of immediate use
column27: the Empire maintained only minimal oversight of the world.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column28: Baros remained largely peripheral to the conflict between the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. The planet's remote location and the Brubb's limited technological development meant it attracted minimal attention from either side. The Brubb themselves were likely still processing the implications of discovering they inhabited a galaxy filled with advanced spacefaring civilizations.\n\nAfter the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic
column29: Baros's status remained uncertain. The planet represented one of countless worlds in the Outer Rim where the collapse of Imperial authority created political vacuum. Whether the Brubb would seek membership in the New Republic
column30: attempt to maintain independence
column31: or face exploitation by various factions competing for influence in the post-Imperial era remained unclear."

Text: "Targonn is a world located in the outer edge of the galaxy. Home to the avian Targonnian species
column4: this mountainous planet was ruled by a ""Dictator-Forever"" until it was liberated by an opposition group."

Text: "Targonn is a terrestrial world located in the Outer Rim Territories. A planet of mountainous terrain and varied climates
column4: Targonn is the homeworld of the Targonnian species
column5: an avian humanoid race characterized by their distinctive features and insular culture.\n\nFor most of galactic history
column6: Targonn remained isolated from the broader galactic community. The planet's remote location and the Targonnians' preference for independence meant that little was recorded about their world in Republic archives. Unlike many species who sought membership in galactic governments
column7: the Targonnians maintained their sovereignty
column8: never joining the Galactic Republic or any other major power.\n\nThe Targonnian government was led by a hereditary ruler who held the title of ""Dictator-Forever
column9: a position passed down through a single family line for generations. This autocratic system concentrated power in the hands of one individual
column10: who governed with absolute authority over all aspects of Targonnian society. The Dictator-Forever ruled from the planetary capital
column11: maintaining strict control over both domestic affairs and any limited contact with offworld visitors.\n\nDuring the Old Republic era
column12: Targonn appeared on star charts but attracted minimal attention from explorers
column13: traders
column14: or Republic officials. The Targonnians showed little interest in galactic affairs and actively discouraged outsiders from settling on their world. This isolation suited both the ruling dynasty
column15: who feared external influences might threaten their authority
column16: and the general population
column17: who had developed a deeply insular culture over millennia.\n\nThroughout the Clone Wars
column18: Targonn maintained its traditional isolation
column19: refusing to align with either the Galactic Republic or the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The planet's lack of strategic resources or military significance meant neither side showed interest in forcing Targonn into the conflict. The Targonnians continued their existence under the Dictator-Forever's rule
column20: largely unaware of the massive galactic struggle occurring beyond their world.\n\nFollowing the rise of the Galactic Empire
column21: Targonn remained independent. The Empire showed minimal interest in the remote world
column22: recognizing that the resources required to subjugate and administer Targonn would exceed any potential benefit. The Dictator-Forever maintained power
column23: and the Targonnian population continued their traditional way of life without significant Imperial interference.\n\nDuring the Galactic Civil War
column24: Targonn remained neutral and isolated. Neither the Empire nor the Rebel Alliance established any presence on the planet
column25: and the Targonnians showed no inclination to involve themselves in the larger galactic conflict. The planet's mountainous terrain and lack of significant infrastructure made it unsuitable as a military base for either side.\n\nApproximately four years after the Battle of Endor
column26: the long rule of the Dictator-Forever came to an abrupt end. An opposition movement that had been organizing in secret launched a successful revolution
column27: overthrowing the hereditary dictatorship. The opposition forces
column28: led by Targonnians who had been exposed to democratic ideals from offworld
